Reviews.Title: “Westin is usually first class...not this time”
Reviews.Author: getteedoff
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston March 15-19 with my family for a conference. The Back Bay area was experiencing power failure due to transformer fires earlier in the week. This had an adverse effect on our experience in many ways. I knew beforehand about the issue and chose to keep my reservation at Westin Copley. Having called the hotel on Thursday AM I received assurance that the power had been restored and was no longer an issue. The hotel and conference hall lost power several times over the course of our 5 day stay. Though the hotel staff handled the matter as well as could be expected but I was surprised that a hotel like the Westin would not have measures in place to mitigate the issue. Most of it boiled down to minor inconveniences (Conference Hall going dark, I couldn’t print boarding passes in the business center on Sunday night, etc) but I don’t expect to have to deal with that at a Westin. To make matters worse my son was disappointed to find the pool closed for rennovation. I take no pleasure in writing a negative review of Westin Copley. (We stayed tyhere in 2011 and had a great time.) Generally I love Westin hotels and don’t mind paying a little more to stay there. That also means I have higher expectations when I do stay at a Westin. This time unfortunately, Westin Copley did not meet that expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: podunkjeep
Reviews.Content: A small but comfy room. Able to walk to nice Thai and Indian restaurants, not to mention the "attached" shopping center if you're into that sort of thing. Take a taxi from the airport, they were cheaper than the shuttles and fast.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: crzyrner
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times and always love it. It is very clean, the beds are very comfortable and the service is great. It is in perfect location in the city to go out a s site see! A.so it is attached to Copley plaza and the Prudential Center so there is lots of shopping and restaurants nearby without ever going outside!

Reviews.Title: “ANOTHER GREAT STAY”
Reviews.Author: heatheranne22
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay at the Westin Coopley Place within a few months. This stay was for 2 weeks. Once again there was outstanding service from front desk agent Masai. He went out of his way to make it a great stay finding the perfect room to make me comfortable for that length of time. He also personally greeted me every time I was in the lobby or just walking by. It might seem like a small thing but it made me feel welcome. I would also like to thank Winsome in housekeeping for the wonderfull and meticulous way she took care of the room. Her attention to detail was outstanding. I hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Family with kids”
Reviews.Author: ssfer
Reviews.Content: Our family decided to spend a few days in Boston over our kid's February vacation. The Westin is a superb location and had some family friendly amenities (indoor pool, breakfast and very quiet rooms), yet maintained the excitement of being the heart of Boston's Back Bay. We parked the car in the Copley place parking lot (not the hotel parking lot, but the parking garage attached to the mall) and left it there for the entire weekend. We walked everywhere except to the MFA (took a $13 cab). The hotel is attached to the Copley Place mall (which is attached to the Prudential shops), which has upscale shopping (Neiman Marcus, Louis Vuitton, Barney's) and eats. Prior to checking into the hotel, we spent the day at the Boston Museum of Science with the kids. After an easy check in, we grabbed pizza on Newbury St. at the Upper Crust and headed back the hotel for night swim. We were pleasantly surprised at how quiet the hotel room was during the night. A clean room with plenty of towels and we were given our requested room- two queen size beds. In room coffee with Starbucks was a good start to the morning. I did read the reviews about the snacks and minibar - the warnings are true, so don't touch them unless you plan on purchasing them. The concierge was helpful in guiding us to the MFA by either subway (Green Line T) or cab. We had Sunday brunch at the hotel to top off the weekend. Overall, a most accommodating, convenient and fulfilling stay.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly beds, need I say more”
Reviews.Author: beachtravelerrrr
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here a few times while on vacation and or business. I usually like to stay at Westin's because of their Heavenly beds which really do make a difference. Aside from that, this hotel is centrally located with plenty of sights to see within walking distance. If you feel the need to shop there is of course a giant mall attached to the hotel. Staff was pleasant, rooms were clean.

Reviews.Title: “Solid experience at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: MartinAdroguÃ©
Reviews.Content: I staid at the Westin for an event and had a great time there. It was all you can expect from a Westin: nice atmosphere, contemporary decor and good service. The rooms were huge and mine had a great view (23rd floor, overlooking the Charles and Cambridge). The bed was excellent as in any other Westin I've slept in. The bathroom was very spacious and confortable and everything was perfectly clean. The whole hotel feels new; there's a nice bar at the lobby level and the property is connected to a series of malls in the Copley Place areas, which is very convenient in the winter. Location is great, just steps from Boylston and Newbury streets. I'd definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “First time in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: First time in Boston, only one night for work. They kindly held my bag for me as I arrived in the city before check-in. I was very busy and didn't get back to my room until after midnight, but the bed was VERY comfortable. Staff was super niceâ€”I'm just out of college and not used to being called "miss" and "ma'am," but it was pretty nice! The best was that I could get up and make a cup of Starbucks coffee before my morning train back to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Kim A
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at the Westin Copley hotel in Boston. The staff made you feel comfortable from the start when they valet the car, took the luggage and showed you were to go to the front desk lobby area. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room itself was very clean and comfortable. I did eat at the Bar 10, which had great prices and drinks. Friendly staff throughout my whole experience staying at this hotel. The area is great with all the restaurants and shopping! I would recommend this hotel to my family, friends and fellow business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: Joe Y
Reviews.Content: After propsing to my then-girlfriend, we spent the night in Boston here. I had called the concierge to let him know it was a special night for her, and were upgraded to a river-view room with complimentary champagne and strawberries! It was a VERY nice experience. Unfortunately, there were some noisy folks next door at 3AM, but there's a chance of that anywhere. Overall, very impressed with my stay here and will look to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CaptainDanny
Reviews.Content: Great room, unbeatable location, price competitive (with Marriott and others nearby), and staff that cared. I had emailed the GM - didn't get a response, but his action spoke! Thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “My only impression of Boston so far”
Reviews.Author: Taipeiworldlywise
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for a three day long conference and other than the office at headquarters, this is the only place I was at for the duration of the meeting. For that reason, i can't really comment on the convenience of the location since i didn't see any sights or shopped while we were there. We did everything (meetings, breakfasts, lunches, banquet dinners, drinking, sleeping) at the hotel and it was great. Coming from Asia, there were a few things I now expect from hotels that I forgot is not standard practice in North America. There's no slippers, or toothpaste or hot water bottle, though they did have a one cup coffee maker that I made my tea with. But the Westin Copley had everything we needed. It was clean, the meeting facilities were very adequate and the food for the most part was delicious. The service was first rate and the bar had great drinks and we were there everynight. We had a river facing view so the view was fantastic. I took a picture of the view and posted it on facebook and a friend recognized right away that i was staying at the Westin in Boston. My company paid for the hotel so I can't comment on its value for the buck. It was Boston in February, I can't imagine it would be uber expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location , Great Service !”
Reviews.Author: iReport_News_
Reviews.Content: On recent trip to Boston we decided to stay at Westin Copely Place while exploring the city . The hotel was in a perfect location in the heart of downtown Boston ! Within walking distance to a number of historical landmarks including Funeiul Hall and Quincy Market ! we stayed on the 7th floor which provided a decent view of the city , the rooms were clean and the beds were very comfy but nothing special . The hotel employees were what made this trip amazing . They were the nicest people in the world and accommodated my son who Is scred of elevators. they walked with him up the stairs whevever we needed them to ! AMAZING ! AMZING ! I would return to this Westin !

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at the Copley!!”
Reviews.Author: Deborah P
Reviews.Content: We recently visited the city of Boston in search of potential colleges for our son and stayed at the Westin Copley. We were greatly impressed by the agents at the front desk; they made us feel welcome and genuinely appreciated our arrival. The room was spectacular; the city view was beautiful and waking up to the rising sun with Boston's skyline was great. The location was convenient to shops and restaurants and schools. The next time we are in Boston, we will definitely stay at the Copley and have highly recommended it to others. Thanks again for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “lovely contemporary decor, heavenly bed”
Reviews.Author: Debra L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night on a recent business trip. I'm already a big fan of Westins, but this one exceeded my experiences re the decor in the room itself - very chic contemporary and spacious. A contrast to other large chains in the US which tend towards daggy old decor that hurts my sensibilities! The staff were extremely helpful and courteous, and understood our accents and travel needs. I will be returning and hope to have the same excellent experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: champptg
Reviews.Content: We haved stayed at several hotels in Boston since our girls go to school in Boston. We now only stay at the Westin Copley because of the great rooms and service. The Jr. Suites are very large. Everytime we check into the hotel, the staff is very welcoming and helpful. If we ever have a problem, they correct it immediately. Since we usually arrive late in the evening from California, we are usually starving. We always order room service because the food is excellent and we get if very quickly. Our family also uses the health center and pool. The hotel is located perfectly for us since our girls go to different schools but they can get on the T and arrive at the hotel quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: TOTravelerEJ
Reviews.Content: Usually, I stay away from big-chain hotels preferring to book more "boutique" type ones but the Westin at Copley Place was a pleasant experience. It's a great location being connected to the shopping centre and near the train station as well. Not as cosy as a boutique property but a great looking hotel nonetheless. I would defnitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more”
Reviews.Author: Chatty3867
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation back in December for a stay in February. I was told at that time that there were no rooms available with two beds. I called 3 times to see if anyone cancelled a reservation so I could have two beds. They offered a roll away bed for a price then on top of it I was told if I have 3 people in the room we will charge you an additional 30.00 per day. Very poor customer service. The hotel is dark, old. The location is great. The parking is pricey at 46.00 per day, we parked across the street. The attached mall was great. The room was not as clean as I would have expected, bathroom had hair on floor and there was garbage that went unnoticed on the floor. The bathroom was really small. The only nice thing about this hotel was as we were on our way to the hotel the manager Daniel Fazzio, took care of the bed issue from HOME since he left for the day before we were able to finish communication. He deserves a raise as he showed exemplary customer service without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Never a bad moment at the Westin Copley!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole K
Reviews.Content: Every January I attend a conference in Boston, and now my first and only choice for a place to stay is the Westin Copley. The service is always friendly, pleasant, and very helpful.The rooms are comfortable, and the atmosphere from the lobby to the room to the pool area is relaxing, which is what I need at the end of a very busy conference day. The location is so convenient. It is within walking distance of shopping and plenty of restaurants to choose from. The only time I take transportation is when I jump on the shuttle to my conference.

Reviews.Title: “Conveniently located for a weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Bostonner
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley has very modern rooms, updated amenities, and a convenient location in the heart of Boston. Walking distance from many restaurants and stores, I saved on cab fares being able to walk everywhere I needed to go. Check for Starwood and AAA discounts as well. You can also park across the street at the Copley Mall and save a few dollars on parking (the hotel parking lot was sold out when I stayed there).

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: mozyAlong
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for it's location. The T stop (metro) is close by, restaurants, and shopping also. Speak to the Concierge, they were very helpful. We left the car in the garage and either walked or took the T to where we needed to go. This Westin aside from the location, was just okay. Parking - Limited space by the Valet (pictured) to leave your car while you check in. You can park $39/day at the copley parking garage, or download a coupon from boston.centralparking.com Restaurants walking distance - Sorellina, and Stephanie's on Newbury were great choices Also can go to the Top of the Hub for view and dessert ($14 min per person at table). Shopping - Newbury Street a must, and many shops in the Prudential Center Mall (all indoors). Fitness center - It was very busy, but still had plenty of treadmills to use.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: cgct
Reviews.Content: Really in a great part of town. Hotel itself is nothing special, rooms are nice but ordinary, nothing stands out. It is a little bit of a pain that the lobby is on the second floor but all in all a good place in a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services and wonderful stay at Westin Copley”
Reviews.Author: Lychee_Lo
Reviews.Content: Staying with Westin Copley is the best choice - it makes my first journey in Boston after the horrible long flight from Hong Kong wonderful, comfortable and warm (esp. in this winter time)seriously! It locates at the center of the city while everywhere is just a walking distance - make my life easier and convenient (no kidding). I will definitely tell my friends/ colleagues to stay with Westin Copley if they are planning to Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Robin R
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice now and you cannot beat its location. Parking is never a problem even for our SUV. The hotel staff is accommodating and friendly. The pool and workout room are great and offer a beautiful view of the city. We wouldn't hesitate to stay again for future visits to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve in Boston”
Reviews.Author: BostonSuburb
Reviews.Content: For the last three years, we have stayed with our family at The Westin Copley Place to celebrate First Night and ring in the New Year. Since the hotel is connected to Copley Place and The Pru, the walk to the First Night activities at the Hynes Auditorium is indoors, i.e., nice on cold winter nights in Boston. We are always impressed with the front desk staff at The Westin. They are accommodating and knowledgeable about local activities and restaurants. We requested rooms on the upper floors and the front desk staff was able to meet our request, i.e., even though the hotel was full. Since the hotel is located in the Back Bay, you are near the heart of many activities. In addition, the hotel is adjacent to Back Bay station on the commuter rail and Orange Line. The Copley Green Line station is only one block away. Based on this, you can easily travel by train outside of Back Bay to other parts of Boston. With two young boys (ages 7 and 9), the swimming pool is a treat. Please be forewarned that the pool is quite small for a hotel of this size; therefore, it may be crowded. Our room was an adequate size. I mention this because others have written that the rooms are small and this is not the case. North facing rooms on upper floors have great views of the Charles River and MIT. We did not eat at the hotel's restaurants because there are so many good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. You can find family friendly restaurants and others for quiet romantic dinners. The Westin's location is perfect for both leisure and business travel. We return often to this hotel for both types of travel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business class hotel, set apart by excellent, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Quenames
Reviews.Content: There is nothing particularly spectacular about this Westin, but it is more than merely serviceable. The food is good, the rooms perfectly adequate (very good beds), access to the indoor malls very easy, and the location commendable. For me, the very friendly staff set this hotel apart from many others in its class. From top to bottom I found them to be cheerful and ready to provide whatever help they could in an efficient and friendly way.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very comfortable room”
Reviews.Author: Jade97
Reviews.Content: Very very comfortable rooms as expected from the Westin. Room service food and service were excellent. Very convenient location close to tour operator desks, malls and even a supermarket. Overall service was a bit impersonal, but is not unexpected. Feels safe walking around in the surroundings at night.

Reviews.Title: “Not as strong as other Westins”
Reviews.Author: SoCALcanuck
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is great and the surrounding area/restaurants, etc. is nice. Had some water issues during my stay (no hot water in morning) and although there was apologies from the front desk and managers, that did affect my feelings about the hotel. The rooms are fairly recently updated, but still showed some wear and tear.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: NYCFrequent_traveler
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice looking hotel in an excellent location. Staff were attentive and friendly, room was very comfortable if a little bit on the small side. Was upgraded later to a junior suite which was still on the small side on my opinion but great view from a high floor. Wonderful location near transit, shopping etc. Lobby was inviting if a little on the small side. Bed very comfortable and nice bathroom. Would recommend if you get a good price on the room.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing weekend Get-A-way!”
Reviews.Author: Jessica M
Reviews.Content: Our stay was nothing less than CLASSY! The hotel is amazing, very clean and very personable and friendly staff! I booked through expedia and got a great rate, I was a little skeptical because some of the other reviews said that it was a timely check in process and so on... Totally not the case! We arrived about an hour early and within minutes was given our room key and permission to enter early! We had an amazing view, spacious room (corner rooms are def the way to go). From our king size amazingly heavenly bed we got fantastic views of the heart of boston. The prudential center was right out our window! We were celebrating my husband's 30th and it was a great choice! Very busy but still very relaxing, just as I would describe Boston! The hotel's restaurant's were pretty exspensive and a little to over the top so we took a stroll through the skywalks which are connected from the hotel all the way to a few blocks away! We ate breakfast and lunch at The Cheesecake Factory at the Prudential and it was delicious. There is so many nearby attractions and very conveinant shopping, even Shaws was step's away! This was great, I didnt have to buy 4.00 waters... I just went and grabbed a few 1.00 waters at Shaws! I love the night scene! All in All it was an amazing stay, amazing room, amazing service, and very fun! We can't wait to go back! So worth it! Thank You Westin Copley for making my husbands 30th Birthday getaway so special! P.s the heavenly shower and bed are both so very heavenly especially waking up to the scenery we did, totally felt like a mini pent house! <3

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: elirnerak
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at four different hotels in the Copley Square vicinity, and this was my favorite. When we pulled up in our car, the doorman suggested that, due to construction in their parking lot, we self-park in the Prudential center. This was a bit of a daunting task, at first, because I was not sure where to go and how to get back to the hotel from the Prudential Center, a block away, but attached through a shopping mall. Better signage in the shopping mall, directing weary travelers back to the hotel would have been a big plus. But, overnight parking in the Prudential Center is $29, as opposed to $46 in the hotel, not a bad bargain if you have only light luggage to deal with. Our room was spacious and lovely, with a beautiful view of the city. It was comfortable and extremely pleasant. There are plenty of electrical outlets (always appreciated.) The only annoyance was a "snack center" on the dresser, complete with $8 canned Pringles and a printed warning that if you accidentally move the merchandise, it will be recorded by a sensor and you will be billed for the price of the item, whether or not you consume it. Really, have we not moved past this tacky stage of hotel management? The location is excellent. There is a T stop a block away, for transport to other areas of the city, and there are wonderful restaurants within walking distance. The connected upscale shopping mall has a Starbucks, within a few feet of the hotel exit.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Copley Lives up to Expectations”
Reviews.Author: AnotherGl0beTr0tter
Reviews.Content: The Westin Coply Place in Boston was a pleasure to stay at. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, the hotel was clean and the rooms the usual comfortable ones I've come to expect from the Westin. My wife and I requested a room upgrade and got one with a spectacular view of the river on the 32nd floor....it really added to the stay, and I would not hesitate to recommend the Westin to anyone traveling to Boston. The one copmlaint I have, and it's not really against the hotel itself, is that there is no self-parking at the hotel (only valet) and so if you want to save the $10 to self-park, you have to park at Copley Place - and I found parking quite expensive ($35 for 24 hours self-park). Having said that though, Copley Place is connected to the Westin and isn't exactly a hike, though it might force you to spend more money as you walk by some pretty nice stores! Also, I got a great deal staying at the Westin by using the "mystery" deal on Hotwire, so that was a bonus :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Donna L
Reviews.Content: On a recent business trip to Boston I stayed at the Westin, Copley, and had a wonderful stay. I was most impressed by the extremely courteous and genuinely careing staff. It was so nice not only to have a great room with a nice view but it was especially nice to see the staff always with a smile and nice words to say. I will certainly look forward to my next stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Donald H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Copley while I attended a conference for the weekend. The staff were extremely friendly and knowledgeable. The room was spacious and comfortable. We loved the lobby with it's fireplace and cozy seating in front. The dining was great with many fabulous restaraunts of all types either in the hotel or a short indoor walk through the mall. The location of the hotel to the mall was terrific. A short walk takes you to great shopping. The neighborhood is awsome. A short walk to fashionable Newbury St. great restaraunts and sightseeing. Copley Sq. is the perfect location to stay to enjoy the history and flavor of Boston. We will defenitely be staying here while we bring our daughters up to Boston to check out colleges next year, and will be planning a return trip soon to enjoy the great city of Boston

Reviews.Title: “What a view”
Reviews.Author: j-wish
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice now. First time with a regular room on 17th floor overlooking the river, so nice, it was June, great location, close to miles of indoor walking malls/shops. Boston has Starbucks everywhere. river and boston harbour area Just finished a 7 day stay on Friday, upgraded to a larger corner room on 29th floor, corner room overlooking, had 180 degree view of the city, beds were wonderful, "heavenly bed" ahh. plenty of places to find to eat, close by and in the hotel. great place to walk, have to say i did not like the taxis, always seemed expensive, grumpy drivers, underground tunnels left me thinking they were hiking up the fare taking longer routes on purpose, walking was always fun, brisk area, beautiful skies. Westin Copely staff always friendly and helpful. We will stay here whenever in Boston

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Roger A
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at the Westin, Copley. We travel to Boston often and this is our choice location and hotel. It is near shopping, dining and attractions. You can walk to Fenway. It is also close to Newbury street and Tremont street for great dining. The beds are excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: onedude
Reviews.Content: Service, food and beverage leave a lot to be desired. A $60 charge to receive a package at the business center. A breakfast restaurant where I had to almost trip the waiter to get coffee. $8 for soup that frankly tasted worse than what you would get in a can. Wifi constantly crashes. Guest folio still wrong 24 hours after checking out. Noise travels, you can hear doors slamming on rooms. Front desk just shrug and smile inanely, smug in the fact that there are few other options. Currently on the Platinum challenge with Starwood; after this stay reconsidering whether its worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hard product, some improvements to be made”
Reviews.Author: AndrewW2
Reviews.Content: This is my preferred hotel in Boston for business trips: 1) Large, beautiful and new rooms 2) Very good gym - even recently renovated too 3) Fantastic beds So, the 'hard product' is great but I still feel after all these stays, there is a lot to be improved on the front desk. There is ALWAYS a queue at reception. Maybe I am just unlucky, but there is always a queue and despite lots of people standing around at the bell hop area or concierge (doing nothing) no one takes the initiative to call for back-up. There always seems to be a problem customer and then things back-up. Only one side of the reception is ever open. Please fix this! The rooms are fantastic at this hotel, TV's are beautiful and selection of programmes is also great. I'll definitely stay here again, but please improve the service!!! PS - General Manager, please stop leaving SPAM promotional messages via the voicemail - that is super annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Upgraded, from a D to a C”
Reviews.Author: Big_Foof
Reviews.Content: A colleague booked us here and I only realized it too late to change. I've got to pay more attention to travel arrangements! Anyway, I ended up with a better room this time because the last time they also screwed up my Starwood points. Still, the bathroom sink faucet was not properly secured. Shouldn't the cleaning staff notice that the faucet moves freely when they clean it (if they clean it?) and tell maintenance? The absence of materials in the room about Boston and the surrounding area continues to dumbfound me. However, the room was otherwise nice and comfortable. I find the hallways dark, and being in the far corner of the triangular floorplan (as my colleague was) is kind of creepy. While the location is decent, bear in mind that you are in the middle of a very, very busy traffic triangle if you plan on walking around. Other hotels in the area do not have that problem. For me, this place just not deliver value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful presentation, atmosphere, accomodation & location”
Reviews.Author: David S
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler, I have stayed at The Westin Copley Place on several occasions, both for business and pleasure, and without excpetion my experiences have always been outstanding. It's the first place I think of whenever I am stayng in Boston and want a first class experience. The presentation of the hotel is always exemplary, very neat, tidy, and welcoming. The staff are always extremely professional and exceptionally attentive, and the rooms are always extremely clean, bright, and welcoming. Nothing is too much trouble, and every expressed need is quickly met. With great restaurants and shopping on site the Westin is able to provide for every need, and in addition, its location is wonderful. It is easy to get to and perfectly located for those who wish to take in all the great City has to offer. A true home away from home. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jim90068
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed for 3 nights before Christmas. This time we were upgraded to a river view, the first time for us , and on a high floor. It was great. We had flown in from California and typically sleep in when we start a holiday trip. Housekeeping was flexible and just asked us to let them know when we wanted service. Thngs were quiet, the bed very comfortable and the room design very nice. This is a great example of a well run Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Westin in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: InNYfromGA
Reviews.Content: Probably one of my favorite aspects of Copley Place is that you can walk forever without ever having to bear the brunt of Boston's sometimes unforgiving weather. I stayed at The Westin Copley Place while one of my co-workers stayed at The Marriott Copley Place. A covered walkway/indoor mall connects Westin, Marriott, Copley Place and Prudential Center. You feasibly could spend your entire stay indoors. Kind of cool. Copley Place and The Prudential Center are indoor shopping centers/restaurants. The Westin is massive. I think there were 20+ stories of rooms. I was on the 19th floor and had a beautiful view of the river/downtown. I was upgraded to a King plus sleeper sofa. The room had plenty of room and could have comfortably accomodated 4 people. The room itself was of typical Westin standards (which is a great thing). I haven't had much from Westin that I didn't like. I don't think this hotel has a club lounge. The wi-fi (free for platinum SPG members) was fine. Taxi from Logan (BOS) was about $30 during PM rush hour. The location and proximity to other attractions is clearly the big draw for this hotel. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Guest Rooms Need An Update”
Reviews.Author: LinGal2001
Reviews.Content: For the price of the room I think there are better choices in the same area I was staying. The room I stayed in was showing signs of wear and tear. My average rating was made stronger by staff. They are well trained, responsive and friendly. The common areas of the hotel were nice. It is a great location connected to a couple of malls and close to Newberry Street if you like high-end window shopping. The bed was comfortable, the view was nice it just lacked the luxury feel for what I thought was a luxury room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond helpful!”
Reviews.Author: Bob K
Reviews.Content: I frequently stay at the Westin Copley flirting with the new W and the Four Seasons. Usually though I default back to the Westin since the rooms are a bit bigger, the Starbucks is literally right next to the lobby, and the terrific Equinox gym is across the street. While it is my default, I neither look forward to my stays there nor dread them like I do some SPG hotels (like W New York). Last night, the Westin Copley amazed me and converted me from frequent guest to loyalist. In a rush back from a dinner meeting, carrying a stack of papers, and talking on a conference call I jumped out of a taxi and left my wallet on the seat. Having no idea which taxi company it was, without a receipt, and late at night I asked the valet if he had any idea of the name of the taxi company. Rather then shrugging, he said let me go check the cameras and see if we can find the taxi number. After a hour, Sarim Son's security team and the valet person, tracked down the taxi numbber and phone number of the taxi company. Miraculously, we were able to reach the taxi driver who found the wallet and returned it to the hotel. These extraordinary effort and resourcefulness made the next two days and 4 flights far easier -- with ID and credit cards -- and made me tremendously appreciative for the willingness, kindness, and intelligence of the Westin staff to go out of their way to help distracted guest. The Westin Copley even remembered to slip a WSJ under my door as I requested before I left today. This is a wonderful team who have convinced me that this is the best place to stay in Boston. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Another Christmas trip”
Reviews.Author: goodjudge
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here regularly on visits to Boston over Christmas. The hotel is still our pick in Boston, really central to the best mall, Copley Square and great bars and restaurants. The room we got was an upgrade (thanks to a little used Starwood loyalty membership) and had great views of the Charles River. At $170 inc taxes no argument on value either.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely pleased, great location”
Reviews.Author: spectra21
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel for a business stay. Rooms were clean, and typically modern. The best feature is the incredibly convenient location - you simply take an escalator down from the lobby and you are right in front of Copley Square, in view of the T station, and steps away from Newbury Street, Boylston St, shopping, restaurants, etc. Concierge and check-in was helpful. I felt the very nice guest experience and location here provided an edge over the nearby Boston Copley Marriott. This hotel being attached to indoor shopping is also a great feature; you never have to step outdoors to reach the shops of Copley Mall and Prudential Tower (if you know how to navigate the walkways!). If money is not an issue, I would choose this hotel easily again as the brand-name option in this neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Mari858
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped into the hotel, everything was just perfectly handled. We stayed there in December 2011 for our anniversary and were impressed with the courteous and kind attention of the staff. We came in on a red eye and needed some rest so the front desk handled the situation expediently so we could get some shut eye time immediately. The rooms were very clean and relaxing. We look forward to going there again!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel and good location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa2319
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Westin Copley Place on the weekend of January 21-22nd 2012 I've arrived in a snowy day and was looking forward to getting to my room. The check in was quick and very polite and also when requesting a late check out for the following day (Sunday) they were very nice about accomodating me. Also when making my reservation I've requested certain details about my room and they were completely satisfied. As this hotel is located in Copley Place is very convenient to get to a variety of restaurants, shows & convenience stores. I thought that the price was very good and completely adequate to the quality to the service provided

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: sclife
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, very nice rooms, good service, amazing location - what more does a business traveller want?! I was there during Christmas time and the decorations were a delight. Not to mention that the Copley shopping mall was connected to the hotel - so I escaped the cold! Decent facilities in the hotel and good view of Boston too. Would love to go back sometime.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, grat rooms.”
Reviews.Author: tookie624
Reviews.Content: I really liked the Westin. I usually stay at the Colanade when in Boston, but the prices there seem to keep going up. Instead we stayed down the street at the Westin. Everyone was unbelievably pleasant. The rooms were modern spacious and clean. We had a corner room with a great view even though it was on a low floor. The only negative about the room is that the toilet is very low to the ground.This could be an issue for older guests or those that have back and knee problems. also the bath tub has no railings and the tub bottom can be pretty slippery. The restaurant and bar were excellent if a bit pricey. My only complaints that there didn't seem to be enough valets, causing some lengthy wait for your car. However, the valets themselves were some of the nicest I have ever encountered. They were always friendly even in -8 wind hills. All in all I would definitely stay at the Westin again. It was a great place with great people.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel except for a couple of things”
Reviews.Author: SFTripper
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Christmas 2010 and 2011 and would definitely stay again. The rooms were big, very clean and had great views and, of course, the beds are super comfy. All the staff members we dealt with were extremely helpful and friendly. I just wish the bathroom lighting wasn't so dim. When you book into this hotel factor into the nightly rate a $46 charge per day for valet parking. There may be other, less expensive garages nearby or maybe even street parking on a holiday weekend, but we didn't check it out. We were also disappointed that when we decided to stay an extra night we weren't able to get the same great rate but had to pay $56 more for the same room. The explanation was that weekday rates are higher which seemed like faulty logic since the extra night we stayed was a holiday night (Monday, Dec 26th). And added to that disappointment was the fact that when we returned to our room that night at 7pm, it hadn't been made up yet - seems to have been some miscommunication with housekeeping - so we had to wait about 45 minutes for the room to be done. Not the end of the world I know, but we were tired and really looking forward to a nap before dinner. But as I said, we'd definitely stay here again but might look into other parking alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: katensteve
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel in Copley Place - which is a good location in easy walking distance of a ton of eateries and bars. Short cab ride to Boston College (on-site valet as well, which is nice.) Rooms were also nice, very clean and quiet (we requested a high floor, which I recommend for a nice view of the area.) We got in pretty late but check-in was a breeze. The one sour spot on our stay here was that we had breakfast in their restaurant which was very busy and as such, service was incredibly slow. One other silly item - I booked my room and then called to extend our stay and they made me book two different stays (without guarantee of it being the same room - though they were able to do this at check-in - which was a hassle) That was a bit annoying - so best to know your dates from the get go when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jannaweber
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on New Year's Eve. Even though we are local to Boston we wanted to have a nice hotel room to crash in downtown instead of trying to find our way home after midnight. We asked for a high floor and the view was beautiful. The room was large and quite and very comfortable. The line was very long when we were checking in but it moved very quickly and Emily who checked us in was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the best location!”
Reviews.Author: TJS525
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Westin at Coply to celebrate the New Years and more importantly to celebrate our wedding. When we checked into the hotel, we were greeted by a very courteous staff that took care of our luggage and immediately sent a bottle of champagne to our room to congratulate us on our marriage. The room was very nice and the view of Boston was spectacular! The staff was quick to help us in any way they could to make our stay pleasurable and I was really impressed by the expedient service, especially since it was a very busy weekend with New Years Eve. The location of the Westin could not be better. It is within walking distance to many great restaurants, shopping, and sites. I looked at a lot of hotels before booking the Westin at Coply and I'm glad I made the right choice. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: JMUstu01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Westin for a business trip. It is close to many great restaurants and many businesses as well. The rooms were nice, quiet and comfortable. I'd recommend asking for no adjoining room...that was my only complaint the one night there was a guest next door. There is a nice spot for breakfast in the hotel. Same for dinner and drinks. It is also attached to a mall, Copley Place which has many more restaurants and shops. For the winter, this is also nice as Copley Place connects you to other hotels, buildings and businesses so you don't have to venture into the cold. I will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Calm place to stay in the middle of a lively part of Boston”
Reviews.Author: phillydaisy
Reviews.Content: The location is great - right off Copley Square which is gorgeous and connected to Copley Place and Prudential Center shopping with lots of shopping (including super upscale and nice but more moderately priced) and dining. Close to tons of attractions in Boston. I've stayed here a few times and in general I really like the hotel. There is also a Sheraton and Marriott connected to the Copley/Prudential complex. They are both nice but the lobby's are very, very loud and busy. I've really enjoyed coming into the quiet calm lobby after either sightseeing or being busy at a conference. The rooms are nice and have been renovated recently. There is room service, but it's even nicer that they are close to lots of restaurants and takeout options. The negatives. It will always be annoying to pay for internet. Wired is cheaper than wireless but is not free. There is a restaurant Turner Fisheries that is right near the lobby and I think might be part of the hotel, and I really don't like the smell. It's not exactly fishy, and some people might enjoy the smell, but it really turns me off. I have stayed here a couple of times before, and during this stay we have a corner room which is a nice size and has a lot of windows, but no way to fully close the drapes on the windows. I hate that. There are shades that you can pull down but they don't block all the light, and this morning I was unable to do work at the desk because of the glare. I don't think this is a problem in all the rooms because I'm pretty sure I would have remembered it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: RDRca
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel to stay and is in the center of Boston. The staff were proactive in offering help and went beyond what would be expected. The room was spacious, had a great layout, and was well-appointed. I would definately stay again when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: JMDB
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin Copley Place for 6 nights in July 2011. Having the directional sense of an under nourished gnat, I was initially confused by arrival at Level 1 and Check In at Level 2 but I got with the programme eventually! As we both have bad backs we appreciated the comfortable sleep the suuportive bed afforded us during our stay. The bedroom was was a good size and well furnished but we both thought the bathroom was too small for comfort. As we were on the 32nd or 33rd floor we enjoyed panormic views of the city and the summer sunsets. We ate out every night except one (easy to do given the location of the hotel) and on that night we only ate a snack in Bar 10 as the humidity had effected our appetites. The snack food was good though and delivered quickly and pleasantly. The only serious quibble we had with the hotel was that the bottled water in the room's fridge was vastly over priced and led us to buy bigger bottles for loss money in the CVS across the square.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: Leftmid9
Reviews.Content: Very nice Westin, up to the usual standards. The only negative was the bathroom which was on the small side but on the positive, great water pressure in the shower even on a very high floor. Connected to a nice upscale mall and only a couple blocks from premier shopping on Newbury Street. Would return. Also, if you want to save a few bucks, there is parking for the mall about 200 feet past the Westin entrance. We saved $17 over two nights for the very short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious bedding. Gorgeous view. Up to date room. Great location.”
Reviews.Author: njcronk
Reviews.Content: We normally look for a bargain on vacation, so I am not used to staying at places this luxurious. I went with my husband to his conference, and so glad I did. The hotel is in a beautiful upscale part of Boston, but within walking distance of many historic areas. I did all the touristy stuff I could think of, from Duck Tours, to walking tours, to double decker bus tours, while there. It was a blast, and every kind of tour was a tad different. The parks in Boston are beautiful, and filled with interesting, friendly people. The hotel is close to many restaurants, parks, tour pick-up and drop-off, the farmers market, etc. If the weather is bad, every imaginable business is in the attached conference center, from Starbucks to Japanese food, to clothing and jewelry stores. The hotel is not near the water, which I was okay with. I fell head over heels in love with the city on this trip. Everything was close to the hotel (within half a mile) that I could possibly think of doing, with the exception of the JFK Library, which was worth taking the train and a bus to get to. While in Boston, I highly recommend seeing the nation's first municipal public library (more like a museum) that is just right across the street -- a breathtaking building! I also recommend taking a taxi to the Italian neighborhood. It was very romantic and quaint, and the food was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful escape”
Reviews.Author: l_l_sx
Reviews.Content: Westin Copley was a great experience. Valet/baggage handlers personable and helpful, front desk staff upgraded my wife and I to a junior suite @ check in, and location - hooked into Copley Place and steps to Newbury Street/Back Bay/ Boston Common can not be beat. Currently upgrading fitness facilities, which will be a good addition to a strong property that delivers good value.

Reviews.Title: “Geat escape!”
Reviews.Author: James B
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel... will be back! Renato and the staff went out of there way to take care of us. Great vibe.... LOVED our room!!!

Reviews.Title: “spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: sheilaandjj
Reviews.Content: we stayed int his hotel at the end of november..our room was number 3419 and what a beautiful room it was.the views over the charles river were amazing.the reception staff were a little cold but that was probably because they were so busy. this hotel is very close to back bay train station and was ideal for us as we were travelling on the acela express amtrak to new york.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: audilim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so centrally located that everything is, literally, within walking distance! The hotel itself is attached to Copley Place Mall which is then attached to the Prudential Center. Having stayed here most recently a few weeks ago, this not only made it easy to get around during the colder weather, it facilitated my holiday shopping! It's also just a couple of blocks walk away from Newbury Street, which is a must-see for all new visitors to Boston. Also a short walk away is Chinatown and the Boston Common. For someone who enjoys walking as much as I do, it's also possible to walk all the way to the North End and Faneuil Hall. If you're not a walker, Copley Place T-station is located just outside the hotel. The hotel room itself was spacious and very clean, the beds were comfortable and the view was fantastic! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, service, location”
Reviews.Author: 1Trave
Reviews.Content: The service, cleanliness, and modern rooms make this a great choice with an unbeatable location. The rooms are clean and have a good air quality, which next to noise are the most important aspects for me. The noise level is also minimal. Great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Boston getaway!”
Reviews.Author: BetsyD
Reviews.Content: We chose the Westin Copley Place due to its proximity to Symphony Hall and the reputation of their "heavenly beds" and were not disappointed. On checking in we were upgraded to a junior suite (it was my husband's birthday) that not only had a great view, but of course the fabulous bed and linens that we had remembered from a past stay. Being Christmas week, we were so happy to be within walking distance wonderful shopping (no coat needed since the hotel is connected to the Prudential Shopping Center) by enclosed walkways, and a very short cab ride to Symphony Hall and the Boston Museum of Fine Arts. We have stayed at a number of hotels in the Copley Square area, and the Westin is by far the best!

Reviews.Title: “great staff, comfortable room, fun location”
Reviews.Author: TNgalcookeville_TN
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for six night at the Westin Copley Place and it was a great experience. The staff were exceedingly pleasant, very helpful, and very knowledgeable. Enjoyed a very clean room with a comfortable bed. The workout facility, usually a great plus, was under construction but a perfectly adequate workout rooom had been set up and arrangements made for free use of full service workout facility nearby. The hotel is located near public transportation and in the heart of this wonderful city. Connected by enclosed walkways to great shopping. Very happy with this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: tgibbo
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Copley Place while on business in Boston. I work out regularly and their fitness center was under renovation. I woke up at 5:30 AM to go to the fitness center that they told us to use. Unfortunately, the doors were locked and I could not get to the other hotel from inside the hotel. I told the night manager about my problem. He proceeded to get me a taxi ... he took me to the concierge desk, spoke to the taxi driver and made sure that I was able to get back to the Westin Coply. I was surprised and gratified that he took the extra time to make sure that I had access to the other fitness center. He went above and beyond what I expected. The door man that meets and greets guests as they drop their cars is great ... he remembered me from previous stays and really made me feel welcome. I travel a lot on business and usually stay at another major hotel chain ... however I have never seen the great custormer service that I received at the Westin Copley Place. They really do a super job. I would recommend this hotel to anyone ... they are the best!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Evelyn C
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed another stay at the Westin Copley Place, great location. The only complaint we have ever had here is the size of the bathrooms, which are always small. Sorry also to hear the Palm is moving to another location, but the hotel continues to remain our choice for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - first class”
Reviews.Author: 2BW2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel 4 or 5 times now for business travel and plan to again in a few weeks. Always very convenient and great service. Clean, modern rooms. Have been upgraded to a jr suite a few times as well with a great view. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Bill M
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley is perfectly situated in the Back Bay, convenient to businesses, shopping, and transportation. The service in this hotel is outstanding, from the time you check in through checking out. I truly felt like the staff cared about my experience, even a short business trip - the rooms are wonderful and the beds are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Always consistently the best!”
Reviews.Author: Susan D
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley is where we stay - period! Best location, best service, beautiful and clean rooms! This is a winner in the Boston area!

Reviews.Title: “First class hotel”
Reviews.Author: LetsGo48837
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 5 days because of a business meeting at the convention center and what a great choice (there were other hotel options available). Check-in was smooth and efficient. The room was top notch--nice, new furniture, the expected comfy Westin bed and linens, a great place to sit and put your feet up, large desk, plenty of electrical outlets, super fast Internet, easy temperature control, spacious bathroom, and a TV with a working remote (not always a "given" in some hotels). Every time I walked into the room I thought, "Wow, this is a nice room." Housekeeping kept the room spotless. Every staff member that I spoke with in the hotel was cheerful, courteous and accommodating; it's nice when you feel like they are happy you are there. Coffee shop off main lobby was my first stop every day and I always appreciate this convenience. Had dinner in the bar one night and service was great and food outstanding. Concierge people were pleasant and helpful. All in all, one of the nicest "business" stays I've had. Would return and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: gill04236
Reviews.Content: We spent Dec. 17th at the Westin and I can honestly say I have never had a better hotel stay. And I have never had better service then I received from Cristina at the reception desk. When she found out we were there to celebrate some wonderful health news, she went out of her way to ensure that our stay went above and beyond our expectations. That is something I won't forget - this will be our hotel of choice in Boston from now on.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Kathy311
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at the Westin Copley Place and it could not have been more wonderful. From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty. The person at the front desk was very nice and accomodating and upgraded our room to a beautiful jr. suite with gorgeous views. We ended up having to stay an extra night because of damage from the October Nor'easter in our hometown. The staff, especially Brian from reservations, was extremely helpful going above and beyond in order to make this possible and at the lowest rate possible. Overall, we were truly impressed with the accomodations and friendliness and courtesy of the staff which made our weekend in Boston very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Boston”
Reviews.Author: SGECHAMPION
Reviews.Content: The Copley Westin's location cannot be beat. It's right at Copley Square, with lots of shopping opportunities and public transport links nearby. We enjoyed a splendid view over Copley Square, the city, and the bay from our nice 34th floor room. We noted some minor issues though. First, we needed to weigh whether to enjoy the beautiful vista or avoid the cold draft coming into the room when the curtains were open. We also would have liked to have another nighstand, since the one between the two queen-size beds was very small and crowded. In addition, the mattress did not seem to be as firm as the one we enjoyed at the Westin in Fort Lauderdale, for whichever reason. And finally, the TV did not allow us to review our portfolio when we wanted to do express check-out, which the front desk clerk said she had heard from other guests as well (even though she said that the Westin's IT people would usually say that it should be working). Fortunately, check-in and check-out were very smooth and efficient, as was the elevator service--which is important when you stay at such a large hotel. Overall, we would recommend the Westin, since the issues we identified are minor, and the prime location and nice ambience more than offset them.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Front Desk Service”
Reviews.Author: heatheranne22
Reviews.Content: After a few issues with entering the hotel which is on a different level from check-in I was not in a great mood from a long day of travel. I was not very pleasant to deal with but I was treated with a lot of patience and with great care to make my stay extremely comfortable. The front desk agent (Masai K.) worked to obtain a room that met all of my requests. The room was very comfortable and I had a spectactular view. I stayed for 2 weeks and was told by Masai that if I needed anything to call on him (I did!). It was his wonderful attitude and willingness to provide a great stay that will make me go back. Good customer service is hard to find but it was definitely at the Westin thanks to Masai. I also enjoyed the lobby with an inviting fireplace. It was a great place to relax and to get some work done. The location is perfect. I could walk to so many things and the shopping (connected to the hotel) is fantastic. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: manojbhasin12
Reviews.Content: Though I have stayed in Westin Copley couple of times earlier too but everytime I stay here it's more enjoyable and satisfying stay for me. The bed size and comfort of the bed is amazing. The rooms are clean and the services of the hotel staff are very prompt and courteous. The location of teh hotel is also very convenient as it's almost in the heart of city and closer to good eating and shopping areas like New berry street etc. The best.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Grumblepoot
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite place to stay whenever I'm in Boston for business or pleasure. The beds are extremely comfy, the rooms are clean, and I love the complimentary bath soaps (odd thing to look forward to, I know). The staff can be a little snooby sometimes, but nothing outrageous. Wonderful location, and if you don't feel like wandering out of the hotel for food, there are plenty of options in the lobby. There's even a walkway to the Copley square mall, so you don't have to venture outside on blustery days - more dining options and things to do -bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: gatorkate_1
Reviews.Content: Stayed Thanksgiving weekend. After thoroughly comparison shopping, I had narrowed hotels down between this and the Copley Square Hotel, and I went with the Westin. It was a lovely room on the higher floors with great views. The location was fantastic - close to bars, restaurants and shopping. We were able to book a duck tour through the concierge and it picked us up about a block from the hotel. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business or city weekend”
Reviews.Author: D0nTravel
Reviews.Content: I have been trying different locations in Boston and this is clearly a greta hotel in Boston. Location is perfect as you are in the centre of Boston walking distance to most things, including the subway. The complex has the Westin at one end and the Marriott at the other end with a great mall in the middle, with trendy brands like Louis Vuitton, Boss, Zegna, etc and department stores like Barneys or Neiman Marcus and adjacent to the Prudential Center and convention. There are a number of restaurants in the gallery just by the lobby of the hotel before entering the mall, so everything you need is very handy. I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a junior suite due to my gold status and got a great room in a Preferred Guest floor , the 35th floor, so the views were spectacular. See my pics attached.The room was large with a sofa and coffee table besides the desk and the large bed. There was an Ipod/iphone charger and radio, lcd TV, bar, coffee maker, etc. Wifi is not free and you pay for 24 hours or more. I could not get wifi in the lobby, so not sure if they have a free service there. The bathroom was a bit too small for the room, but adequate. The price was excellent and more so if you factor in my free upgrade. I used a Special Offer code I saw here at tripadvisor, so I got the second night at 40% off and same for the 4th night. Great savings. In-room dining was a bit sparse in its diversity but good quality. The lobby bar is a good hangout after work to relax with a drink and catch some sports on their TV. The only thing I do not like, but nothing you can do about it, is that the entrances is one level below the lobby, so you need to go up the escalator to check in. When I arrived no one picked my luggage at around 8 PM (no big deal). But the rest of the days I was there I always saw doormen on call, so I guess I was just unlucky. I plan to go back and next time I will be platinum so I am hoping for a larger suite :-)

Reviews.Title: “Shopping extravaganza”
Reviews.Author: trishgraham
Reviews.Content: If you like shopping, people watching or just plain walking, this is the hotel for you. The Westin is located At Copley Place, a very nice upscale shopping district in Boston. The weather doesn't matter here as it is enclosed in a beautiful walkway, complete with glass bridges over streets, onsite parking and restaurants. The rooms were pretty typical of an upscale city hotel, beds very comfortable and well appointed. The staff is courteous, trained, and the dreaded check in and checkout was swift and painless. You cannot beat the location with subway proximity and the galleria of sights, all within walking distance. Why work out in the boring gym when you can stride along viewing the sites in a weather proof environment. Thumbs up for this!

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: elegantraveller
Reviews.Content: Once again we returned to the Westin for our Boston city break - our seventh visit here. We come to enjoy being in the city and favour this location for immediate access to shops, restaurants and public transport. My previous contributions reveal an eclectic mix of places to stay, from the cheap and efficient Hampton Inns which suit our road trip accommodation perfectly, to the ultra-luxe Park Hyatt Tokyo and similar when we feel like a splurge. Our choice for a city break is always a high end hotel with reliably comfortable accommodations to return to pre-dinner and later, for a good night's sleep. Of course, these places don't come cheap and the Westin certainly charges highly for these facilities. Except they no longer deliver the full service. During our four night's stay, we had a succession of irritations, starting with a couple of minor omissions: no shower gel or shower cap in the bathroom, for example. Allowing this to pass as a one-off error, we hoped that the next room service would sort it out. But no - the next service didn't only "forget" the shower stuff, but failed to replenish the coffee supplies too. (the notice states that further supplies may be purchased, incidentally). My comment at reception about these issues, including a lack of turn down service resulted in the response that guests need to make specific requests for such amenities as shower gel now. Westin, if that's really so, then a notice stating that would be helpful. The lack of consistent and reliable service became annoying and any warmth or loyalty we felt towards the hotel soon disappeared in a mix of unresolved grumbles. In spite of reporting early in our stay that the reading light above the bed was broken, nothing was done and the final straw was delivered when we asked for a late checkout, only to be told that the hotel was sold out, so the answer had to be no. Unless we wanted to pay $25 for an extra hour, that is. Actually, there was another final straw - 4 days valet parking charge added to our bill in error "because there was another guest with the same name", and as I sit at the airport writing this review, we have just received an email with another $30 charge for the 'honor bar' which we never touched. The final straws just keep on coming. So, we leave the Westin Copley Place not only as disgruntled guests, but with unresolved issues as well. Above all, no one seemed to care about our experience. No one accepted responsibility or offered much of an apology and the reception staff were universally lacking in warmth and interpersonal skills. Of course the comfy beds and prime location are still the same but that's hardly a recommendation, I'm afraid.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach in the room”
Reviews.Author: brightlamps
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin in August 2011 for a night trip. The room was very spacious and like always, Westin does a good job decorating. However, I was welcomed by a note at the desk saying " we are undergoing renovation, so please keep the curtains drawn for your privacy". The clerk who checked me in, should have at least mentioned the renovation to me! Someone could have been changing clothes in the room, and then see a smiling face in the window! Not everyone would check the writing desk to see if the hotel has any welcoming comments for them. Well, I drew the curtains...switched on the light and there on the table, near the phone was a huge cockroach! I called the hotel staff, I clicked some pictures, of the cockroach in case it moved and disappeared before the staff arrived. The staff acknowledged "I have never seen such a huge cockroach and we are sorry". One said " It is not the first time this has happened!" What! I have never seen a cockroach in my house and you see those "not so often" in Boston! They moved me to a better room, however it was late be then and I had a flight to catch at 5:30 AM. And then, they charged me for the internet service! I called them up and they refunded my room, after I was back home. That was my last night in Boston, and I have to say I do not have very happy memories of the Westin! I would never ever go back there again. Fairmont Copley Plaza, just around the corner, similarly priced, is a much better hotel, I stayed there for 5 nights, although rooms are small, but the service is great. At the very least Westin could try to make up to their customers in a better way.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice - central hotel”
Reviews.Author: sugabtoronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend following Thanksgiving and it was a great choice. The hotel is a 2 minute walk from the Copley T Station, and a 15 minute walk to the Boston Common. Although we did not shop, it is connected to two large malls. Newbury Street where there are also many high end boutiques, is also very close. Many restaurants within walking distance. The check-in was speedy and the front desk very accommodating and friendly. The concierge desk, was very efficient and knowledgeable. The breakfast in the Huntingdon was good and the buffet, ample. If you are a fan of Starbucks, it is just outside the lobby! The room was well sized,the king bed with its mattress so "heavenly", although the bathroom by North American standards, a touch small. All in all, we would definitely return to the Westin Copley Place and really enjoyed our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great as always!”
Reviews.Author: MGAdventure
Reviews.Content: First time visiting Boston, and although there were several options for the same location, I picked Westin as it have been always a safe choice for me, comfort and service wise. If you love cities - Westin at Copley Plaza is perfectly located in a nice Boston area called Copley - it is convenient to a major roads, and also in walking distance to parks, Beacon Hill area, shops and restaurants. Big grocery supermarket and Tour buses stops just across the street if you choose to take a tour. Shopping, of course, Westin is connected to the Mall and you can get to the many department stores, or just get to the Boylston and Newbury streets where are may shops and restaurant via Sky Walks passages (great for rainy or cold weather). There are several restaurants/bars that you can get to without going outside. Hotel rooms are quite large - my king size room was very spacious, nice hardwood floor at the entrance door foyer. Bathroom was somewhat small - agree with other reviewers. Personally to me, not a big deal, I saw smaller bathrooms in Europe, and I don't spend much time there anyway, so as long as it is clean, works for me. Bathroom was very clean. Room was clean too, carpet with no spots, no smell in the room, amazing view of a city and Charles river. Hotel staff was wonderful, very friendly and responsive to any needs, questions or concerns. There is no kitchenette in room but there is a coffee maker. There is no refrigerator in the room (there is a mini-bar), but you can always ask for one and they will bring it in promptly. Never had to wait more than couple of seconds for the elevators - good thing when you are staying in high rise buildings. Would stay again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Love it - again and again”
Reviews.Author: vk7387
Reviews.Content: Although it may not be the newest hotel in town, there is a reason this on has stood the test of time. They really seem to have their business down to an art. Everything one would expect from a find hotel is in place. That is more than I can same for some other Boston hotels with pricier rooms. But beyond the hotel itself, its location also makes it ideal. Situated in the center of Copley Square and near the Prudential Center and Boylston Street, the location is perfect. It is one of the nicer areas of Boston and there is plenty to do without even needed to set foot outside!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for shopping”
Reviews.Author: ValVil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is connected via covered walkways to the main Copley/Prudential upscale shopping areas. If you are seeking a great shopping experience in unpleasant weather, this hotel (or one of the other connected hotels) is the place to stay. It is an older hotel that has been remodelled since the last time we stayed here. The refurbishing is pleasant and one noticeable difference is that the rooms are quieter. Being an older property, some of the common areas (i.e. elevators) still show their age. One disappointment others have also noted...the breakfast choices are lacking true healthy options. Someone smart at Westin is trying to market the breakfast as containing healthy ingredients, but the actual dishes are average and we suspect the ingredients are no different than anywhere else...just marketing fluff. Some true healthy options would be welcome. The service staff at breakfast was the only service we had an opportunity to experience, and they were outstanding. But parking is expensive...beware.

Reviews.Title: “Neat, confortable, and silent”
Reviews.Author: iyamasaki
Reviews.Content: I could enjoy a nice view from the 23rd floor, and every morning, beautiful sunrise. The maintenance of the room and other facilities of the hotel were correct and neat. You still have a room to improve the coices of breakfast (more fruits and varieties of yogurts). The bathroom coud be larger, and better have a separate shower booth and two basins. Efficiency on services including the check-in and check-out is remarkable, except when your system of the computer at the check-in has had a little trouble. This hotel is good for business as well as for the family resort. If I may add, the security reinforcement could be a better idea (too many people from outside can fool arroud the lobby and restaurant areas).

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelVA
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel with a beautiful view. The room and bathroom were spotless. The bed was awesome. The only downside is that the hotel is not right in downtown and a short cab trip was needed, but I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and Upscale”
Reviews.Author: Donald S
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Copley Place in Boston for the second time in five months in early November. The desk clerk, Sunny, remembered me when i checked in, which was an unusual and very pleasant occurrence. I was upgraded to a junior suite without requesting it. The room was spacious and clean. The location is very convenient. What made the biggest impression was the friendliness and responsiveness of the staff. I had requested no feathers in the room. The desk clerk said it would be taken care of. As I arrived at my room one of the housekeepers in the hall said she would get to it right away. In the time it took me to go up seven floors, the message had been delivered. Very impressive.

Reviews.Title: “5-star Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Traveller35758
Reviews.Content: The staff provide excellent customer service. This stay was a return visit & they took the time to personally recognize me by providing me breakfast & a personal thanks. This is above and beyond many hotels. Of course the beds are Heavenly, no pun intended. Also the workout center is awesome & location great, especially of you are a shopaholic, you just walk from lobby to the mall. I shall return @ you should too. Pt of ref: I'm a Platinum in Marriott & SPG, Diamond in HHonors & Diamond Delta. Travel lots.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Copley Place is great”
Reviews.Author: joe m
Reviews.Content: Great beds , great pillows , slept like a baby !! Great Food and drinks !! , Nice people !!! don't need a car, walked everywhere , Boston rocks .. have fun!!

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Value”
Reviews.Author: drosen85
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin during a large convention that had much of Boston booked up. I'm a loyal SPG member so always look Starwood first if the price is right. In this case, the Westin was one of the best priced hotels in the City. My room was great -- though did not get a Platinum upgrade -- and the hotel is in very good condition. Location is one of the best in Boston. Walkable to the top shopping areas, a little longer walk to Fenway (but on a warm September evening, the perfect distance to stretch my legs after watching the game). Common and financial districts are also withing walking or a very short cab.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: WeekendTraveler58
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Copley Place on a weekend get-a-way. Check in took only a few minutes and the staff was courteous and very professional. The lobby at the Westin is always clean and welcoming. The location is great. The hotel is connected to an up-scale mall, and is also within walking distance to Newbury Street and Fanieul Hall. It is actually very easy to walk around a good portion of the city in good weather from this location. It is also very easy to get a cab from the Westin. I tried to get a cab at another hotel very close by and I ended up walking back to the Westin where I was able to get a cab instantly. The room was immaculate and the view spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay...”
Reviews.Author: Traveler5782
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a night at the Westin Copley Place. I was in town for work and after a long day I was just looking for some rest. Check in was quick and easy. The room was clean...and the Heavenly beds are always a perk...I was able to walk there from work and there were some great places to eat right down the street. I would definitely stay here again or tell a friend who is visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: bruce g
Reviews.Content: During recent business trip found hotel to be clean and friendly. This is a good looking, well maintained hotel that has a great location. Staff was professional. This is a perfect hotel whether you are visiting for business or pleasure. Rooms a facilities are very nice and of high quality.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Classy & Efficient”
Reviews.Author: heart/e
Reviews.Content: Thru the help of Mr. Shatner & Co we were able to book a room at a healthy discount over the advertised room rate (more on that later). The hotel is very convenient to the Mass Pike and valet, check in and bellman service excellent. Before arriving, we contacted the front desk and asked for a high floor, a good view and a room located away from the elevators. We entered a sun drenched corner room with two walls of windows and a lovely view. The room was spacious, clean and the furnishings were modern. The room closet was absolutely huge and the desk and entertainment center had lots of plugs for all our electronic devices. The TV even came with game controllers for the kids. Some may gripe about small bathrooms which I agree & wifi charges in the room. I would imagine business traveler they are use to a wifi fee & the rest of us can take a quick trip down to the lobby for a little free wifi. Valet parking is expensive but we were using our car multiple times throughout our stay and were willing to pay the $46/day fee for the convenience of coming and going. Those looking to save $ on the weekends may want to park on St. James near Arlington and take a cab. The T stop on Dartmouth is seconds away and a great way to get around town. Additionally, the hotel is connected by indoor walkways to a variety of shops/malls and buildings. Its a great way to move around when its raining, snowing or you just don't feel like going outside.
