Regarding our booking, betterbidding.com collects results from travelers utilizing PL and HW. The site lets you search specific dates, cities and hotel classes. While we didn't get the same hotel that others did, we knew what we should be bidding in Boston for a 4* hotel for the nights we stayed. Pretty nifty.........check it out! Overall, fast efficient service, super clean room and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming”
Reviews.Author: Sweetplums
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after the storm hit Boston and it was exactly what I needed. Staff was very friendly and welcoming and I was allowed to check in early. I was immediately upgraded to a corner room junior suite which had terrific views. Bathroom was a bit small for such a nice and large room and room service was ok, not great but I would recommend to anyone staying in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in downtown Boston, MA. with the greatest service”
Reviews.Author: Betty R
Reviews.Content: My stay was flawless. Bed is perfect, staff is outstanding and efficient, rooms are clean and beautiful. The check in and check out process was quick, easy and you were on your way. Registration desk staff was friendly, welcoming, and knew the hotel. My room had a great view overlooking the harbor. The room was very clean and cleaned to perfection each day during my week's stay. I felt safe and secure in the fitness center and throughout the entire hotel. The fitness center was very clean and fresh smelling. Overall I give the Westin Hotel at Copley Place an excellent rating and highly recommend the hotel to all travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location and very clean”
Reviews.Author: tkherold
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Westin for a conference and were very pleased. The staff was friendly and very accomendating. The location was good. Close to two subway lines giving easy access to the city (recommend getting the 7 day charlie card if you are staying awile). The room was average size and the bed was comfortable. The drinks and snacks were rather high but small convience store close by.

Reviews.Title: “Its the location!”
Reviews.Author: MaxineTC
Reviews.Content: Here for 8 nights - mostly business. It was clean with spacious rooms, a good view and a friendly concierge. The best part is its location to all that Boston has to offer. Transit across the street and covered skywalks to various malls.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Accessibility & Class”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth G
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Copley Place for a business event and I could not have been happier. I honestly wish I had been able to have more time to enjoy the many amenities of the hotel. The Business Center was fantastic and helped with every work-related need I had. The other staff were also gracious and there was never a problem they couldn't solve. My conference went off without a hitch and my personal stay was equally without issue. My room was incredibly comfortable. The view was great, the TV was huge and the bed was amazing. Good coffee available in the rooms and downstairs, even early in the morning. Great dining and lounge areas. The fact that the Westin Copley is attached to a large mall is also very convenient. I would strongly recommend this hotel for any business or personal stay.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay while in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: dianaz
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located close to most Boston attractions, walking distance to the park! The rooms very really comfortable. I did not like the indoor pool it was really small and packed.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: GRLTRAV
Reviews.Content: This large property is located in downtown Boston, about a $20 cab ride from Logan Airport. My room was located on one of the upper floors had gorgeous views of Boston and the harbour. There were plenty of elevators to the higher floors, so never experienced any wait time. This is a busy hotel. I arrived mid-afternoon, experienced a small wait during checkin and my room was ready. The king room was large, with the expected amenities of a Westin. WiFi is extra $13 and the mini bar costs are high. While not as gorgeous as other rooms I've stayed, you're paying for the location of the hotel. It's an easy walk to Newbury Street (shopping) and Boylston Street (food) and sits directly across from Back Bay Station (should you want to take the train (T) from the airport or anywhere else for that matter. Across the street is the simply gorgeous Boston Public Library - make sure you take a tour, as well as their local food store, Shaws, should you want to grab snacks during your day travel. Near by is the Prudential Center and the hotel is attached to an upscale mall. The location is the best in the city - 10 minute cab ride to Cambridge (Harvard/MIT) or walk to some of the best restaurants in the country. I had breaksfast in the hotel (pricey buffet and the service was poor), but also ate in the

Reviews.Title: “First Choice Everytime”
Reviews.Author: RedRover02
Reviews.Content: My weekend stay at the Westin was as expected. The staff was welcoming, friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable and relaxing. The beds, as you know, are fantastic. Overall the place is first-class. Having stayed at two other Westins, this was my first choice in a hotel. It is well located and in walking distance of many good places to eat. The only negative is paying $13 a night for wireless connectivity. I used Priceline to get a great deal on the nightly rate.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Copley is an awesome place to stay - very nice!”
Reviews.Author: Steve A
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley is an awesome place to stay. The hotel is very clean, staff is very friendly, and the rooms are quiet, neutral decor, and the bed and pillows are incredible. You will not want to leave. A great place to attend a conference, or stay to conduct business. Can not go wrong with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel; professional staff”
Reviews.Author: Yael K
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels I have been to. The staff was very professional and knowledgeable, the room very comfortable, and the location very convenient. highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Debbie B
Reviews.Content: I hosted an event for almost 1,000 people on a Saturday night recently and stayed overnight as well. The staff couldn't have been nicer. The rooms were clean and well appointed. Our event was a little tricky to put on because we had a lot of music and all of the staff did everything they could to make sure it was a success. Staying overnight was an extra bonus. I checked in early and even though I couldnt get in my room yet they made sure to keep in touch and let me know when it was available. The location cant be beat. Food for 1,000 was great and then room service breakfast the next morning was just as good. In fact too much food for breakfast. I would stay here again, host another event here and cant recommend highly enough. Thank you to everyone who made this such a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Always Happy at Westin Copley Place”
Reviews.Author: MRice05701
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley Place never disappoints. All Westins have the most comfortable beds, and great rooms overall. Westin Copley Place is in a great location, so convenient to wonderful shopping and restaurants. Always a first choice in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Copley Place is the place to stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Oggioni
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley Place has and continues to offer a great service and manages a first-class property. I have stayed at this facility numerous times in the past 5 years and the experience just keeps getting better! Check-in is easy (sometimes busy, but always well managed) and the staff is friendly and helpful. Sean Howe, as Director of Guest Services, is at the top of his game with service! The location is within walking distance to many universities, great restaurants, cafes and shopping (both indoor and outdoor). We love this place and we stay here whenever we visit our daughter attending Northeastern University in Boston. The tower structure offers superb vistas in just about any direction and the cleanliness of windows is excellent. Operable ventilation windows are a plus!

Reviews.Title: “westin copley place”
Reviews.Author: Michael M
Reviews.Content: Great Location, very welcoming staff. The bathrooms are a little small but they are on par with most of the hotels in Boston due to the age of the buildings. Front desk service was great and Jen D. at the concierge desk was just a sweetheart, she made sure we had a wonderful stay. A great place for business or leisure travel and the heavenly bed is just that! Always my go to hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Average.”
Reviews.Author: francyl01
Reviews.Content: The location for this hotel is the best part and mostly the only reason why I stayed here. The rooms were clean, although a bit noisy (thin walls), the beds were comfortable and the staff friendly, especially the gentleman who assisted us with our luggage (sorry, I can't remember his name). I do have issues with the cost of the hotel food, parking and internet fees (Prudential offers free wifi though), and although prices are about the same in other hotels nearby, I guess I was expecting more from this hotel. It was a clean, nice place but nothing outstanding or remarkable.

Reviews.Title: “About what you would expect from a Westin...”
Reviews.Author: nelsoli
Reviews.Content: This was hotel was just what you would expect from a Westin - standard room and standard service. The lobby is a bit busy and the hotel is rather large (primarily full of business travelers). My room was fine - it had a decent work area but a very small bathroom. There was no robe and the toiletries were missing. However, room service was very fast and the hotel is in a great location, right next to shopping and a lot of restaurants. If you are looking for your standard chain hotel, this place won't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “disappointing food”
Reviews.Author: judith94941
Reviews.Content: Rooms at the westin copley place are very nice, the hotel is very well located, but the food is disappointing. i ate 2 meals here and the food was substandard, especially given prices. i recommend you stay at the W hotel in boston. W often costs less, the rooms are stylish and the food is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: ETinSLC
Reviews.Content: W Boston is well appointed and the service is good. It was actually one of the better deals in town and the location was good but I did not leave there thinking that I had to stay there the next time I was in town. Work out facility was lacking a bit!

Reviews.Title: “There are better places to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nic H
Reviews.Content: I stay in a lot of hotels as I travel a lot for work and this hotel was very unimpressive. Very expensive for what you get, no free wifi ($12.95 per 24 hours), and all parking is valet which costs $46 per night! Do I need to go on? My drain in the shower was blocked, there are sensors in the minibar that charge your account if you pick anything up, and you have to swipe your credit card to use the safe. Anyway, if my conference for work wasn't here I would have gone somewhere else. Definitely would not stay here if I was paying. I got the feeling they didn't really want you staying there, so if you were going to stay they were sure gonna charge you for causing them the inconvenience. Rooms are modern and clean. But seriously...who doesn't offer free wifi???

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect...”
Reviews.Author: rhweatherly
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley Place is an amazing hotel, modern and clean, well designed and conveniently located in a great part of Boston. We stayed here through the weekend for a wedding (which was across the street at the historic Fairmont) and had a great stay. The room itself was clean, well maintained, and relatively spacious for a downtown hotel in a major city. Although somewhat pricey, I think given the location and the level or service onsite it was an excellent value. My one complaint came after checkout. We got home to an updated bill from the hotel including $30.56 for in-room mini bar charges. I can't for the life of me figure out how that happened - we never touched any of the minibar. When I called to deal with the bill, the billing department refused to correct the bill, saying that we had activated the weight-sensitive triggers that charges to the room for each item. I think a simple spot check would have confirmed that these items were not removed or used, but they insisted that they were. I found it contrary to the attitudes of the staff onsite, who were ameniable and helpful at all times. In short, I won't return to this hotel out of principle. There's a reason why I stick with the Hilton family - I've never had ANY issues like this. I would probably still recommend the hotel as a whole, but encourage you to confirm your bill before checking out - once you're gone, they have your money and will likely not refund any incorrect charges.

Reviews.Title: “Problem with service”
Reviews.Author: Ilayuk
Reviews.Content: Although our room was spectacular I have to report that a pair of earrings disappeared from my room while I was having breakfast. The concierge staff were not concerned and the only thing they did was pointing me to a phone to contact lost and found dept. The room maid obviously did not find anything and barely spoke English.

Reviews.Title: “Westin was amazing”
Reviews.Author: BeckyWebster
Reviews.Content: Having been to New York last year I didn't think the experience could be matched. I was wrong Boston is a fantastic city and the Westin Copley was a fab place to stay. We were greeted by warm friendly staff. Our bags were kept free off charge whilst we went to explore( we were early for check in). The hotel is on the corner of a very clever network of shopping malls, including a Starbucks only seconds away from the hotel lobby. Complimentary wifi in the lobby. I liked the fact that you could use a stand alone computer in the lobby to check in for return flights hassle free and without cost. Thank you Westin for a fantastic stay in a brilliant city

Reviews.Title: “Good location and hotel, but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Mondo5280
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during a business conference we had and the rate for the room was high, but I guess it's typical when you stay at places and locations like this. The room was very nice, clean and comfortable. Of course, the Internet price is not free and are charged about $10-12 for 24-hour period. The meeting room they stuck us in was very tight and just not the best. The location is close to many restaurants and a fast food joints too. Only thing I experienced at the hotel was the bar and it was nothing special, but pricey for the drinks. The hotel is close to a super market and the subway. We were able to walk to the Cheers bar from here, but it was a good walking distance. Overall, I would not stay here on my own dime, but for business travels it works if you want to pay a lot and not get any free stuff out of it. It was close to a mall or shopping area, but I did not explore that.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to everything”
Reviews.Author: cybermd
Reviews.Content: A really great hotel with fantastic views, fast elevators, nice gym and indoor pool, great restaurants and great service. Best bed ever. Immaculately clean.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Long Weekend”
Reviews.Author: pontevecchio59
Reviews.Content: We had a chance to stay at the Westin recently from Friday to Tuesday. The trip was part pleasure and part business as my spouse had to attend a conference some of the time. We landed at 8 AM and the reception at the desk was very efficient and polite then and at all times and we were given the room by 10 AM . The hotel is more oriented for business travel and hence the Lobby was always busy. The rooms were very well maintained and the bedding helped us get a good nights sleep during our stay. The ability to enter the adjoining Mall without leaving the building was nice specially considering you could go quite a distance right up to the Prudential Building. The proximity to Dining as well as the ability to walk pretty much anywhere we wanted was a bonus, Boston being a city eminently suitable for walking. So the hotel comes well recommended all other things being equal. The desk Staff are a credit to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: campbell_jamesn
Reviews.Content: Expensive, but clean and very nice.... also, location cannot be beat

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Gina P
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley Place is in a fantastic location. The hotel and staff are extremely welcoming. This hotel is a wonderful place to stay that is sure to please. You will not be disappointed. The beds are so comfortable you are sure to get a fantastic nights sleep. The rooms are immaculate along with the hotel common areas. The food in the hotel was exceptional. The gift shop and the shopping associated with the hotel is also amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely experience; I will return”
Reviews.Author: WindyCityWoman847
Reviews.Content: I went to the Westin Copley Place for a conference and stayed 5 nights. While I always find Westins nice, my expectations were exceeded. Really nice room, friendly and attentive staff, incredible view, and great amenities (full-service Starbucks adjacent to the lobby was nice). I have recently stayed across the street at the quite-expensive Fairmont, which was great, but after this experience, I would actually make this Westin my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Boston's Best Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jwredlabel
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is classy, from check-in, to rooms, to location. I love the indoor connection to the mall, the proximity to the subway, the closeness to many of the sights of Boston, and one can just laze around in the lobby and feel special. After a dozen stays in this city, I will no longer stay anywhere else. It is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Super experience checking in!”
Reviews.Author: Latricia P
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with some colleagues while we were attending a meeting from October 12-16. We shared the room to reduce the overall cost per person, but we needed the bill split two ways for one night and three ways for the remaining three nights. This is a task that other hotels would have made a huge mess of, but Dan (a manager I believe) handled it masterfully! Thank you for a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “great location, was ok for our baby”
Reviews.Author: wayneshallmd
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin Copley Place with out infant. Their website states that they are very baby friendly, but I am not sure what makes them so special. They gave us a crib. So does every other hotel. Like other reviewers have said, the bathroom was small, but more significantly, dark. Especially the shower. Otherwise, we loved our room. It had great views of the Charles. The hotel had a great location. Connected not just to the mall but a lot of other hotels. Not only is the Starbucks closeby, but just over the bridge is the Au Bon Pain. You can walk indoors to restaurants like the Cheesecake Factory as well. Across the square was a 24 hour CVS where we bought diapers, it was nice to not have to pack them. Very easy access to the T, but was a big pain lifting our stroller up into the green line car. We took the T from the airport and the stop where you switch trains (government center?) was not handicap accessible so we had to carry the stroller up the stairs there. Everyone kept saying it was 35-40$ taxi ride to the airport, but on our trip back it was only 25-30$, and that's including tip and luggage extras.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debra M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here to celebrate our 20th Anniversary on September 16th, 2011. The room, the view, the staff and the food was amazing! We stayed on the 33rd floor in a suite!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Box Hotel in a Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: dancepig
Reviews.Content: I would have to say the best thing about this hotel is the location. The beds are wonderful, but other than that, it is the standard four star hotel in a large city. The beds are one of their marketing stars. Our room was clean, but we were lacking coffee for the coffee maker. The price is high, but there are usually some deals out there. Just watch out for the parking. The hotel charges you $46 per 24 hrs. as soon as you leave your car. We were not going to park at the hotel, but by the time we got out of our car and had the luggage out, the valet had taken our car to the garage. If you don't intend to park there, make sure you park on the street, don't pull up to the area for drop-offs. The bar and lounge was the standard bar in any hotel, service was average. So, I guess it's all about the location, which this place is in the heart of the shopping, great restaurants, and right next to the Prudential Center. The Copley mall and the Prudential Malls are connected with a covered walk way which is ideal in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Hip, Views, Copley Square”
Reviews.Author: kbobefun
Reviews.Content: The Westin seems to have a hip feel as compared to other hotel chains and this hotel was no exception. The room was very modern, and clean. It is centrally located if you are touring the city, and not too far from the T stop outside of Copley Square/Boston Library. It is right near the duck tours and about a 5 minute walk to the Prudential Skywalk. The service was very good-valet, bags, check in, toy for our kid at check in, etc. One minus was that the pool area was a little cold. If you have a young family, the waterfront may be a more preferable location to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Concierge Service!”
Reviews.Author: Lindsay N
Reviews.Content: I have been truly impressed by the concierge service at the Westin Copley Place. Specifically Sean Howe has been quick to respond to any questions I've had and has gone far beyond what is expected of him. He helped me plan a perfect gift for my boyfriend on our anniversary. I can't speak highly enough. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “One night Boston Escape”
Reviews.Author: Dennis M
Reviews.Content: A great one night stay began with an early check in. Masai was very helpul. He was able to find us the perfect room. An example of the great employees at the Westin Copley. The room was fantastic. Breakfast the next morning was a special treat. Everything was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Dad06279
Reviews.Content: My wife and I reserved this hotel through a name-your-own-price website and received a decent discount on a Saturday night stay. We were very happy to find out it was the Westin, and even happier when we finally arrived at the front desk. The staff was wonderful, and we had a very nice room on the 25th floor with one king bed. The hotel itself is attached to the sprawling Copley Center, which is a large, upscale mall. The hotel's parking was completely full due to multiple weddings, so we had to park at the mall and walk back to the hotel (via indoor passages and skywalks). This was a trifle annoying but the staff was apologetic -- they really couldn't do more than they did. The hotel itself is stylish even if the overall decor tends toward the dark end of the color palette. Once past check-in we found our room to be very spacious. The furnishings were all very high quality (as I would expect for this class of hotel), the bathroom was very nice, and the bed was extremely comfortable. We were there for a couple's getaway, but they had a large glass-topped desk with plenty of accessory plugs for ample working space, and they even have an additional charging station in one of the nightstands for convenience. The view from our side of the hotel was of South Boston -- it was a very nice view, especially at night. My only caution (not really a complaint) is with the honor bar. I happened to read the sign and noticed that they use a pressure sensor. If you even move something, either dry goods or in the fridge, you will be charged. So we had honor bar rum because my wife touched it. We had a night on the town and returned to the hotel a few minutes after 1 am to find the lounge was already closed. This was a little surprising, but quite a few places in Boston do close around 1 am -- if you are interested in nightlife. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. We did not use any other services or restaurants in the hotel, but its proximity to transit and Copley Center gives the traveler plenty of choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: Christina M
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Westin Copley Square. The location is excellent for shopping, dining and going to a Red Sox game. We did all three the weekend we were there. The proximity to the public transportation made it easy to get back and forth from the ball field. The staff was very friendly and made great recommendations for dining out. We will stay here every time we come for a game.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for the discounted price”
Reviews.Author: SJB1209
Reviews.Content: Only stayed for two nights and booked through a discount website. Was very happy when name of hotel was revealed. Staff allowed early check in and provided a fridge for some baby bottles. Beds were very comfortable indeed. General decor and ambiance of hotel was great. Staff in lobby were very helpful. Really good location for Copley area. Would be five stars if there was free wifi in rooms - only free in the lobby. If I was paying the full rate I would not want to pay up at extra $15 a night for wireless access in my room.

Reviews.Title: “Location but”
Reviews.Author: JohannOttawa
Reviews.Content: A reservation not worth the money one pays. Great location but when we arrived there was no Valet Parking left so had to park in the nearby Copley Square = like putting a Quarter in the sand on the Beach and then trying to find it next day. Reception on the 2nd floor was a bit odd. Rooms were fine - nothing exceptional. Breakfast was not included but they did have a Coffee machine in the room. But in this day and age - no free WiFi is unforgiveable. Over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Best concierge”
Reviews.Author: Victor J
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 nights at the Westin and while everyone was very helpful and friendly we had the best experience with our concierge Frank. He had been with the hotel less then a week but you could tell he was well connected with Boston. He gave us great advice on the best tour bus company, made arrangements for the ferry to Cape Cod, recommended restaurants and even got us tickets to the sold out Red Sox game. He was a delightful person and really made our time in Boston the best. He made us want to come back and visit Boston and the Westin hotel. Vic and Lynda

Reviews.Title: “Dependable and a great location”
Reviews.Author: warnert
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a busy fall weekend. Front desk was very efficient, pleasant, and helpful. Our room was excellent even roomy, despite being a double. The bed is possibly the best part, extremely comfortable. The room was about as quiet as one could expect on a busy weekend with a hotel pretty close to fully occupied. Enjoyed the lounge/bar downstairs, the bartender was very attentive and the appetizers were excellent. The location of this hotel is the best part, close to shopping, great restaurants, and Fenway Park. We would happily stay here on another trip.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently a cut above the rest”
Reviews.Author: MajorNYC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times over many years at the Westin Copley Place, and each time have been delighted in surprising ways. Staff are always super-friendly and helpful, everyone smiles. The location can't be beat. My latest wonderful surprise was an upgrade to a corner room with a fabulous view of Copley Square, Boston Harbor, and the Charles River. The staff provided many little extras, much appreciated, such as extra creamer for the usual complimentary coffee. When I have a choice, I choose this hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely first class on the world class scale”
Reviews.Author: forbes1
Reviews.Content: We spent ten wonderful days in this hotel. I would single out the unfailing friendiness of the staff and their dedication to service.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: elfgurl
Reviews.Content: Centrally located, very clean. Very comfortable bed. Nice modern rooms. They charge a huge amount for valet parking, but considering the location, I guess that is to be expected. The bathroom is small, but again, considering the location, no surprise there. We were able to walk to several great restaurants from here the few nights we stayed. Be warned, they charge for every extra thing. Also, although there is a fridge in the room, it is a mini bar filled with stuff. But you can request a different fridge for your own stuff! I found that out the last night, wish I had known earlier!

Reviews.Title: “CONSISTENCY & FRIENDLINESS MAKE THE DIFFERENCE”
Reviews.Author: MES49
Reviews.Content: A busy, hustle & bustling property offering great views & good location. Staff makes the difference in courtesy, friendliness, & competency, particularly Ms. Drummond handling Gold/Platinum SPG guests--quick to resolve individual issues to satisfaction of guest. Don't forget Turners seafood downstairs--friendly bar, accommodating manager-Trish, & consistently good food--watch out for specials during the week. What can I say--I use to book only Fairmont, but you just cannot beat Starwood--what a difference.

Reviews.Title: “OK, Needs Improvement!”
Reviews.Author: SWIFTYS
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights, and were greeted in reception by a huge queue to check in, only 3 out of a possible 8 desks were being used. After a 20 min wait, we were told about our amazing, newly refurbished corner Junior suite! We couldnt wait. the room itself was spacious and nicely furnished, the bathroom however, was disgusting! Not refurbished! it was tiny, so small I couldnt take a photo. The toilet tank was badly cracked across the whole width, the bath had chips out the enamel, the wood on the vanity unit had nail polish spilled on it, and there was this tiny bath, described by Westin as a 'Heavenly' Bath! Maybe if you are 2 feet tall! it was shallow, old and not great! and a shower curtain across also. Very Poor indeed. Breakfast, again, the service was dreadful. There were 6 or 7 staff standing around for the whole of our breakfast talking, one man was doing everything. We couldnt get more juice or coffee, or anyones attention! We were fuming! It set a really bad example. Go to St arbucks! All in all a very badly run Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Location”
Reviews.Author: irelandbuffalo
Reviews.Content: One of my better Starwood experiences recently. Nice renovated rooms, solid service and great location. Supermarket and mall next door, subway/train block away and close to Newbury. Lobby is small, but full Starbucks within bldg. should be open shortly. Pool is nothing to get excited about but fine for kids, nice workout facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Special Occasion”
Reviews.Author: Irishprincess2
Reviews.Content: This was a short weekend trip to Boston, main reason to see Red Sox play Tampa Bay, hotel gave us nice upgrade (our 40th wedding anniv) overlooking Charles River, pretty beautiful view from the 29th floor. Got a wonderful surprise from my sis and her husband of Champagne and fruit delivered as soon as we arrived. Room was roomy and nicely appointed. Bathrooms are small but adequate. Food in hotel bar delicious. Hotel was super busy with graduates from Northeastern staying there as well as Tampa Bay's baseball team, we were gracious even though they beat us!! You would never know they were that busy as the attention by the staff was great, very courteous. Have stayed before and would definately stay again...

Reviews.Title: “Great First-time Boston experience!”
Reviews.Author: NJAloha
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal through priceline bidding for the room during a peak weekend. Valet service was prompt, our bags were taken out and loaded immediately. The front desk agent who checked us in (Michelle) was friendly and did not hesistate when we asked questions about amenities within the hotel. Upon getting into the room, my boyfriend and I promptly inspected the room (we both worked in housekeeping mgt) We found very little wrong with the room. The linens on the bed were fresh, no stains or smells. The bathroom was dust free and the shower was up to standard. Past reviews mentioned a small bathroom, they weren't joking. It is a tight bathroom but it does what it's suppose to do. The amenities smelled nice, did not prefer to use them though because I was unsure of the quality. Our bags arrived right after we came in the room, the bellman told us all about the area and what streets we could find something to eat. The only unfortunate part of the stay is that we requested a refrigerator (which came on time) but smelled like vomit! I had to use burning hot water, soap, and a washcloth to clean out and it still smelled vaguely of it once I was done. It was usable but still gross!! PROS: Spacious room (King room) Bed was VERY comfortable and clean to sleep in, we basically passed out each night. The location of the hotel is SO close to subway (the T) and is close to high-end shopping and local eateries. All staff were absolutely friendly and very helpful. CONS: Elevators take forever! They have a large elevator bank but it still takes awhile for you to get one. The elevator indicator lights up but doesn't open the doors until another 30-60 seconds. Weird. The TV takes about 6-8 seconds to load each channel. Valet is $46/night!! Only other option is parking across the street in parking garage that will charge you each time you exit/re-enter. Bathrooms are small (but it's not that big of a deal because they were clean)

Reviews.Title: “A Very Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: MrJoelB
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for three nights on business. Staff was very friendly and very helpful. Room was well proportioned and comfortable. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The very best hotel on the planet”
Reviews.Author: Kevin H
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Westin Copley Place hotel now for over 15 years. I can honestly say that this is the best hotel that I have ever stayed at. The hotel staff are incredibly friendly and attentive, the rooms are immaculate, the service is premier, and the food and atmosphere at Bar 10 and Turner Fisheriers is incredible. I recently stayed at this hotel with my wife celebrating both my birthday and our anniversary (I actually proposed in one of the rooms in this hotel). I made mention of our special trip there at time of reservation and I was greeted at the registration desk by staff wishing us a great anniversary. That doesn't seem to ever happen anymore. Like always, we had an incredible time and felt like we were at home. I wouldn't hesitate to stay at this hotel again, and will. The proximity to everything Boston is great and top notch service is something you can count on. Treat yourself to the very best and stay at the Westin Copley Place. You won't ever regret it. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful newly renovated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Blake_Hampton_Foster
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin in Boston. The staff was incredibly helpful and the hotel was simply perfect. Beds were cozy, modernly designed rooms and lobby, great bar area, work out facility etc.......From what I heard they just got done with a 20 million dollar renovation and although I never saw it before, I sure believe it because everything looked brand new and well taken care of. The hotel has a great view of the boston area and ocean. I will be back here the next time i visit.

Reviews.Title: “Needs an overhaul”
Reviews.Author: bodfish
Reviews.Content: This hotel is showing its age and needs some significant updating. The carpet in our room was worn and the furnishings looked like they were ready for replacement. Maybe they have redone some of the hotel, but this room definitely lefty much to be desired. As a SPG member, I can only assume I didn't get the worst room in the hotel. The hotel is enormous, elevators are crowded. You will hear people coming and going at night. This place is best for large groups - if you're a couple looking for a nice getaway, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Musty, paper thin wall hotel at great location”
Reviews.Author: mgoblueNY
Reviews.Content: I don't normally write negative reviews, but I was shocked at the quality of this Westin. My check-in took a full 20 minutes as they did not have my room ready for me at 6:30pm at night. I took it in stride and went up to my newly renovated room where, oddly, the entire room smelled musty and moldy. I was awoken (in my heavenly bed which was quite lovely) at :4am as the hotel guests started taking their showers since the walls are so thin that you can hear the plumbing and water rushing throughout the walls. (Mental note to self: pack ear plugs...) Question for the hotel: Did you consider putting lighting in the shower at all when you "renovated" the room? The shower had zero lighting and so was completely dark. I had to keep the bathroom door open and all the lights in the room on in order to see. Small point that I don't really care about but goes to quality - my room was never "turned down" for the night. I check out this morning. Pro: Great location. However, I really need to sleep and see in the shower and what IS it with this musty smell?

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable bed”
Reviews.Author: Swingdancers123
Reviews.Content: Really good location, nice night time window shopping, safe area.easy access to everything! Great discount last minute rate!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Foodies4
Reviews.Content: From the momemt we arrived until the time we checked out, the Westin staff did everything just right. The room was clean and spacious, the service timely and efficient, and the food and function rooms were spot on. Great location near many attractions and excellent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “city luxury”
Reviews.Content: I had a flight delay, and it was the airline that put us up in this hotel. I felt that I could ready enjoy it, as I didn't hace to pay the bill. The bed a queen size & was wonderful & the way it was dressed with lots of pillows & cushions. The room was so large that I have stated in smaller sites in 5star hotels. The mini bar, was nit just overt priced like other hotels, it was extortion, & I refused to indulge. Should I have the misfortune to have to return to Boston I would happily stay there.

Reviews.Title: “In the Heart of EVERYTHING”
Reviews.Author: anitavoltz
Reviews.Content: We had to attend a high school graduate in New Hampshire and decided to take the opportunity to stay in Boston and do some exploration. We flew into Logan Airport, jumped on the train that took us directly to the subway - - - couldn't have been EASIER! A quick 2 block walk from the subway and BOOM - Westin Copley Place! Right next to the Boston Public Library - easy walk to all sorts of restaurants and attractions (the concierge handed out maps to everyone with easy walking instructions)... and the hotel is attached to the Copley Place shopping center - with a Starbuck conveniently located on the way! We loved Boston and would go again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Room was Great.”
Reviews.Author: josiah97
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel due to a bid on Priceline as I was on a budget and traveling solo. I paid more than I usually do, but since this was downtown Boston this was expected. I was vistiing a friend who lived in Back Bay and thought Copley area would be a good base to go out from. My room was nice and updated as was my "heavenly" bed and I also had a water view. Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Convenient to just about everything I needed and I got a great deal. I also used the fitness facilities and found them to be nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortably beds, nice views, convenient location, but charge for internet”
Reviews.Author: lindaruthe
Reviews.Content: Comfortably beds, nice views above the 22nd floor, convenient location, but annoying daily charge for internet usage. This hotel seems to cater primarily to corporate conference attendees. Close to good restaurants and shops. Pleasant walking area. We came in late and wanted to check email for 10 minutes before going to bed. That would have cost us $14 a day, but the day was almost over. We went to the lobby where the wifi connection was so-so. First a message came up that said, usage is full, then after twenty minutes we were able to get on, with sometimes slow speeds.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable evening”
Reviews.Author: jbackus8746
Reviews.Content: My wief and I were at this hotel for a one day conference. . Although I understand in my head why parking is 46 dollars over night in Boston it still bothers me. We ate a the hotels restratunt as we were exhausted. The place is called Turners and it was excellent, not just fish which made me happy. The room is nicely furniished on the 16th floor there is a nice view of Boston. It is right in the center of Boston and very easy to find off of the Mass Pike.

Reviews.Title: “Just did some renovations! YEA!”
Reviews.Author: atraveljunky
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Westin Copley Place for many years. It is a very busy mostly convention go-ers hotel. Very convenient to many parts of town, well located and great that it's attached to the malls and convention center (especially when the weather is inclement). While the staff is always helpful and friendly and great amenities (gyms, salon, restaurants, etc), it was sorely in need of upgrade. Happy to say there is new carpet, furniture, etc! Yea!

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Super nice room. Attached to mall!”
Reviews.Author: 4boyzaz
Reviews.Content: Great stay here with my family for Christmas. It was COLD, so access to the mall inside was a great benefit. Walked to movies, Boston Common, etc. Can't beat the location. Better than the harbor because it isn't excessively touristy, yet easy to get to anything - the T is across the street - or even walking. The frozen pond was a huge bonus for the boys! Pool was small, but at least good for an hour of play!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: JPL19
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and comfortable. Staff efficient. Their own website says hi speed internet $9.95 per day in rooms ($12.95 in meeting rooms). Well, my room was $12.95 per day, though it did decrease if you got more than one day at a time. When I called for assistance setting up, associate was a little short and unconcerned. Did have to call for help as my room safe was left locked, security arrived promptly and politely.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: woofdoc31
Reviews.Content: A stellar example fo the Westin Brand. Can be a little difficult on the second floor with check in - not really a special line for SPG gold and platinum... Rooms are awesome - especially corner, junior suites...beautiful locations and incredible views. Being attached to Copley only adds to the charm and the ability to shop, have great sushi or chowder and get a feel for the Boston locals. Right off the Green Line of the "T" - transportation ANYWHERE in the city is ideal. If you are driving, the property is easily accessible off the Mass Pike and 95. Easy Easy Easy. Rooms get pricey, really pricey - got hit with some $400/night rooms mid summer - guess Boston is a HOT destination...but I didn't want to stay down by the waterfront in "convention land". No complaints, interested to see if they will do any "updating" or "facelifting"?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Rooms; Spotty Service”
Reviews.Author: Balad
Reviews.Content: Location: Â Shopping arcade with high-end retail connects this property and others to the Hynes Convention Center. Â Located in the heart of Back Bay, the Westin is also close to several T (subway) lines, the Boston Public library, and some great running and biking trails. Accommodations: Â Very nice rooms with breathtaking views from the higher floors. Â Great beds. Â The clock radios have iPhone docking stations so if one forgets the plug-in charger, no worries! Service: okay -- not great! Â I checked in to find pubes in the bathroom and a room phone with makeup on the receiver. Â The breakfast buffet had good food but the service sucked just about every morning. Â The servers were so slow with drink refills that I had to refill my own juice and water two mornings in a row. Â And, for $20 the buffet should include an omelette station, it doesn't. Only my 15 percent conference discount made the price tolerable. Lastly, I want to commend management for keeping the hotel guests apprised of developments during the little East Coast Earthquake. Â The tremor caused the all but one of the hotel elevators to shut down making my 33rd-floor room tough to access after lunch. Â The manager sent no less than three voicemail blasts to guests during the afternoon, the last of which let guests know when all elevators were back online. Overall, a pretty nice place, I would stay here again if I needed to be close go the convention center.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous views. A keeper.”
Reviews.Author: Bookshelfish
Reviews.Content: This Westin has incredible views up and down the Charles River. Book a corner suite facing the river and you will see from Fenway Park to Trinity Church to Beacon Hill to Boston Public Garden to the harbour - honest. The suites are spacious and decorated in clean lines (very Metropolitan) with great seating areas. Nothing fancy but very comfortable. The bathrooms are very small, dark and disappointing - more Holiday Inn than Westin. Seems crazy, as the suites are so big. You are better off eating elsewhere as the hotel restaurants are mediocre, but as you are in Copley Square, your choices are limitless. I am a very picky traveller who was not given a choice of hotels first time around but I must say that for the price, the Westin is a good buy and I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Palermo1994
Reviews.Content: Great location for shopping!!! Staff was great. Hotel was very clean. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “clean and comfortable, would stay again”
Reviews.Author: bullo55
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and comfortable. Being on the 25th floor we had a great view over the city. The location was good. There are bus stops and a underground station across the road. It is a 10 minute walk to the oldest botanical park in the US, and 30 minutes to the waterfront. We did not visit the restaurant, but did visit the bar, where we ordered food. The food was good. The beer was a little more expensive than the other places we visited, but the bar was nice. Just make sure you hold on to your drink. When the waitress asked if we wanted another beer, she took our glasses with her even though they were not finished. The hotel does not provide an airport shuttle, and they charge for internet service. Being so high up my cell phone would not work. But the view more than made up for that.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Cap93
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Boston on many occasions in many different hotels. The Westin Copley was the best combination of accommodation and service that I've experienced. As a senior leisure traveller with my grandchildren, I've found Boston to be one of the friendliest and most helpful big cities in the United States and Europe.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and underdelivering”
Reviews.Author: ginatufano
Reviews.Content: Totally NOT a 4 star hotel. No idea how they got that rating. Location is good, everything after that is downhill. Service was abysmal. Lots of 'not my job' going on. 40 minutes for bags to be brought up, room never cleaned consistently, always took @ least 3 people pointing to figure out how to get car from valet, etc, etc, etc. I began to refer to it as the Holiday Inn. It is a solid 2-3 star hotel. Way overpriced. Add to that 46/per night to park and you have a stay at the Westin. Not sure who they paid to get the 4 star rating, but let's hope they treat them better they treat the guests.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYC102005
Reviews.Content: Rooms are clean and comfortable. Extremely convenient location - there is a Starbucks just off of the lobby of the hotel, it's connected to the Copley mall and steps away from Trinity Church and Newbury street. I've stayed at several hotels in the area and this is the best value. They also allow dogs to stay at a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Solid 4-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melwyjak
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 3 nights. We've stayed before, knew what to expect and love the central location. We had two adjoining rooms â€“ 2 queens and one king which worked well for our family of 4. CONS: I forgot just how minuscule the bathrooms are so we were happy to have 2. The toilets are super loud and donâ€™t flush well so you have to flush 2-3 times (eliminating any water conservation, a total waste). I couldnâ€™t sleep one night and could hear toilets flushing all around. The smell of cigarette smoke permeated the hallways â€“ donâ€™t think they enforce non-smoking rules. Rooms are generic with only one sitting chair so youâ€™ll have to sit/eat on the bed if thereâ€™s more than one person. Housekeeping did a terrible job of making the beds â€“ bottom sheets always came up. Why do they not use fitted sheets?! These beds were not very heavenly compared to the Trump/Ritz beds and sheets and towels were average quality (but we didnâ€™t pay Trump/Ritz prices so it was fine). Charged for mini-bar items we didnâ€™t eat/drink. Recommend previewing room charges on TV prior to leaving. Sensored snacks/drinks are in plain site so, of course, my son simply touched something and we were charged. They actually have two bottles of plain water sitting on the dressers appearing complimentary â€“ noted in teeny tiny print they are $6 each! Beware the onsite Enterprise Rent-A-Car will deny you a car if you want to use a debit card even if you have reservations in advance (and website says they take debit). We told them to charge thousands on it until we returned the car because we CHOOSE to pay cash but guy (Fareed?) was rude, sent us on a wild goose chase around Prudential w/ our bags to be turned away again. The foreigners were getting cars all day long. Enterprise has forever lost my business. Anyone can get a credit card but actually having cash in the bank is a bad thing?! It turned out better in the end as we took a relaxing Peter Pan bus from South Station to the Cape/Vineyard and saved several hundred dollars. You donâ€™t need a car in Boston, T and cabs will get you anywhere. It was nice to have indoor pool for kids but it was skeevyâ€¦.loads of infants, not clean. PROS: Central location. T across the street, restaurants everywhere. I always enjoy the city views. Room service was slow but decent. On-site business center allowed us to print boarding passes for no charge â€“ quite the surprise because they really nickel and dime you here. Boston is wonderful â€“ lived there many years but we love pretending to be tourists every year and staying in the city. The kids prefer touristy Faneuil Hall area better but Mom likes the shopping mall attached to hotel, Newbury Street and restaurants in the Back Bay. If you have time, walk the city - down to the Charles River, through the Public Garden, down to Harbor and get a good feel for this quaint city. The kids wanted to do the duck boat tour and have to admit it was quite fun even though we're from Boston. If you can, check online for good pre-paid rates â€“ we did months in advance and for the cost paid, we have no major complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous view of the Charles River!”
Reviews.Author: donnainnapoli
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a lovely stay at the Westin at Copley Place. The rooms were clean, well maintained, and quiet. The service was excellent! I highly recommend requesting a room with a view of the Charles River. Stunning! *not a great place for young children.*

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: highlandspring
Reviews.Content: Well,little character(didn't,expect otherwise) but very clean top notch service, and great location. Beds extremely comfortable Stayed with my wife and daughter and would recommend without hesitation

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: pk_aroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in July with my family. The rooms are spacious and nice. The location was great. But the service was terrible. The receptionists and the concierge were very unfriendly! We were surprised because we had expected more from a Westin hotel!

Reviews.Title: “would go back”
Reviews.Author: ratpackfan
Reviews.Content: arrived early and was told leave a number to call, when room was ready they would call. never recieved a call. Went back to check in 3 hours later. had to wait 20 mins. got a room on the 28th floor. room was great and had a great view of the charles river and prudential building. bed was comfy great sleep. sensor in fridge was sensitive. but front desk changed the charges. parking was $46 , but expected when staying in boston. the internet was around $13. Stayed other places was free. grocery was nearby , good for picking things up that you needed. business centre was helpful and great view of boston. valet was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “Everyone was so nice!!”
Reviews.Author: Pauline S
Reviews.Content: What stands out in my mind the most from my stay was EVERYONE, in every department was so nice!! From the front desk, to the bellhops to the valets, everyone was so nice and helpful, good eye contact and a genuine smile. When I checked in, the remote control for my television wasn't working, so I called downstairs and in less than 5 minutes, someone came to change the batteries. The front desk also called to follow up that I was happy with my room & they serviceman came, which no hotel I've ever been to has done. The lobby is big, with lots of couches to hang out in while waiting for friends and the downstairs bar had a good lively crowd and good service. While I'm on it, the breakfast buffet was EXCELLENT. Our waiter was very cordial and they had awesome breakfast wraps...yum! The gym was pretty big and their equipment was all high quality (I've been to a lot of gyms) and well maintained. Their hot tub and swimming pool are indoor and next to the gym, and my only complaint about the whole place is that the hot tub did not get hot enough. What made up for it is the heavenly shower w/the 2 showerheads and the super comfortable bedding...I slept so well and had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynWillow
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice, and I would definitely stay here again. Room was spacious and nicely furnished and decorated. The lobby bar is nice. Breakfast buffet is pretty good. Concierge is extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, Hotel as expected”
Reviews.Author: ChrisM
Reviews.Content: Have found Westin's to be very similar in large cities. Great beds but charged for everything. Internet was over 10$ per room/night, parking 46$/day. I am also tired of starbucks being served throughout these hotels. The concierge recommendations were very pushy and not great suggestions. Did better on our own. The service in the room was limited. Asked for extra towels every day. They only gave us 3 in our room of 3 people and 2 in room with 2 people. They would not give us adjoining rooms even though I booked 2 months in advance but they were next to each other. The location of this hotel is excellent though. Breakfast (of course not included) was way too expensive (more than 20$/person) so we went to Au bon pain every morning which was very close by through the first covered bridge. The hotel is attached to the prudential center mall by covered bridges. There is a Dunkin donuts in the Shaw grocery store. The Duck tour pick up is very close as is a lot of great restaurants on Newbury street. There is a T stop for the green line close by. The North end is a very quick cab ride but cost about 14-16$ plus an extra 6$ for a party of 5. Overall good location but after staying in 3 different Westin's, still not a huge fan. Would stay again but have to swallow all the extras on the bill.

Reviews.Title: “couldn't really fault it”
Reviews.Author: Angela36hpw
Reviews.Content: We have just stayed 3 nights at this hotel. I was worried after reading some of the reviews, but I have to say that it was as good as a hotel this large could be. We prefer smaller hotels but were very satisfied with this one.The room was very large, the bed very comfortable, and the room was cleaned early each day, while we were at breakfast. The checkin and concierge staff were very helpful. We were on floor 13 and could see the Charles river from there. The location is good, and the adjoining shopping centre is useful to eat in especially if it is raining. I was disappointed to have to pay for using a computer as the other hotels we stayed in provided free use. However we were told it was $5 for 15 minutes, but then found out too late that it is now $6 per day, which is much better. The Public Library opposite is amazing, - don't miss it. The ceilings and rooms are beautifully decorated, and there are some very interesting exhibitions there.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible courtesy by personnel at the lobby desk”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen B
Reviews.Content: I met the niece of a very good friend on checking in, Erica Hollner. She was so pleasant, she sent a dish of fruit and mineral water to my room with a lovely card, it just made my stay there. She went above and beyond to ensure great customer service. Her roomate did as well when I was checking out, Laura, I don't know her last name. She was courteous and helpful, dividing up my room expenses separately for my travel expenses. I have and will continue to recommend your hotel to my peers. Beautiful rooms, great food, conference rooms have comfortable chairs!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Westin Copley”
Reviews.Author: pearlgirl22
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel for a weekend in Boston. It is really convenient to everything in the city. Infact, it is somewhat of a midpoint of the North and South ends. It is one block from Boylston St. and two blocks from Newbury St. Check-in took a little longer than I would have expected, but that is my only complaint. There was about a 10 minute wait to do so. Everything else was great and I would highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Improving with an eye toward customer service”
Reviews.Author: ilovemanhattanNyc
Reviews.Content: This is a big hotel that serves a lot of people and those traveling for conferences, so you get a big hotel vibe. That said, the customer service was amazing. They did a wonderful job of tending to me as a Starwood Platinum member. Room service was timely, as was everything else. They even manage the crazy check-in line well for Starwood regulars. The management has put an emphasis on customer service recently, and it shows.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: Love2travel630
Reviews.Content: After reading other TripAdvisor reviews we made our reservation at the Westin. We didn't want to spend a fortune on cabs or sit on the T all day. But the Westin Copley Place was a perfect location... Steps from the T, minutes from great resaurants and tourist attractions. It was quiet at night for peaceful sleeping. We only took the T once, and walked everywhere else. We will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: ACole_11
Reviews.Content: This hotel was really great. It is in the heart of Back Bay, the best place to stay in Boston if you are able to pick the location of your time in Boston. We were close to all the major sights, most within walking distance. We were steps away from the T train and we had too many restaurants around us, it made it hard to pick just one. The hotel staff were very friendly and knowledgeable about their city and Natalie )the concierge) was fantastic, giving me a running map to follow and great restaurant advice for my husband and I. Although it was a bit out of our price range, plus you have to pay for parking (44 US a day), this hotel was totally worth it. I used the very well stocked fitness room twice and was provided with towels, water and fruit. As well, the cleaning staff were very nice to us when we asked for extra towels because I was training heavily for a marathon. Loved this hotel and would go back to it anytime I went back to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Terrible Customer Service.”
Reviews.Author: tiborjebus
Reviews.Content: I wish I could say that I had a great stay. While the room was very nice and the location great, I'm afraid the customer service left much to be desired. A 30 minute wait for check-in to begin with (leading my travel partner to name the hotel "The Waitin' Copley Place." And now I'm in the midst of trying to get an answer for why the bill slipped under my door differs from the amount charged to my credit card. Two calls to the hotel's finance department have gone unanswered. The shower is dreadful, too - next to no water pressure and a clogged drain. My counsel? Stay in the Copley neighborhood though not at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding 'big' hotel . . .”
Reviews.Author: TravelingScholar60
Reviews.Content: I usually prefer smaller boutique hotels in larger cities, but my work has brought me to The Westin Copley Place multiple times, and I've been very satisfied with my stays here, including especially this most recent one. Our plane to Boston was late arriving, and we didn't check in until close to midnight, at which time we were given a complimentary upgrade to a "junior suite" on one of the top floors. This may well have been the nicest hotel room we have ever stayed in (certainly one of the top five!): spectacular views of the Charles River and Beacon Hill as well as all of downtown and Cambridge to boot, through large panoramic windows. The "suite" was actually one large--very large--room, with a comfortable couch and chairs, the always reliable Westin bed, and thorough room cleaning. It's a big hotel, with some of inevitable disadvantages of bigness (very busy concierges, congestion at the front desk, overcrowded bar), but these are mitigated by the fact that the hotel connects to a capacious shopping mall with excellent bars and restaurants a few minutes' walk away (including a Legal Seafood and Turner Seafood), so it's easy to escape the crowded bar for a more relaxing drink without going outside (and, when you do go outside, you're right at Copley Square, with even more unlimited choices). You can walk to the Boston Museum of Fine Arts (25 minutes or so), the Commons (ten minutes), and Beacon Hill, as well as to Hammersly's Bistro (a pleasant half-hour stroll), my favorite Boston restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: aguyinthe818
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night before driving down to the cape. Excellent location, walking distance to great shopping. Room was quiet, clean and very comfy with amazing views of the Charles from the 28th floor. Great bar too, though it's not open late, but MiniBar across the street is open until 2am. Check-in was flawless and fast, room was ready early, staff was very helpful. My only complaint is that the lighting in the bathroom was too dim.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nicely appointed rooms with good views!”
Reviews.Author: SteveNChrisSD
Reviews.Content: Had great view of Copley Plaza, Charles River to Cambridge and downtown skyline. Great location in the heart of Back Bay, Boston. Excellent choice anytime, but especially in the winter or spring when Boston weather can be harsh and unpredictable. Hotel is connected to the Copley Place Mall which also connects to Prudential center. Able to get to either Green or Orange line T stops without going outside, as well as many shops and restaurants within the malls, or use as passage way to travel several blocks while protected from the elements. Great starting point for most of your tourist ventures and easy to find your way back to from anywhere you go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Suite”
Reviews.Author: JeffandDes
Reviews.Content: The Westin was great hotel due to location and accomodation. Suite was great for meeting. Great view. Close to shopping at Copley and Newberry St. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “All about the location- very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: legalgal80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were so excited when we got this hotel at a great price on priceline at the last minute. My family was in Boston for a convention and staying at the Sheraton Copley, which like our hotel, was connected to the mall (but on the otherside). Check-in was very easy. There were no lines and they let us check in a little early. We decided to park at a garage located at 100 clarendon since we found a coupon online that saved us a lot. The garage ended up being only a block away and saved us big time since our car battery died the day we were leaving and they were quick to help us out. Our room was very nice and the bed was so comfortable that we are actually considering shelling out the $300+ to buy the comforter for our bed at home. The only complaint I have about the rooms are that they are very dark. Also, be careful not to touch any of the food or drink items in the room since they have electronic sensors that will charge you if you take something out just to look at it (which later became the butt of many jokes). We didnâ€™t use the pool (it looked very small) or the gym (which had some high tech. equipment). The lobby always smelled fishy. This might be because there is a sushi restaurant and fishery right when you walk in. Not a great smell, even if you are a fish lover like me. I do have to say we were really happy with the location of this hotel. It was right near Newbury Street, and within walking distance to the Freedom Trail. If you are staying here for a conference at the convention center, be prepared to do a lot of walking. I would estimate about 20 minutes each way. It is nice that you can walk to the convention center without going outside just by going through the mall. Seeing the Sheraton, I would have to say, I thought it was a nicer and more convenient location. However, if you get a good deal on the Westin, itâ€™s worth staying here. We were very satisfied with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay in Boston.”
Reviews.Author: Cokemonkey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a couple of friends for our first trip to Boston thanks to a great Hotwire deal. Really nice and quite posh compared to my usual accommodations in a major city. Staff was quite friendly and very helpful, with suggestions, directions and even a menu for a local restaurant. Service was fast and accurate. Beds were very comfortable, as was room in general...bonus points for crystal clear HD TV channels and in-room safe. Gym facilities were awesome and modern, right down to iPod hookups on treadmills. We really liked the option to be a bit more eco-friendly and not have all of our linens and towels changed every day for our 6 day stay. My only 2 (very minor) complaints were: -location, it's great and close to Newbury St., but if you're looking for food after 9pm (which we often are), it's a bit difficult to find. -valet parking was a might expensive for our tastes; there is underground parking a 3min walk away which costs $10 less per night, so we moved our car after the first evening All-in-all, these are more things to be aware of should you stay here and were far outweighed by the pluses of this hotel. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel with no personal touch”
Reviews.Author: SoniaM_11
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from Boston and spent a week at the Westin Copley Place. First the good, the hotel's location is great, very easy to get around and lots of shopping nearby. Also the famous Newbury Street just a few minutes walk away. Concierge desk can get busy especially in the mornings. However, they will do their job and not anything extra. I was in a hurry one morning and needed one page printed off the internet for discounted parking nearby and they refused to assist with this and said I needed to go to the business centre and do it there, where they were charging $1.50 per page to print. Valet parking at the hotel is $46 per 24 hours, we parked at 100 Clarendon Street across the road for $19 for 24 hours (print off discount coupons found online). Finally check your bill thoroughly when checking out. We were told we would not be charged for internet use in the rooms or the extra bed (we are starwood gold members) but both were on our bills. Also one night the beds were not made up in one room but by the time I complained, housekeeping had left. We were told we would be charged half for that night because of this. However, this was again on our bill and we had to explain the full story all over again. Also some items from room service were wrongly charged but all these wrong charges were reversed once explained. I requested for bottled water from housekeeping and was told that it was no problem and we would get a bottle every night but it never came. All in all, an ok stay. Would look for a hotel with a more personal touch on my next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “Best view of Boston!”
Reviews.Author: Acarlso
Reviews.Content: Loved the Fourth of July fireworks right from our room. Walk to mall and Copley Square. Even close enough to Charles River. Best Boston experience we have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel rooms, but slow, slow service”
Reviews.Author: AndrewW2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in May and just this week in July. I had a great room each time, renovated and very spacious. Especially with the Westin bed, these hotel rooms cannot be beat. Bad first impression in May when there was a huge queue just to check-in. There are two large check-in counters with a large space in the middle. There are no queuing barriers or guidance so guests just queued every which way. It was a mess. There was no one manning the right hand side of the desks, that being the Gold and Platinum desks. There were only 2 agents manning the check-in for the entire queue. They appeared stressed. July â€“ problems with check-in all over again and more queues â€“ really understaffed. My key failed to work when I got to my room. I didnâ€™t want to go back down to reception. I called from the phone on my floor and someone (surprisingly) came up quickly and let me in. I went down later to the gym and coming back up, the key didnâ€™t work again. I went to the lobby in my gym clothes and the queue was just as long as hours before. I instead went to the concierge for help just to get some help with my key. She told me that she couldnâ€™t do anything and I need to join the queue. I told her that was ridiculous. I realized that she might not have had access to the electronic key system, but good customer service would have been to help me with this quick query. Instead she told me just to jump the queue â€“ itâ€™d â€œbe okâ€�. I really didnâ€™t feel comfortable doing that. So, really no points for customer service of just plain taking some initiative! Reception for check-in really needs some improvements. Just some more staffing would be a good start. Gym facilities are quite good but bit dated free weight equipment. Pool and wet facilities look good but didnâ€™t try them. Breakfast is quite nice with a nice buffet and fast service. Free WIFI in the lobby is appreciated. Hotel is well connected to Pru Centre and other shopping and in a great area. Room amenities are quite nice and if you have a renovated room, itâ€™s terrific. Opt out of housekeeping for 500 points which is worth it, especially as you donâ€™t get any SPG points if you book via an online travel agency, Expedia, Hotwire, etc. The Westin does a good job as an oversized chain hotel but reception really needs some attention. Iâ€™d still recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly acceptable”
Reviews.Author: William_N
Reviews.Content: Location: a pretty central location. Unfortunately, the hotel is connected by walkway to about three shopping malls, so on our first day we didn't manage to get outdoors until well into the afternoon as a result of the wife's "short detour". On the plus side, it's about a five minute run to the Charles River which has a beautiful (if rather cold) riverside jogging path. Check-in experience: not the quickest check-in process - there were only two receptionists around despite several people being in the queue. Room: if one were being picky, the rooms are in need of an overhaul. However, they are perfectly functional and the beds were the usual comfortable Starwood ones. Surrounding area: there's a convenience store three minutes' walk away across Copley Square. Check-out experience: not the quickest check-out process once again. Surely in a university town one would be able to get a few more students to work as part-time receptionists?

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay at a nice place.”
Reviews.Author: VisitorsFromBelgium
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley Place is locate near Copley Square, the Boston Public Library, and has a shopping mall that connects to the Prudential complex. Nearby you find also a stop of the Boston Hop-On Hop-Off Trolley Tour (Trolley) The hotel itself is a nice, new looking hotel, whit bars, a nice breakfast and a Starbucks in the hotel. The room was well equipped and clean, as well as the bathroom. Staff was helpful and friendly. More info about our vacations in the USA, you can find at our website: http://www.visit-usa.be

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: spin4lyf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night with my husband and 3 kids. The rooms are fabulous. The beds are queens, not fulls, which is important for me. A full size bed is big enough, really, for one adult or two small kids, but that's it. We ate dinner at The Palm which is right in the lobby. It was pricey but delicious. This hotel was in the middle of Copley Square so there is a ton of great shopping and restaurants. It also wasn't far from Fenway Park. Service was excellent. We will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great but chilling!”
Reviews.Author: Visitor43833
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a fantastic location and Copley Square is a great place to stay no matter where you are going in Boston. As other reviewers have noted, the entrance is a bit daunting, dodging cabs as you enter and then need to go up one level for check-in. The rooms are superb. My room (1028) had a great view and it was very spacious and clean. The only downside were two aspects of the room: (1) The windows (external) were really dirty and (2) the toilet. Not sure how I can delicately describe the toilet other than to say the seat is either too low or the water in the bowl is too high. When a man sits on the toilet it can be a startling and chilling experience. You can read between the lines. Because of its size, amenities, value and location, I very much recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajh169
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a week during a conference and had no complaints. Staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel itself is in a wonderful location, and we could walk to the river and Newbury Street. Having a large shopping mall attached was great on the hot days when it was too humid to go outside, or when I had to run out to buy something I had forgotten to pack. I had a mini suite on a high floor, and the room and view was wonderful, including the super comfortable heavenly bed. The bathroom was a little small and dark, but manageable. Housekeeping seemed to come as soon as I left each morning, which was great because I was often running back to my room for things during the day and was happy to always see it made up. The minibar selections could have been more plentiful, but was fine overall. Room service provided quick service, and the portions were very large and delicious. The hotel bar was nice for a quick drink or a bite to eat, and everybody in our group enjoyed the food there. As for the conference that was put on at the hotel, everything went off without a hitch. The hotel staff did a great job of putting on a large event, and the meeting rooms were modern and comfortable. The only issues with planning a large event here are that the catered meals were average at best (minus the delicious desserts), and there did not seem to be enough restrooms for a large meeting. Everybody resorted to running back to their rooms instead of waiting in long lines.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - Beware of the honor bar”
Reviews.Author: Jay201146
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Very friendly staff. If you so much as pick something up from the honor bar and place it back within seconds it shows up on the bill. Staff is nice to fix it but its a bit embarrassing. All in all great location and a Very nice hotel. Bar 10 staff is not the friendliest and the service I poor. Again the staff that really matters is great !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business/vacation location”
Reviews.Author: grommit
Reviews.Content: Downtown Boston. Easy access from the Mass Pike. Convenient to the T and airport. Excellent rooms - large and clean.. Large conference rooms. Spotty wi-fi when multiple users try to access the net. Nice covered walkway to the various shopping malls. Excellent in-house catering. Top-notch planners. Nice exercise area. Fast valet parkig (albeit a bit pricey).

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: sb_2004
Reviews.Content: Th title says it all. If you want to feel connected to a city when travelling then I highly recommend this hotel. We could not have asked for a better location - you certainly didn't have to go far to find what you were looking for! We had access to many shops that we could travel to by walking which is even better because you get a real sense of being caught in the whirlwind of the hustle and bustle of the city. The staff were great and were very accommodating to families with children - a real blessing!! It was clean, polished, and very safe!! Not a flaw in sight!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great part of town”
Reviews.Author: SarahMpls
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business conference. Overall it was a great stay. At check in, the staff was helpful. Going up to my room I found that the room I was assigned to - though the hotel is non-smoking - smelled very strong of smoke. I called to the front desk and they were able to switch me to another room (though with a lesser view of the city). The new room I move to was nice, though not very quiet at night.
