The sound of the pipes is loud and woke me up in the morning when other neighbors began taking showers. It was so loud I was not able to go back to sleep. One other con about the hotel - the conference rooms were kept FREEZING cold. I wish I had both a sweater and a jacket during my conference, but because the weather was over 90 degrees outside I didn't anticipate needing those things! The pros about the hotel: great location, connection to shopping and restraunts, good restaurants and bar on site, coffee shop on site, great beds, updated decor. I would stay here again, but next time I'll bring ear plugs, air freshners and a sweater!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Katrinar787
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for one night (although our relatives had stayed there the week before with nothing, but good things to say). The room was large, comfort for four people. It was extremely clean and the beds were very comfy! The service was prompt and friendly. The biggest perk: its great location. We had a beautiful view of the city from our window. The hotel is a bit pricey, but if you watch for deals its manageable!

Reviews.Title: “More wrong than bad feng shui, and deserving of poor rating at this price point”
Reviews.Author: Big_Foof
Reviews.Content: I admit, I don't like hotels with pedestrian unfriendly access like this one, where you basically have to walk across the parking garage driveway and through the porte cochere to get inside. I also don't like the fact that the lobby is a level higher and you have to navigate several sharp underlit corners to get to the check-in. So let's put aside the design issues (which do not end in the lobby) and go straight to the room. I have never stayed in a hotel charging north of $250 a night that provided so little in-room info about the hotel and surrounding area. No services directory. No area map. Only a lousy paid-advertising Boston book with no focus on the area. And not even a phone book. I could, however, have bought linens from the Westin Home Collection. Is it really too much to spring for copies of 1 or 2 local magazines that cover entertainment and dining options? And the capper was finding some very long hair on the shower wall the next morning; a surprise I hope not to encounter even in any motel. Maybe I should overlook these shortcomings. After all there were two small warm bottles of Poland Spring water available in the room for $5 apiece. Poor service and price gouging is an odd service philosophy.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent hotel overall”
Reviews.Author: pottering_pasty
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfy rooms. Great service with fast check-in and check out. Get a high room - both for the views and reducing street noise. Extremely well located

Reviews.Title: “Conference hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Navajorug
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the hotel while in Boston for a seminar and professional meeting. The hotel was clean and well-appointed. Our room had a gorgeous view of the Charles River, Copley Square, and Cambridge. Boston is really a pretty city. We were lucky to get upgraded to a "junior suite", for some reason, and the room was large and comfortable. I loved the location, on the edge of Back Bay, near the Public Gardens, a short walk to the Charles River and the running paths, and very convenient to several T stops. Fenway Park was just a couple stops away. Lots of cafes, restaurants and shops in the neighborhood. A good place to walk around. The hotel connects to the Copley Place shopping mall, which as far as I can tell is just like every other high-end shopping mall in America. Certainly not a draw for me. Our bed was comfortable, maybe a bit too fluffy. I'd prefer a firm mattress and firm pillows with less of a featherbed feel. Staff cleaned the room but it was often late in the day that they got to us; routinely, housekeeping would appear about 4 p.m. or so. So returning to the room between outings meant coming back to unmade beds, uncleared dishes, etc. Maybe they were busy. Overall, this is a big conference hotel and it did well at fulfilling that role. I wouldn't mind if my organization picked it for future events.

Reviews.Title: “Basically good; hardly luxurious”
Reviews.Author: Steve N
Reviews.Content: The room was fine; nothing special even though it supposedly was a "preferred level" room. Indoor pool was ok; a bit small. Nice workout facility. Location is really great if you're doing anything near Prudential Center/Fenway. Warning, they charge you for everything

Reviews.Title: “Staff goes above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: Jallington
Reviews.Content: I recently contacted the Westin Copley Plaza about helping me out with our engagement night. I spoke with the front office manger Michelle and we kept in contact for a couple weeks before the night. She gave me advice on what they could put in the room to make everything special. Just after I proposed we checked in. The woman at the desk clearly knew what was going on and once she saw the ring on her finger she was just as excited as my fiance. When we got to the room, there waiting for us was white wine on ice, flowers, chocolate covered strawberries, and a congratulations card from the hotel (a very nice touch.) They gave us a room on one of the upper floors with a fantastic view of the river. I want to take thank the entire Westin Copley Place staff for doing so much to help add to our special evening. I would highly suggest seeking the assistance of the Westin staff if you are considering setting up anything similar.

Reviews.Title: “sunny chen & renato kriste was Awesome, Amazing service and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: S8Searcy
Reviews.Content: service i got from hotel was very very good. i had billing error on hotel stay when call & explain to accounting dept. they told me to talk to front desk manager. just one phone call i talk to sunny chen and she done all rest the work for me. i like the staff and service when stayed for 2 nights. All in all it was a great experience! Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Near Everything”
Reviews.Author: Kaysiah-chan
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels near Hynes Convention Center, I decided to try this one. We were flying in and didn't want to rent a car and knowing Boston's train system, I didn't think we would need to (and we didn't). We took the train here and walked no problem to the hotel. Being a Starwood member and noting when making our reservations that we were here for a special occasion, they were able to upgrade us for free! It's by and connected to the Hynes Convention Center and the malls which made things easy for shopping and eating. Since it's close to a train stop, we were able to travel around Boston pretty easily to places we wanted to see and explore. The room was clean and we had a nice view. The internet is not free in the room, only in the lobby which is kind of inconvenient. Beware of the food and drinks on those sensors in the room. There's plenty of drinks and alcohol in the fridge and snacks but everything is sensor activated and has a warning that if the item is moved (even if not eaten or drunk) then it will be charged to the room. I think this is good to know as a warning for people who have children. We did not use the pool, eat at the hotel's restaurant/bar, or use the room service so I can't comment on that. We did not have any issues with bed bugs.

Reviews.Title: “One disappointing incident”
Reviews.Author: Ops
Reviews.Content: I was in the MA area for business recently and wanted to stay in Boston for the weekends. The Westin Copley was attractive because it is attached to a shopping mall and is located in the main shopping area with tube/train stations nearby. The first weekend was fine, no issues. The room is a good size and clean. The bathroon is TINY but that was not an issue. The second weekend I was joined by my sister. I called up beforehand to specifically request a twin room. I would have switched hotels if a twin room was unavailable. I was told that a twin room was available and my booking was changed to reflect that. My sister arrived first and she was told that there were no twin rooms but that they would give us a rollaway for no extra cost. When I arrived late that night and went to speak to the front desk, apparently speaking to the manager. She was apologetic but could not understand why I was making a fuss. I tried to explain to her that I had taken the effort to call them to ensure that a twin room was available and that I wouldn't have stayed at that hotel if one of us had to sleep on a rollaway. There are plenty of other hotels in Boston and the Westin is not particularly cheap ($300 plus tax per night). She just kept saying, in effect, that there was nothing she could do. Her tone and attitude really annoyed me. There was no offer to help in any other way or to offer some sort of goodwill gesture. In the end I had to suggest that they moved us a twin room the following day. What particularly annoyed me was that she tried to place some blame on my sister for the current situation which was totally unprofessional. She was more worried about covering her own backside than making sure the customer was happy. The following day, I had decided that we would just stay put in the room as I had been travelling for a while and really couldn't bear to repack and move to another room so we went to the front desk to inform them. That night, we got back to the hotel with a message that they had tried to move us but couldn't as our stuff hadn't been packed up. Just total incompetence. It was an unpleasant experience so I will not stay there again. It is in a very convenient location but there is a Sheraton, Marriott and Fairmont hotel all in the same location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Larrylnb
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Copely Westin for a conference. It was convenient to most everything, including downtown - subway, walking, cab. Rooms were very nice - spacious, clean, well decorated. Loved the single brew starbucks in the room! The only complaint is the honor bar in sensors. They went off easily and I was charges for things I didn't take, but the front desk quickly removed them from my bill. Great overall stay.

Reviews.Title: “Staff & Manager lie about bedbugs in hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandra60827
Reviews.Content: WARNING-AWFUL SERVICE, MANAGEMENT LIES. NEVER BOOK A NON-REFUNDABLE ROOM...YOU PROBABLY WON'T GET YOUR MONEY BACK EVEN IF THOUGH THERE ARE BEDBUGS IN THIS HOTEL. We found out this hotel had bedbugs the day we were driving up to the hotel. Two or three different people complained on the internet of bedbugs in the recent months and stated in no uncertain terms that the staff did not care and simply ignored them. Highly concerned, we called the staff to ask about these internet posts, having two young children with us. I asked if they exterminate for bedbugs and they adamantly said no. I pointed to the internet posts and they said the guests were lying. They then said a LONG LONG time ago, they exterminated and the problem went away. Then they denied they ever had bedbugs in the hotel. The story was not straight in the least. Then they said they rent the rooms around the bedbug infested room (this is crazy, since bedbugs are known to travel under baseboards and in the walls). They would not give me my money back, even as a starwood guest. I lost alot of money.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Birthday to Me!”
Reviews.Author: luvlacandi
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for my birthday and got an excellent deal on hotwire. The location was great and we loved the fact that we could rent a car on site (we drove up to Maine one day). We had dinner at Turner Fisheries and it was excellent! Overall it was a great stay. This is a very nice hotel and you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Very accomodating”
Reviews.Author: inapickle_11
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Westin Copley Place after having a bad experience with a hotel down the street from the Westin. The staff at the Westin was accomodating and went out of their way to meet all of our needs. Very clean; great service and a nice central location. I would definitely go back here next time I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “What happened to the Westin Copley Place”
Reviews.Author: BlueHorseshoe1
Reviews.Content: As a long time customer of this hotel for 20 years, we stayed here as we do for every year since the hotel opened back in the 80's. One of the reasons we stayhere versus the Marriott, next door is the comfort and luxury of this hotel. having undergone an extensive renovation, e rooms are cold and unwanting compared to last year. they had comfort and traded that in for uncomfortable furniture. The only positive was they upgraded the tv's. the staff really needs training. As a Starwoods Preferred guest, instead of being extended a late check out, we were told that this would now be a fee of $25 per hour. The excuse I received from Stephon, the front desk manager was that some employees lacked training ...boy is at an understatement! also, I had to pull teeth to get my complimentary morning newspaper. This hotel has become too expensive and snobby. what a shame for the 360 degree turnaround There are too many other hotels within a stone's throw that do have training in how to treat a customer and we recommend the Lenox, Marrriott or Mandarin. It seems like the Westin is getting away from remembering how to treat customers and is more interested in cutting back on the little things that made them tops in our book. after 20 yeRs we will be looking for another hotel to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: torontolive
Reviews.Content: Great stay in a great area, could walk everywhere from there. We left our jewelry box behind and the cleaning service turned it in!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Versailles2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in May for our son's graduation. The location was great and nearby restaurants were a bit expensive but the food was good. What I could not beleive was how the hotel nickle and dimed the guests for every single thing and I'm a SPG Gold Member . We ordered breakfast from room service because of limited time and were served powdered eggs with for scrambled eggs....disgusting, it cost almost $75.00 for breakfast for two and service charge and we didn't even receive fresh eggs. The breakfast was inedible, if they want to charge the prices they charge they certainly need to come up with higher quality food. The bathrooms are so small, swing a cat....not a chance do it at your own peril. We were charged for using the business center another chain which charges a fraction of the price lets guests use the business center at no charge...that would be Hilton. The concierge was there to stand behind the desk, not helpful at all. Shame on you Westin...what a disgrace, you will not be seeing me again. Find a hotel where you get what you pay for not where you feel ripped off when you leave.

Reviews.Title: “Easily! the best hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: paradise-ami
Reviews.Content: Everything about the Westin Copley worked for us. It was near everything and we found it easy to get around town. The rooms were great -Ours had an awesome view!--We used the hotel and liked Bar 10 as a place to relax and have a drink! - Check In was great -Massai really made us feel welcome--We attended a wedding and the catering was about the best we have ever had....and of course the Banquet room had windows overlooking the city! -it was a wonderful weekend..Thanks to everyone at The Westin!

Reviews.Title: “I stay here all the time...”
Reviews.Author: KittyGags
Reviews.Content: I travel to Boston frequently for work. The Westin has a very convenient Back Bay location--attached to the Pru and a quick walk to Newbury Street. The only problem I've EVER had here is getting a room when something is going on in town. They're always happy to check me in early and great with watching my luggage when I'm running from meeting to meeting on my check out day. And of course, they have the heavenly bed so I always get a great night's sleep! :)

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch and great location!”
Reviews.Author: passionate1217
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boston Copley Plaza in a junior suite riverview renovated room with my two adult kids. The room was top notch with two super comfortable queen beds, and a fold out sofa sleeper. The room had a great view and was nicely furnished. The service at the hotel was exceptional, and we were always greeted with a personal touch. The location of the hotel is perfect and convenient ,with walking distance to most everything the city has to offer. The hotel is attached to two great indoor malls, with every store that you could possibly want to shop in, along with great food options. This was my first time visiting Boston, and I was so happy I made the choice to stay at the Westin Copley Place! Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected, nicer than they needed to be.”
Reviews.Author: KiowaVT
Reviews.Content: I got this on Hotwire at a time when rates were oddly super high. I expected as a Hotwire user to be treated poorly. Instead, unlike Hilton where i feel like all my top level user perks are hidden or being retreated, these folks honored my status, and I had a great room and use of a great gym after fearing the busy moment in Boston would force me into a less glorious hotel. Kept up well, great room, great bed, pool if I had wanted, gym, and more all impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Expected way more”
Reviews.Author: happyyheatherr
Reviews.Content: Took us an hour to check in because the girl didn't know what she was doing, and she wasn't even nice or apologetic about it. The staff was pretty much indifferent to the guests, and if anything they seemed inconvenienced that anyone was staying in their hotel. Between booking the room and our arrival, the price went up. The room was nice enough and the beds were comfy. However, the air conditioning really didn't work that well. The thermostat didn't go lower than 60 and even at full blast all weekend, the room was barely cool. Continental breakfast was not included or even discounted, kind of ridiculous considering what we paid. Our keys stopped working and the people at the front desk blamed us for it - said we must have kept them next to our cell phones, which we did not. I don't expect the royal treatment, but nothing about the hotel was worth paying over three hundred a night and I would not stay here again. I flat out told the girl at the front desk that our stay could have been better and she didn't even ask why. I'm young and I'll be staying in a lot of hotels in my life, and I would not give my business to this establishment again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it :-)”
Reviews.Author: Erica_S
Reviews.Content: We drove to Boston on Memorial day to celebrate my birthday. Booked through Priceline at the great rate. I wrote to the hotel saying that it is our first trip to Boston and my b/day celebration. Got a very nice reply from the hotel manager and, upon arrival, upgrade to a Jr. suite. The view was spectacular !!! Very nice room, big and very comfortable.. Overall, the hotel was clean and the staff VERY helpful and friendly. Thank you for making our stay so enjoyable, we are tremendously grateful - Erica

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place!”
Reviews.Author: mgaddis011
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful and employees were very helpful, extremely friendly. Jen at the front desk made us feel very welcome with a warm friendly attitude. Room was spacious and very comfortable. Great location to shopping and Back Bay. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Good 4 star hotel in Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: Cincinnatus1
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley Place is in an excellent location -- in Back Bay, connected to the Copley Place complex of restaurants and shops, one block from the subway, and 2 blocks to Newbury St. shopping. I did not use the workout or business facilities, but the room was clean and well appointed. Internet use in the room will cost you $10/day. The only downside to this hotel is its cost. 4 star hotels in Back Bay are expensive, and this is no exception. Bottom line: This is a solid 4 star hotel with a great location.... an easy choice if you are traveling for business. However, if you are traveling on a personal budget, you will probably need to use Priceline or Hotwire to get the rate significantly below the $200 mark.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice staff - average rooms & average facilitie”
Reviews.Author: Wineten
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very small. Also, biggest complaint is hinged doors swing shut making a slamming noise. This means in the AM, around 5:00, you start to get a cacophony of door slamming, so you don't need to worry about setting your alarm.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: prockCt
Reviews.Content: We booked through Priceline and this is the hotel we got, we were very pleased! The front desk staff was very friendly. The room was clean and bed was comfortable. The best part was the location...right near the T stop, one block over from Newbury St, about a 20 min or so walk to Fenway and a short cab ride ($9-$12) to Quincy Market. It does cost $44 per night for parking though, but I've paid that in NYC for only a few hours, so I guess it isn't that bad for a big city. When we checked out, they held our bags while we walked around the city some more and it didn't cost any extra for parking. The room cost on their website seems a little high, we paid half that. But overall, this was a very nice place and I would stay there again at the price I paid. Oh, and not that we used it, but room service was available 24 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: “Fit our needs perfectly”
Reviews.Author: Rebekajean
Reviews.Content: Booked on Hotel.com and was very pleased with the resulting hotel. We lived in the area 30 years ago so we were already familiar with the lay of the land as Boston proper doesn't change all that much. It is close to the T, lots of eateries in the area, walking distance to the park, Copley Plaze, downtown, Theater District and local shopping. The Westin is an older hotel but it has been updated and nicely kept. The service was friendly, check in was fast even though there were dozens of people checking in and out, the room was quiet and it was the perfect location for our two day stopover pre-cruise to Montreal. I wouldn't hesitate to stay again. The only down side is that they would not give us Starwood points because we booked third party. Small price to pay for the excellent deal we got on hotels.com.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: traveltina
Reviews.Content: Pros: We liked the Copley Square location and relatively easy access to the T. From the hotel we walked to Charles Street, the Boston Common & the Public Gardens, strolled Newbury & Boylston Streets. Plenty of dining in the area. The rooms & hallways were freshly re-done. We had gorgeous views from our room (Charles River, Hancock Tower) Cons: Lobby was under renovation, long wait to check in at front desk; Copley Place is a bit outdated decor wize & there is a greasy/stale smell when you enter the "mall" area near where the huge waterfall was & the escalator is.

Reviews.Title: “Refreshed Westin at Copley Place”
Reviews.Author: JRWB1960
Reviews.Content: My selection of this hotel was largely price driven. I stayed here in 08 and found it to be too big and corporate and in need of an updating. I was pleasantly surprised this time to see that many fresh design features have been added to the rooms. They are quite nice. The usual Westin expectations (comfortable bed and bath, friendly professional staff etc) are met here. Westin does a good job of making the experience familiar from property to property. Even the smell is the same. it's a good smell--the white tea theme they have been on for a few years now. The location is great it is steps from all the action in Boston. The lobby adjoins the Copley Place Mall which is a pleasant high end establishment with quite a few restaurants and bars. When the weather is inclement (as it often is in Boston) you can entertain yourself there without going outside. There's a pool and a spa too. One caveat: it doesn't seem like they have revamped all the floors but I am sure that's in the works.

Reviews.Title: “A little underwhelmed.”
Reviews.Author: acswift
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline when it was becoming obvious that I had waited too long to book during a holiday weekend. The prices were all inflated and the hotels I really wanted to stay at were already booked. I am allergic to feather down, so earlier in the week before my stay I contacted the folks at Starwood via their web chat application since their email application on their website was not working. They assured me I would have a room prepared with hypoallergenic bedding. I checked in early 5/28/11 around 8AM. I did not expect a room to be ready and really just wanted to leave our bags. When I asked to confirm my request for a hypoallergenic room, the gentleman assisting me stated (in a rude tone of voice) "When you book on Priceline we can't see those requests, you have to contact us directly." When I stated that I had in fact contacted them directly he just shrugged and stated that there was going to be a wait of about an hour and requested that I leave my cell phone number and they would call when it was ready. Around noon, I decided to call them since at that point it had been more than an hour. I explained the situation to the front desk attendant that answered my call, and she said that there was a room available with a king bed on the 25th floor. I asked if it had been prepared with hypoallergenic linens and she acted confused (as clearly it wasn't in the system, still)... Upon my check in I was given a room on the 34th floor with a fantastic view and it had been prepared appropriately. The view was amazing and the room was spacious. The transitional foyer with hardwood floors looked as if they had never been cleaned, and sadly so did the shower. There was thick soap scum on the shower wall, and the bathroom was quite dimly lit. I also narrowly escaped gashing my foot open on a piece of glass that was on the floor. The climate control worked perfectly and no complaints with the plumbing. The television was a decent size flat screen and we had no problems with that as well. The location was fairly good, being close to Newbury St., and Copley Sq T stop was right there. Lots of dining options in the neighborhood and on premises. We used the pool and whirlpool facilities, but they were on the small side, not very well kept, and full of children at all hours. Even though the whirlpool is restricted to people over the age of 16, it was constantly full of younger children. I guess you can only blame the parents for that... On our last morning before check out, around 11am the housekeeper burst into our room exclaiming "You're still here?" after I had said "Hello?" when I heard someone trying to open the door. When I said "Yes, we are still here!" she had the nerve to say "Well, when will you be leaving?" Honestly such a "high tech" operation should have a better system of alerting the staff when a room is vacant and when it is still occupied.

Reviews.Title: “Close to subway lines”
Reviews.Author: KeroppiQueen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for a couple days in February 2011. We booked the hotel through Priceline.com for $90/night. Normally, the cost is over $200/night. The location is excellent! The hotel is within the Copley area, and is 1 block away from the Boston Public Library and the Copley T-Line. In addition, the hotel is really close to the Prudential Shopping Center. I was able to check into the room before the check-in time. I didn't have to lug around my luggage all day. Our room was good, but it was older looking. The bathroom had marble floors and granite countertop. The shower needed some work, especially with replacing the shower head and cleaning out the grout. The shower head was orange around the water holes. The bed and pillows were comfy. If this room was supposed to be over $200/night, I would feel ripped off since I expected higher quality. Our room was close to the elevator, so it was a bit noisy. There was also construction either on the floor above or below us so that woke us up around 9am. During one of the early mornings (around 4am), someone must have pulled the emergency line since we woke up to a really loud intercom announcement that we may have to evaluate the building. Luckily we didn't have to evaluate in our pajamas. BTW- No free wifi in the rooms. You can get wifi in the lobby. I would consider staying here again due to the location. I'm sure that the hotel looks better now after the remodeling.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, great location, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: 14Roger
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. I stayed for 3 nights. It is a 4.5 star hotel with large rooms, great amenities, great location, etc. I would not hesitate to stay here again but did have a couple of small issues - see below. FYI - The taxi from the airport was around $40. I have almost no complaints about this hotel. It is everything I'd expect in a westin. The rooms were clean, they replaced bathroom amenities daily, beds were comfortable. I just have two complaints - one I wish they had better pillows rather than the ones that go flat when you put your head on them. I had to sleep with my arm under my pillow all night to prop my head up. The second - for some reason every night at 12:30am, perhaps there was a staff shift change, about 10 staff members, all hispanic ladies, seemed to gather outside our room and be chatting up a storm. The noise from the hall carries in really loud you'd have thought they were in our room. The first night we just put up with it but on the second night I opened the door to my room and they all hushed, a couple of them tried to make a break for it and scattered. On the third night of our stay there was a noticeable improvement as they seemed to have carried their conversation down the hall. This hotel is attached to the Prudential center complex, is only a block from 2 different subway lines, a block from trinity church, 5 min walk to lots of restaurants and shops. The business center allowed free boarding pass printing but you had to ask for it. I think they otherwise charge.

Reviews.Title: “For people on an expense account. Way overpriced for us ordinary folks.”
Reviews.Author: Beader36
Reviews.Content: We had to reserve a hotel just 2 days in advance of our stay, and granted it was commencement week in Boston. We feel The Westin really took advantage of the shortage of rooms in the city and gouged the prices. They called the room "deluxe" but it fit the description of their standard double room. For 2 nights we were charged more than $950 including taxes. For this room charge we would expect at least 1) breakfast, 2) robe and slippers, 3) a shower cap 4) double sinks in the bathroom, 5) a telephone in the bathroom--none of which were included. Dirty dishes from a nearby room sat in the hallway for most of the day and evening. On the positive side, the location is wonderful and the beds are luxurious. If you don't mind paying through the nose for them.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: L0veNYC
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 8am and requested an early check in... which they gave me without thinking twice, along with a view of the river and the Trinity Church. Great location, staff and hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “NIce beds but...”
Reviews.Author: ewbinnyc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely located. The beds are cozy and the rooms clean. However the parking rate is rather high (enough to put one in a bad mood), and the $5 dollar water bottles and over priced snacks waiting to be touched by kids is to much (get that stuff out of the rooms). No complimentary breakfast or Sunday paper. Internet access costs in the room. There was no notice that there was actually free wifi in the lobby The pool is to small and the water seemed a bit hazy. The workers are very friendly. Overall, aside from location and a clean room, there is not much to recommend about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, pleasant and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: travelbug61
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for one night on a Priceline bid. My room was on the 19th floor with an OK view (looking west on Huntington Ave. and south toward the South End), pretty spacious with lots of windows, and very clean. Bathroom was tiny but clean and well functioning. Only complaint was that Internet access costs $9.95 per day (but the nearby Prudential Mall has free access). Nice location, adjacent to Copley Place mall, and through there to Prudential Mall and Hynes Convention Center. A stone's throw from both Copley and Bay stations. Overall, a very pleasant, well run hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Helpful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ellebeendrw
Reviews.Content: Felt very welcomed at check-in and were very pleased with our room. Definitely the best views in the city! The location is fantastic and the staff are very helpful. In particular, Sandy was very gracious when we required some late night housekeeping and Jose couldn't have be more helpful with directions and sightseeing suggestions. Thanks for the great visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: pericomx
Reviews.Content: We stay one night(2 days). I ask for early check in with no problem(6:00 AM). The room is great, the bed magnificent. Location is really good, train outside, mall in same building, Newbury street few blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “I thought we had a great value and a great room!”
Reviews.Author: markdkirstein
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a junior suite at no charge. The room was beautifuful, spacious and very comfortable. The view overlooking the Charles River was fantastic. It was a great value! Also, the hotel staff was most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: runnermom14
Reviews.Content: We have family that lives in the Back Bay/South End area, and typically stay with them, but couldn't due to the large number of family in town at the same time. This was a great place to stay for many reasons. Location was perfect for a rainy weekend, being attached to all the shopping, dining, and convention center via the "skyways." It's also right across the street from the Back Bay T stop. Didn't spend a lot of time in the room, but it was clean and modern. Pricing was also more than I'd like to have paid, but was "in line" with many of the other hotels in the immediate vicinity. Other family members stayed at the Marriott a block down the street, and wished they'd have stayed at the Westin instead!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and beautifully designed rooms!”
Reviews.Author: jaylaw333
Reviews.Content: We booked through hot-wire and received a great rate given how nice this hotel was. Our room was adequately spacious. We enjoyed our stay thanks to a helpful and friendly staff and an ideal location in the centre of Back Bay-close walk to many of Boston's major highlights! I'd stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Typical Westin - does everything well”
Reviews.Author: tanseaway
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently on a business trip. Check-in was a breeze. The suite was on one of the top floors and had a great view of Boston. For a junior suite, it was pretty spacious. Bed was as comfy as one would expect from a Westin. The hotel is also connected by walkway to Copley Place - a shopping mall - and another shopping mall further down the road. Basically, the location is pretty good. Lots of shops within a 5 minute walk. There is also a nice bar on the other side of the road. Overall, this seems to be a solid choice for Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent refurbished A+ Hotel for stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: JPFA
Reviews.Content: Booked through priceline for an more than reasonable price. Compliments to the Hotel, the rebuilding of the interior was executed beautifully. I stayed two years ago and my comments at that time were a bit more negative because of the outdated room and mostly bathroom atmosphere. Now rooms look as new and together with the accurate staff (compiments to Pepijn!) and the central location it is a hotel I can recommend for both leisure (find a good fare with priceline!) and business travel. Just one remark for Hotel Management, in the bathtub and on the ground I found hair that was certainly not mine. Not to important but this might give me the feeling the room was not cleaned well. I stayed in Room 1823 from 13-14 april.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ADRTron
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. Rooms recently remodeled. Great location. Subway station close. Nice to be able to walk to Hynes CC 100% indoors. But watch out for their laundry service. They'll overcharge you. And the odd pillows leave a bit to be desired. My neck was stiff every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice in the Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: CapitalFlyer
Reviews.Content: When I lstayed at the Westin Copley last August, I was worried that things were getting a little tired. There were scuffs along the floorboards in the room, the hallway carpeting had stains, and the shower was old. This past weekend I was happy to discover renovated guest rooms and guest floor hallways to match the already very nice lobby and other public areas. Guest rooms couldn't be better. Now the signature Westin Heavenly Bed is complimented by features such as a high back chair with ottoman that makes for at-home comfort when reading or watching TV at the end of the day, new carpeting and wall coverings, HDTV, and very important for those of us who travel with a lot of gadgets that need to be re-charged---tons of electrical outlets. Desk chairs are modern and comfortable when having to do some work, though arms on the chairs would have added comfort. Guest bathrooms are tiny but now fully re-done to be at their best. Everything is handy. Shampoo and conditioner are already place in the shower so that a guest doesn't have to remember to look for them prior to getting in the shower. The hair dryer isn't hidden someplace difficult to find in some bag but rather placed helpfully at the corner of the vanity for an easy grab after showering. Beds have reading lights. These are all the helpful little touches in a guest room that add up to a wonderful stay. The safe in my room was locked when I arrived but within 15 minutes of calling downstairs about it, hotel security came and got it unlocked for me to be able to use prior to going out for the evening. That kind of responsiveness is appreciated. The lobby already was, and still is a very warm and comfortable central area. There are lots of plush chairs and sofas with a fireplace to add to the relaxed mood. A Starbucks just outside the lobby provides a place to grab a drink and relax in the lobby. There is also a good indoor pool and whirlpool. The location is outstanding for just about any purpose in Boston. It is one short block to the T's Green Line which allows for airport transportation for $1.70 each way (via transfers to the Red Line at Park Street and Silver Line at South Station--about a 45 minute trip but much more affordable than the $55 cab fare each way!) using a reloadable Charlie Card that can be obtained from any T station and for quick transport at that same $1.70 rate to any place in the city. The hotel is connected to Copley Place and Prudential Center with their many shops and places to eat. The hotel itself has Turner Fisheries, one of the best seafood restaurants in Boston. Symphony Hall, home of the Boston Symphony Orchestra and Boston Pops is either a 15 minute walk or two subway stop trip. The Museum of Fine Arts is just five T stops away. It is two blocks to Newbury Street with its shops, galleries, restaurants, and bars. Boston Common is just one T stop or a 10 minute walk away. Same for Beacon Hill. The brownstones of Commenwealth Avenue facing a park its length are just three blocks away. Fenway is just a few T stops or a 20 minute walk away. The Esplanade along the Charles River with its walkways and park benches is just a ten minute stoll up the street. The Westin is close to it all. While room rates aren't bargain basement, they are reasonable for the high standard of comfort and location in such a hotel and a good value when compared to a hotel like the Fairmont across the street. The Fairmont is nice with its chandeliers and other attributes but the staff can be rather stiff and the hotel costs twice as much per night as the Westin without offering twice the level of luxury, especially now that the Westin's guest rooms have been renovated. I highly recommend the Westin as a terrific place to stay in a terrific city.

Reviews.Title: “Solid stay at Westin Copley”
Reviews.Author: xcptnl
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate for this hotel through Priceline for a Friday/Saturday night stay. We got one of the funky shaped rooms at the end of the hotel-very cool that windows wrapped around the room. Very comfortable bed. Check in was superb Two complaints-you could hear people in the hallways and doors slamming from the rooms next door when they left their room and we did not get any washcloths when our room was done on Saturday...I did not notice until I went to shower on Sunday and did not feel like calling for them.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - This Westin offers true customer service!”
Reviews.Author: TexasTwin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visit Boston often. This was our first stay at this Westin. We will definitely return here. Great location, spotless rooms, wonderful staff. We had one issue with a dining experience, and the management addressed it immediately and completely. I have a business trip to Boston in 2 weeks, and I will return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled, Clean Rooms, Great Service, Central Location in Downtown Boston”
Reviews.Author: Fool for the Beach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference the last week of March. The hotel has been remodeled, and the rooms, and the public areas look wonderful. My room was on the 32nd floor with a great view of downtown Boston. Request a high floor, you will not be sorry. The hotel is located in Copley Square, and is easily reached off of I-90, Amtrak is right across the street in the Back Bay Station, it is also next to the Green T and Orange T lines, so getting around town is simple. The room was very clean, new carpets, furniture, wall coverings, large HD TV, in room Starbucks. My room was a junior suite with a king bed, and a day bed that turned into a pull out for the kids. The food was great, had room service about 4 times, very prompt, under 30 min delivery every time. The restaurants were very good as well. I ate in Turners which is seafood, as well as The Palm. Each let you charge to the room so I could get triple SPG points. Not much on the downside other than parking is valet at $40 per day, the bathrooms need a little better lighting, and the bell men will not let you use luggage carts to take your own luggage out to your vehicle. I guess they really want those tips.... Minor stuff though. I will always stay at this hotel when in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Danfromns
Reviews.Content: Thanks to a great rate through Hotwire I had a two night stay at this awesome hotel. Was delighted to get a free upgrade to a suite on the 17th floor with fantastic views. The room and bed were top notch. Room service was fantastic and definitely worth staying in for dinner. Can't wait to get back there!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and view - housekeeping was off”
Reviews.Author: detraveler_7
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel a few times and would stay here again because it is close to my meetings. The room is nice and the river views are very good. This time it seemed that housekeeping was not paying attention. There was a coffee maker but no cups to use. There was no tea or creamer either. The breakfast buffet is pricey but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Old reliable”
Reviews.Author: EatWithMe007
Reviews.Content: Two adjoining rooms for a family of 5. Done it many times. Always consistent. Being connected to Copley place mall is a plus too.

Reviews.Title: “Copley Place gem with fantastic views and spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Wanderlust78
Reviews.Content: Was very pleasantly surprised by the giant rooms on the 35th (SPG) floor. The views of Boston just could not be beat - best during my entire trip! The staff was friendly and the location of the hotel was so convenient. The bedroom and bathroom were perfectly furnished - everything I'd come to expect from a top-notch Westin location. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel when in town for a conference”
Reviews.Author: PhillyVoyager
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have returned to this hotel when in Boston and I always choose it preferentially over other choices. I agree with all of the other reviews-- comfortable and stylish accommodations (nice fireplace in the lobby), friendly and helpful staff, and great location. My conference is always in February which would sound gloomy given Boston's weather, but when staying at the Westin, I can use the bridges/paths through Copley to get to the convention center, dine, shop, etc. without ever having to leave the building (and put on my coat and boots). There's a Bon Pain just outside the hotel to grab breakfast and a great Legal Seafood a 5 minute walk away (both within the building). It's on a "T" stop so you can get within steps of the hotel from the airport (again without having to go outside into winter weather). If you do want to go outside, Boston Commons is about a 10 minute walk, Copley Square is across the street, and Chinatown restaurants are about a 10 minute walk.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: bob_96
Reviews.Content: We visit Boston on a regular basis to visit our daughter and my wife really likes this hotel during the colder months because you can get to Copley Place and the Prudential Center without going outside. My opinion of this hotel has dropped slightly over the years but it is still a very good hotel. It is getting a little frayed at the corners but is still kept very clean. If location is your primary criteria for picking a hotel, you won't be disappointed with this choice.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, centrally located”
Reviews.Author: CutisNP
Reviews.Content: Thank you for such a pleasant stay; prompt about returning our car; prompt with obtaining a taxi !

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: yellowdog11
Reviews.Content: We negotiated a price for 2 nights on Priceline.com and we were not disappointed. The staff at the hotel are very accomodating and we stayed in one of their traditional King rooms in the newer section. The beds are awesome .... you don't usually get beds at a hotel that are this comfortable!! Starbucks coffee in your room for the morning (nice!) The location is also very conveniant, we were able to park our car at the Boston Common parking lot (very reasonable) and walk everywhere. We would go back here again .... you can't beat it!!! Thumbs up for a great Hotel ... nice friendly staff, clean, quiet, comfortable, in a superb location!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Haven after a Long Days Work”
Reviews.Author: KSUKids
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley was the perfect santuary after 3 straight long days of work. The rooms are very spacious, newly remodled and clean. The TV's have VGA connectivity to your laptop if you bring your own cord which is great for preparing for a presentation or watching a DVD off your laptop. The front office staff was very friendly and the cocktail servers at Bar10 were quick and knowledable. As always, the Heavenly Bed delivers the world's best sleep. The location is great and connected to the Copley place if your travelers leave you any free time to shop. No need for a car as they are a few steps from a train station and connected to TONS of shopping and dining. Hope to be back in Boston soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location and beautiful views!”
Reviews.Author: deavodl
Reviews.Content: Once I entered the hotel I was greeted by several Associates welcoming me. Upon check - in they were efficient and fast which is what I prefer. I always visit the concierge when I am not familiar with a city to inquire about the best restaurants and clubs - they were great and provided maps for ease of transportation (I mostly walked everywhere). The restaurant had wonderful food (ony tried once) and I asked the bar tender if they had blue cheese stuffed olives (my fav) and they didn't but would make them for me (which they did) and I was thoroughly impressed. The flatbread pizzas are wonderful and HUGE. I had a renovated guest room (make sure you ask) and it was very comfortable and contemporary. Offered great views of the city. I would recommed this Westin and hope to return soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Westin Coplely Place a Great Value”
Reviews.Author: pauditore
Reviews.Content: Another excellent Starwood hotel in the best of all locations when you are in Boston in the winter, especially during the snow storms. I found nearly all of the service here excellent, free WiFi in the lobby helps get you out of your room and next to the cozy fireplace. I really like the quality and modern rooms with great views and excellent linens and pillows. The beds in this place were amazing and room temperature easily controlled for comfort. What is great about this place is the location and ability to walk through a myriad of buildings and passages to the conventions center and mall areas. This is a plus when its 6 degrees outside let me tell you, I also enjoyed Turner Fisheries near by and the 2lb lobsters on Wednesday night. Right nest to the hotel is a great restaurant named Lucca that I reviewed on Yelp, check it out. Everything was great here until the last morning when I sat down for breakfast and had to wait quite a long time for even water, they need to fix the breakfast service. We found the bar excellent for lunch and the servers were very friendly and nice overall we had lunch there one day and I had dinner the first night at the bar as usual. I really liked what they have done here in upgrading and investing in the property, overall service was excellent until I complained about the breakfast service and got a snotty remark from some manager type, but most of the staff were excellent, aside from the fact that they forgot to put my starwood number in the system.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in accomadations”
Reviews.Author: Rocco1010
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Valentines weekend. The website description of the room is not at all what you get..Our room had peeling wallpaper, heavenly bed not so heavenly, mattress looked pretty old and the heavenly bath was a joke! The bathroom was very small with a standard tub and 2 very dirty shower heads. I wish I took pics of the shower heads! I was extremely disappointed in this hotel. Went The Palm for dinner. I ordered a Filet cooked medium. When we got the food my steak was purple on the inside and when I sent it back I got the same steak on the same dish wich was now charcoal on the outside and still purple on the inside!! Bar 10 was good :)

Reviews.Title: “Great views and luxurious rooms!”
Reviews.Author: sevenstates
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference and the Westin was the preferred hotel. The rooms are newly renovated in rich, dark, earthy tones. The room has very unique features -- recycle bin, a electrical outlet pod, large flat screen television, art deco velvet chair and lighted headboard. The location is perfect and you don't have to go outside to have access to restaurants and shops. You can visit two other hotels without setting foot outside. Check in was great. Everyone was friendly. Would definitely stay here again... even if I had to pay for it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: italybiker50
Reviews.Content: You cannot beat the service or the location of this hotel. I always try to stay ar a Westin just because of the coma inducing beds But this time the bed was not up to the usual standard. Second the room was too hot. I turned down the temp. To 60 but still no luck. The service is worth the stay. I would go back despite the things I ran into during this stay. Great value and great service

Reviews.Title: “Great New Refurbed Rooms”
Reviews.Author: goodjudge
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here before but the hotel is undergoing a refurb. the excellent desk staff were very apologetic about some daytime noise and asked if we would like to stay in older rooms away from the work. or in new rooms on floors closer to the 'doozers'. We opted for a new room, and the noise wasnt that bad any way, just occasional drilling etc. The rooms are really nice, very modern and comfortable, and as usual beds that induce a coma. Bar 10 was as usual very good, great Martinis for the Mrs and comfortable, all in all pretty tough to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Rooms”
Reviews.Author: misskate123
Reviews.Content: I had a fantastic stay at the Westin. Service was amazing...upgraded to a Jr Suite because of construction. Staff was lovely and helpful. Extremely comfortable beds. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “good location, facilities”
Reviews.Author: mrv099
Reviews.Content: We stay here for our company conference every year. Great location, wonderful facilities and nice helpfyl staff. Question: Does anyone know the length of the pool? hoping to use it this year.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy, chaotic, great location.”
Reviews.Author: wombatus_10
Reviews.Content: This is a super busy hotel. There are people everywhere, in the lobby, in driveway, in the hallways. It's almost too popular for it's own good. I didn't enjoy my stay as check-in and check-out was chaotic due to staff being overrun by people from unloading luggage to getting the room key. The location is great with easy access to public transport and great shopping and restaraurants nearby. It's definitely not a good place to stay if you have a car. The room was ok, nothing special, decent size for a city. Noise level is high in the room due to tons of people in the hallways. It is not a restful hotel but a hotel in the thick of everything that's very popular.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff and a place to feel at home!”
Reviews.Author: CTDave72
Reviews.Content: I spent the Christmas break in Boston with my family. Thanks to the great staff at The Westin Copley Place, it was a wonderful vacation. I needed to make some truly last-minute changes in my reservation - absolutely no problem. In fact, when I arrived, I was upgraded to a junior suite. And, this whole trip was free - using my Starwood points. What is most unique is that each person seemed happy to help. If you're heading to Boston, this is definitely the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “5/5 Wonderful Weekend Away”
Reviews.Author: SnowSurf01
Reviews.Content: I recently booked a weekend away at the Westin Copley Plaza in Boston to relax and go shopping with my spouse. We received a very good online rate through the Westin website for a King sized bed in a standard room. Our room was one of the newly renovated rooms and it was very clean, very large, and extremely quiet. We heard no noise from the hallway or other floors during our stay. I had ordered champagne and chocolate covered strawberries to be available on arrival and they were. The strawberries tasted like they were just picked fresh. I had also called the concierge desk the day before to book dinner reservations. The woman at the desk was able to secure the reservations, at Sorellina for us, which came highly recommended. All I can say is that it was the best meal out I've had in years. Every single staff member was courteous, and the hotel was amazing. Definitely an A+ experience.

Reviews.Title: “A good value for room appearance, hotel location, good staff, but noisy guests.”
Reviews.Author: efghij
Reviews.Content: Einstein said that a sign of mental illness is repeating the same behavior over and over and expecting a different result. We have stayed at this hotel on multiple trips even though the very nice junior suites share a connecting door to the next suite, a suite inevitably filled with very noisy guests who seem to rev up after midnight, stretching into the early hours. There is something wrong with the sound-proofing, and perhaps with the clientele. Why do we go back? The rooms are pleasant, the staff helpful, the location excellent. The morning dining room staff are delightful. We keep hoping the last experience with sleep deprivation was just a fluke. There has been renovation and the newly decorated rooms are pretty. The bathrooms however would be a little risky for older travellers. There is no grab bar to hold onto getting into the tub for a shower and the tub is slippery. There is also no soap holder for the shower, making soaping up awkward. The toilet is too low--perfect for a five year old or the height challenged.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: Take my word for it...
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a great place to stay, especially in the winter as you can move comfortably through Copley Plaza and the Prudential Center for shopping without taking your coat as they are connected by skybridge to the hotel. My room was modern, clean and plenty big. Check in was quick. I took the coach bus to Wrentham Premium Outlets ($42). It was worth it. Bus picks you up at the hotel at either 9 or 10 a.m. and you can leave the outlet center at either 2 or 5 p.m. It's about 45 minutes to get there. Bus comes to hotel to pick you up. The Westin is also close to Newbury Street and easy access to the T (the subway).

Reviews.Title: “luxury yes, but need to brush up on the Basics.”
Reviews.Author: drpoundsign
Reviews.Content: I was there for the Harvard Internal Medicine lectures. Those lectures are all day boot camps so you NEED your comfort. I would have to be a Saudi Sheik to not find it luxurious. More pillows and quilts than I ever needed (or WANTED!) But the thermostat was bimodal...if you turned it down too low the AC mode would crank up BRRR!! There were NO phone books either in the rooms or the lobby payphones. I have been having problems in recent years with the alarm clocks in upscale US Hotels. You need to be an MIT engineer to figure them out! I asked a Russian emigre lady at the concierge desk and she merely offered me a wakeup call and "our engineer will check it out." The Hotel is well located next to a shopping mall and Metro lines. I did not rent a car but if I HAD..parking is forty five bucks a day there...OUTRAGEOUS!! There are restaurants in the complex but they are not cheap and service is uneven. The first night at the fish market they had a Dragon Lady Maitre D and a waiter who thinks you don't need a shell cracker to eat lobster. The Ballroom where the lectures were was too warm and they never dimmed the lights..like the Third Degree all week long. The health club they had a lot of treadmills but the weight area was only so so. The indoor pool was olympic size but too COLD!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Boston”
Reviews.Author: howie1229
Reviews.Content: Westin is usually synonymous with quality, and the Westin Copley in Boston doesn't disappoint. Business travelers need efficient, quality service without any goof-ups, and the Westin delivers . The staff are well-trained and gthe service is great. Most of all, it's personal; each employee down to the maids and doormen seem to have been extremely well-trained and make you feel valued and welcome

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but disappointing service”
Reviews.Author: spch4
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel, but were disappointed by the pool and overall accomodations for families at this location. One reason we booked this hotel was it's access to the subway, but we were unable to use this stop because of our stroller. The pool was freezing and filled with salt water, the hot tub wasn't hot. Our room wasn't cleaned on a couple of days. To top it off, there was 2 hours of loud maintenance on 2 different days during my toddler's nap. Had we known in advance, I could have re-scheduled the nap!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: DocShoz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 5 nights recently. Nice room but not particularly clean (hairs in bath, dirty glass in room). Excellent comfortable bed. Breakfast OK but had to wait at busy times (9 am) for a table. Staff helpful. Internet access available but at a price, hotels should really offer free internet access these days. Hotel situated in great place for shopping being close to Boylston and Newbury streets. Handy for Hynes convention centre.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...not up to Westin Standards”
Reviews.Author: golden66_10
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to the Westin at Copley and I must express my disappointment in the rooms. The bathroom ceiling vent was so full of dust and dirt, it was disqusting. The room was so hot that we had to have the window open to sleep ( air conditioning not working) and the desk outlets were not working for the computer. After looking under the desk we found the wires were cut and never repaired. As a starwood preferred guest I decided to stay at the Westin over the Marriott where the conference was being held but realized what a mistake that was.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but lots of problems!”
Reviews.Author: bpalank
Reviews.Content: Had blocked rooms for daughter's wedding and this went fine. The hotel lobby was beautiful, but the front desk was very slow and long lines to check-in, unobtainable answers to questions, mixed up reservations/charges and even the guest bags went to the wrong guests. Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant, comfortable; excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nhhomebody
Reviews.Content: This is a large convention type hotel; The room is large and comfortable, but lacks character; Shower has double heads-can't figure out why; Bed was comfortable and view of Boston from our room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Dinthehighlands
Reviews.Content: Close to conference center, shopping, food, subway, ball park. The room itself was fine. Comfortable Westin beds, tasty room service desserts. Nice staff. The only real negatives were the on site seafood restaurant was a bit of a disaster, and having to pay for wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, dated rooms, overpriced amenities”
Reviews.Author: mrducky108
Reviews.Content: The good: What a great location. We got off the subway at copley station and immediately saw the huge hotel towering over us. We were grateful for being checked in about 2.5 hours early so we could rest our feet and store our bags â€“ the staff was friendly and accommodating. The hotel is two blocks away from Newbury street which is a great place for shopping, eating, and people watching. It's also a short walk/subway ride to the public garden and beacon hill. Our room had a nice view of the park across the street and with the windows closed there was never an issue with noise. The heavenly bed and shower head definitely lived up to their name. The bad: The hallways and rooms themselves seemed quite dated and a bit run down. There was a flickering hallway light that makes you think of those old run-down hotels in movies. According to their website they will be starting room renovations in November. The room size was adequate, however the bathroom seemed quite claustrophobic (especially compared to the huge bathroom we had at the Intercontinental). The ugly: These 4* hotels continue to nickle and dime travelers for amenities like internet access. It's the year 2010, these rooms are listed at $400/night, yet they continue to charge for internet access. Of course these business travelers continue to fork over the money and just throw it on the company credit card, so don't expect things to change soon. Also, the overpriced mini-bar gives you absolutely no storage room for leftovers.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Centralized Spot to Stay in Boston”
Reviews.Author: PassionateMNTraveler
Reviews.Content: We visited Boston for Memorial Day Weekend. After researching many hotels, we selected the Westin Copley Place. We were very happy! We arrived via taxi from the airport around 11 am. They were able to let us check into our room early. Once we got to our room, we were greeted by a large room (for Boston standards). After freshening up, the concierge had great recommendations for lunch places within walking distance. We were just a few blocks from Newbury Street filled with great restaurants/bars and incredible shopping! From high-end boutiques, to mainstream stores, Newbury had a nice selection of shopping to enjoy a beautiful day in Boston. We were also very close to the Freedom Trail, and easy access to the Subway line at Copley Plaza. The bar at the hotel was a great spot for a post-sightseeing martini, and the mall connected to the hotel had a Au Bon Pain which was perfect for a quick breakfast or snack. The staff at the hotel was very helpful in helping us choose restaurants, giving us information of things to do, etc. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “They charge for things not takenÂ»: be careful”
Reviews.Author: rogercharest
Reviews.Content: The room was not clean and they charged me for a bottleof water that I didn't take. I will remember Westin as no longer for me

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: bruin89
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in late July. Easy access from Copley T stop (which was undergoing maintenance when we were there and elevators were closed - not fun hauling stroller/luggage up stairs) a block away. Across street from Boston Public Library and Copley Square. Friendly staff pulled out large bucket of toys for my two little kids to choose from at check-in and scored points right away. CVS drugstore right on the square and all the conveniences within a couple blocks as well (Finagle Bagel, Dunkin' Donuts). Walk to Public Garden/Boston Common. Attached via interior walkways to two adjoining malls. Turner Seafood (excellent) and Starbucks are right off the lobby and very convenient. Charge for internet in room but free WiFi in lobby. I used points for our stay - I might have been more critical if I was paying cash, but I thought it was great. Our room was immaculate and had a wonderful view. Large enough for two little ones to play.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel and very convenient for walking around city”
Reviews.Author: AWDINKS
Reviews.Content: We just stayed one night in Boston before heading to the suburbs. I booked through Hotewire and got a good deal for this 4-star hotel. We arrived late, but the bar was still open for wind-down cocktails before bed. The room was great, very clean, nice view of Trinity Church and YWCA building (on 19th floor). We didn't choose a particular bed on hotwire, but they gave us a king delux room, which we were hoping would happen. Friendly staff. We didn't get a chance to checkout the gym (would have if we stayed longer). Concierge was very helpful with maps and tips. We ended up walking from our hotel to Boston Common, Freedom Trail (whole thing), and Quincy Market/Fanuel Hall. Everything was very convenient. A farmers market was about a block away. If we go back to Boston proper, I will definitley stay here again. Oh, and the Westin Heavenly Bed is wonderful...we slept like babies!

Reviews.Title: “Hotwire nailed it with this pick”
Reviews.Author: Treycb
Reviews.Content: We recently used Hotwire for the first time and were given the Westin as our choice. We couldn't have been more pleased! Pulling into the hotel you are able to drive right into Valet. Valet was $44 for an overnight charge. You are however able to take your car in and out as you wish for no additional charge. The attendants were very nice and extremely professional. The wait time to retrieve the car was very short. Check in and out was very smooth. The front desk operators were also very nice and eager to make our stay a good one. We had a small charge added to our bill because we took something out of the mini bar (all items are on an electric sensor so they know when you take something out) that we only looked at but didn't eat. We mentioned this at check out and the charge was removed, no questions asked. The room was great. It was very spacious and clean. The bed... AMAZING!!! It was a very quiet room and we could hear no hallway foot traffic or noise from other guest rooms. You can here a slight outside traffic noise, but nothing over whelming or disturbing. The bathroom would be our only complaint of the room. Although very clean, it was extremely small, the wallpaper was coming loose at the seams, the grout in the tub was very roughly patched in areas, and the tub (although not gross), had a slight dirty look to it. The restaurant bar was good and bad. When we went for drinks and appetizers early (about 3 pm), service was great, the food good, and the drinks strong. The prices were a little elevated, but nothing outrageous. When we went back later (about 11 pm) it was jammed packed with people and we waited about 25 minutes for service before we finally left to go somewhere else. The location of the hotel is great. It is connected to a high end mall that you can walk through to get from place to place. Our friends were staying at the Sheraton, 3 hotels away, and we simply walked through the mall to get to them. (By the way, the consierge was very helpful in pointing out the way.) Although the stores are closed, the walking area is open late (possibly 24 hours). We walked through at 1 AM and ran into no problems. Speaking of location, the reason we were in town was for the Red Sox / Yankees game. The Westin is only a mile or 2 from Fenway. Although I'm sure you could walk on a nice day, it was raining and it was a very quick ($7) cab ride to the park. There are plenty of cabs available outside the hotel so catching one was not an issue at all. Will without a doubt stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a central location.”
Reviews.Author: HurdyGurdyMan
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel via a priceline bid and was a bit scared after getting the brushoff when I called to try and request 2 beds. But early check-in was no problem and the 2 bed request was granted. Room was standard 4 star business. Very clean, comfy beds, 32" flat screen TV, minibar, bathrobes and high end amenities. There was a nice single cup coffeemaker with Starbucks coffee but my room only had decaf. No free wifi and only 1 accessible computer in the lobby but there was a Starbucks in the mall right off the lobby. The location is great with BackBay station right across the street and the hotel itself is attached to a high end mall withe several nice restaurant choices and high end shops. I would highly recommend Giacomo's Italian restaurant around the corner on Columbus.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Frankie-and-Emma
Reviews.Content: This hotel proved to be an excellent choice, in an ideal location. The room was spacious enough and in excellent order with the comfiest beds going. Yes the toilet is a little on the small side but again it was kept in excellent condition and after all how much time do you really need to spend in there anyway? The maid service was first class and all of the staff could not be friendly and helpful enough. We did have to pay for wireless internet in our room at 10 bucks per night but it is free in the lobby if required. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price of admission”
Reviews.Author: tlc20
Reviews.Content: Room was quiet and fairly comfortable. Only one accessible electrical outlet in the room which was behind the television and difficult to use. The shower did not work properly and required me to call for service. No newspaper delivered to the room. They charge for internet service which probably should be free given the cost of a room (Omni has free internet for its members and the membership is free on your first stay).

Reviews.Title: “Not up to the stardards of Starwoods premium hotels, very disappointing Westin.”
Reviews.Author: redsoxcubs
Reviews.Content: No concierge floor or lounge, no business center we had to use the library across the street. Clock was set to the wrong time, No channel guide on the TV, either hard copy or on the TV screen. Rude concierge personnel, always made the assumption that we knew where landmarks where located. If we did we would not have been asking them for their help. Boston people were great except for those you worked at this hotel. Next time we will definitely stay down the street.

Reviews.Title: “great location...decent upgrade chances”
Reviews.Author: crazywudsl
Reviews.Content: Great location in copley connected to a few malls. Upgraded to their typical decent sized suite as a platinum guest. Not the newest or most modern of rooms but no problems whatsoever. Valet was fine, pool and workout room were fine, though the machines could use a slight updating. Overall, there is some value here and the service was fine overall. Not as fancy as the W which is newer or fancier, but for kids and family probably better overall.

Reviews.Title: “Big city hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: admg1963
Reviews.Content: The main highlight of this hotel is it's location. Just about anywhere in "tourist" Boston can be reached on foot from here, but it's also located close to two subway lines. The rooms feature the heavenly bed and shower. Don't expect the personnel touch.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rabump
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, and great location, close to the T. Nice restaurants in hotel, a bit pricey but it is Boston, Starbucks in hotel :). Rooms are clean but decor needs updating, parking is very expensive, 40-45.00 a day. Taxi cabs outside hotel, average 12-17.00 anywhere in Boston. The T is the best way to travel. Bova's Pastry shop in North end is awesome

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Desertgirl1960
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Copley Place from September 17th through the 19th. We wanted to tour the city of Boston and see a Red Sox game at Fenway. Got the Westin on the day we left through Hotwire.com for $163/night which is unheard of. Regular rates are in the $400/night range. The hotel was modern, clean and had a great staff. The hotel is attached to the Prudential Mall which is very convenient for dining and an shopping. The hotel is only a 1 1/2 block walk to the Back Bay T station. We took the train from the airport for $2 each as opposed to a $30-35 taxi ride. The trains are clean, air conditioned and very safe. The Back Bay area was very convenient and was within walking distance of all the major attractions. We walked to some places and also had a 2-day pass on Old Town Boston Trolley cars which you can hop on an off all day long. They have 15 different stops and you could get anywhere wanted to go including Fenway Park. We took to trolley to Fenway and walked back to the Westin after the game (about a 25 minute walk). This area is a very nice area and we never felt unsafe walking around at late at night. I would highly recommend the Westin both from a location standpoint and a convenience standpoint and would definitely return there should I travel to Boston in the future. Feel free to email with any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Big room but pricey”
Reviews.Author: joeyjo99
Reviews.Content: Rooms were huge (although tiny bathroom), convenient location next to the station, great breakfast (but expensive). Would recommend. If you are at a conference/ exhibition check exactly where it is as I have also stayed at the Westin Waterfront South Boston which is attached to one convention center and is fabulous but books up well in advance. If you are attending the "World Trade Centre" then the Renaissance S.Boston is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: fivestartraveler01
Reviews.Content: I had a great time while staying in Boston. When i arrived the Valet was right out side opened my door and greeted me with a smile. I was late to a gathering and the Valet Manager Mr. Burns (don't remember his 1st name but really nice guy) allowed me to keep the car out front while i checked in. Most places they move the cars then you have to wait. Then i got to the room and the check in process was really quick. My room over looked the city. The maid service was really good. The beds were heavenly. I guess the name says it all. The rooms had purified air which just sounds great but really is a nice touch. Every amenity in the room was excellent. I recommend this hotel to anyone who comes into Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Copley Did Not Disappoint”
Reviews.Author: TravelLoverHawaii
Reviews.Content: Prior to confirming our reservations with Hotwire, I failed to check the hotel reviews and was deeply disappointed to learn of the poor ratings and traveler complaints for the Westin Copley. Was Starwood & Westin Copley management unaware of the problems occurring there? I proceeded to contact them via email and promptly received a response from Starwood/Westin Copley management acknowledging my concerns. Our hotel experience was nothing short of awesome. The staff was pleasant and courteous, the room clean, beds comfortable, view impeccable. Maybe I was lucky but my impression was that the staff & management were professional, no dire room problems or inconveniences other than a slow drain of the bathroom sink which for me is tolerable, everything was as good as a four star hotel could be. The location is very, very convenient if traveling via subway or bus. The subway stop is kitty corner to the hotel, one short block away. The bus stops are across the street or near the library, depending which direction you are heading. The hotel is situated next to the Public Library and Copley Square. There are always taxi cabs near the valet if it is your desired mode of transportation. Also a whole array of shops are connected to the Westin along with other hotels and the Prudential Center/Hynes Convention Center. Very convenient and also close to Newberry Street for additional shopping. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: kezz38
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin, Copley Place for three nights in July - the best thing about this hotel is the location - its perfect! We got a great deal on Hotwire. We had a good room which was quite spacious. Although a Westin not up to the same standard as other Westins were we have stayed - but the location and good deal we got outweighed that. Staff were OK except for the concierge who could use some training in customer service. Valet parking was good although expensive which is pretty normal in Boston. Bar was good - had an excellent cosmo!!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service at first but overall very nice hotel.”
