Reviews.Author: EllenM2010
Reviews.Content: We arrived just 30 minutes before check in time after 6 hours on the road. We were told our room would not be ready for 45 minutes because the prior customer requested a late check-out. Not our problem but we realized we were early. After 45 minutes, they stated room was still not ready, we complained and they upgraded us to a river view room that was ready. Wrong to tell us another customer was taking precedence and wrong to wait the full 45 minutes with complaints before upgrading but right to upgrade finally. Other than this, a great hotel with comfortable, clean rooms, great access to a fun part of the city and to the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “met all expectations”
Reviews.Author: stantsy
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 night stay at the Westin Copley Place and was a little worried about some previous reviews from others on trip advisor. My honest review of this hotel is that it met all expectations I would expect from a Westin hotel. Check in was easy but one does have to be patient. (took maybe 10 minutes). Dedo at the front desk was very helpful we'll we checked in. Our room was clean, big, had an awesome view and met or exceeded what I want in a hotel. We were on the 32nd floor. The WCP is centrally located and maybe a 20 minute walk to Fenway Park, 25 minute walk to Harbour/Faneiul Hall area, the T (subway) is right there also for day trips that require the use of the public transportation. Tons to do in Boston and the WCP allowed everything to be done by its central location. Newbury street, Fenway, bakeries (Mike's and Modern pastery shops rock), Faneiul Hall, Harbour, Beacon Hill, Freedom trail, restaurants, Boylston street, Harvard, Union oyster house. With hotels being as expensive as they are in Boston, I would always try to surf around for a good rate at the WCP as full price as per the Westin web-site is steep but the going rate for hotels in general in Boston is very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “BEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: hannahec
Reviews.Content: Awesome but abit Expensive but worth it! Also Its very large and has many fllors. Best for kids as well!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Average for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: bedrock49
Reviews.Content: I tried to get this room for a couple of days over the weekend but had a difficult time trying to convince the front desk and management to honor my request to pay the same amount that 6 of my other associates paid. Three rooms were booked at a specific (cheaper) rate which unfortunately expired when it was my turn to book. I really did want to stay with my comrades but couldn't have been happier with anything other than the hotel next door, the Fairmont Copley. Dear Westin - rather than honor and be flexible with the requested rate, you pushed away a customer. Are you happy with sitting on empty rooms? You are not a 4 star Hotel is Boston - more like a 3 star. I have been to a number of Westins before but the one in Boston is probably the worst - not very nice. But anyway, if you have to stay in the area, try the Fairmont Copley - its beautiful and the staff is amazing. Beautiful big rooms and an amazing reception. I will return to the Fairmont but not the Westin - have fun with your empty rooms guys.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Customer Service for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: bellafarfalla
Reviews.Content: I traveled here for work for one night and thought that the service was lacking for a Westin property. The hotel room itself was adequate, the bed mattress was very comfortable, but the pillows were extremely uncomfortable. The check in was fine but the next morning I requested a late checkout. When I called the front desk, the woman who answered was flat out rude to me and told me I had to be out of the room by noon no exceptions. I waited 10 minutes and called back and a different front desk attendant answered and kindly gave me a 2:00pm checkout. When I ordered room service, they got my order wrong, which was also a disappointment. However, by far the biggest disappointment occurred when I went to retrieve my car from the valet. I was the only person at the time waiting for a car and it took 30 minutes for the valet to bring the car to me. This I thought was unacceptable as the hotel charges $40 per day for parking and I expected the service to be much faster. To make matters worse, once I got into the car, a different valet kept on waving taxis to go in front of me so that I was unable to exit the hotel until I rolled down my window and yelled "Stop!" The only positive about my stay was that it was only for one night.

Reviews.Title: “Huge disapointment”
Reviews.Author: newlywedfreeman
Reviews.Content: On July 31st I got married, we had one night away and as a gift my new sister in law booked us a room at the Westin. We got there late and tried to check in, we had copies of the reservation and the 3rd party approval form she had faxed to them so we could sign for her credit card that the room was booked with. Unfortunately the hotel staff LOST their copy of this 3rd party approval. They wouldnâ€™t not accept the copy we had or the confirmation sheet she had given me to prove it had been sent and received. They wanted my sister-in-law to refax this paper to them at midnight from my mother in laws house. My mother in law doesnâ€™t have a fax machine at her house. We ended up having to call my in-laws house to have my sister in law talk to the hotel staff but the manager would just blow her off and hand the phone back to us. We asked to call her himself using the number on file (it was her cell phone) and he refused. They refused to allow her to email this 3rd party approval from as she suggested, all they would accept was a fax. After 45 minutes to an hour of us trying to come up with a resolution to get this form to them they clearly had enough and refused to allow us check in. The two night managers were horribly unfriendly and were not helpful, Iâ€™ve never experienced such terrible customer service. I stood there in tears trying to come up with a resolution, one snapped to us "what do you want me to do" clearly they didnâ€™t want to help even though it was their fault they had lost the original fax in the first place. I had proof she sent it, we tried to get other options and they refused to hear it...all they wanted was a fax... To our discontent we had no choice but to leave. We got back in our car and drove the hour and half back to our home and they had ruined my honeymoon night. I only did not have one night away it was terrible because they were not budge and allow my sister in law to email this form to them, nor would they accept her reading off her credit card number over the phone. I would not recommend this hotel due to the terrible customer service. Itâ€™s not worth their rude unhelpful behavior. They had excuse after excuse for not accepting any form of communication other than a fax. She currently is filing a complaint to get her money back because they did end up charging her card trying to say we were a no show..but we were there, they wouldnt let us check in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect base.”
Reviews.Author: Cailin-oir
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights over Easter. Check-in was very quick and efficient and staff were pleasant. Our room was located on the 17th floor and had great views of the city for miles. We had a lovely view of the Trinity Church across the road. The room was a very good size with seating area, desk/work area and very comfortable bed. The bathroom was perfectly fine with bath/shower, plenty of towels and complimentary toiletries. The location of this hotel is fantastic. Whether you want to spend your time shopping or are looking for some culture and sightseeing, you will be catered for. The hotel is attached to two malls via walkway - here all your shopping needs will be met. Failing that, it is also located close to Newbury street where the more 'up market' shops are found. Boston common is a short 10minute stroll away, a lovely place to spend a sunny afternoon. From there it isn't far until you reach Quincy Market / Faneuil Hall where you will find plenty to see and do. The hotel is conveniently located very close to the Copley T station which makes it very easy to get to/from the airport. Overall it was a very pleasant stay and I would not hesitate to return again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: alhambramd
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference in Boston. We have always had wonderful experiences staying at Westin hotels, so we thought of staying at a Westin in Boston. Check in was such a breeze. I would have to commend them for all their patience, as we had a lot of changes made to our reservations the week prior to our arrival (we couldnt decide whether or not we wanted to get there a day early). They were very courteous and accommodating of our requests. They really worked with us on that one... Westin Copley is attached to the Marriot, the Prudential building and the convention area by a series of walkways that make it so convenient, especially when it was snowing outside. I really didnt need much of the cold-weather gear I had brought, just a light jacket was sufficient. Also it was a block away from major trolley stops, as well as the stop for the Old Town Trolley Tours Boston. Ah the Heavenly bed, we are such big fans... need I say more? Nice-sized rooms. Rooms were very clean and well maintained. Tried out the gym and the heated swiming pool. The hot tub could have used a little bit more heat, it was more lukewarm than hot. Overall very happy with the experience and would stay again if the opportunity came up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Price”
Reviews.Author: FashionbugNy
Reviews.Content: We booked the Westin through priceline's name your own hotel price and got an amazing deal! $140 a night!. The concierge could not have been more helpful! Great Great team!! Our hotel room was very clean, on a corner, and overall we didn't really spend any time in the room except to sleep! Bed and Shower were truly "Heavenly" Parking was $$$,but we sucked it up. A few recommendations! We purchased the Go Boston Card, It was alittle expensive but had some great perks! We did the segueway tour! It was really fun! And cut I think 35% off the price!.. Free Beantown trolley too! FOOD: MUST visit Stephanies on Newbury and Strega in North End, Being from New York and a picky eater I was extremely pleased with the delicious food and service. Traveling: Take the subway!, Cabs are/can get really expensive and hard to find! The subways are clean and very easy to use! Copley has a few main hubs! The Ghosts and Gravestones tour was really fun too! Ask for Mortimer! He was a great guide. Overall the Westin was a great experience, the pool was not as nice as the Westin Waterfront but oh well, like I said we didnt spend much time in the hotel! Enjoy Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; but not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: ForeverMaui
Reviews.Content: Arrived on an early flight and was able to check in around 11am. This was very much appreciated! Our room was hot even though we kept the blinds closed ALL the time and even though we had the thermostat down as low as it would go, the room always felt stuffy. Didn't like the bathroom...it was very tiny & the sink loudly gurgled most of time. And one of my most important factors is cleanliness and I expected better. The room was dusty and for more than $250 dollars a night, I don't want dusty room. I also don't appreciate being charged for internet access. The best part about the Westin was the location. There are two "T" stations w/in a block or two. You can walk between the Westin & the Marriott (which we did several times to watch the World Cup over at the Marriott) without going outside. This makes both of these hotels convenient to the mall that has many food options. I wouldn't stay at the Westin again but would try others hotels in the Copley area.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Westin Standards”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Junkie71
Reviews.Content: We had stayed at the Westin Copley for 6 nights over week of 4th of July. First off, the good things. The location of the hotel was excellent, near many restaurants, shops, and very close to two T stations. You can get to the Freedom Trail, West End, or Fenway in just a couple of stops. Also, the views are excellent. We had a room facing the Charles River and we were able to view the 4th of July fireworks from the comfort of our room. Unfortunately, the bad outweighed the good by a large margin. We arrived at the hotel a little early before check-in time. They told us they would hold the luggage and call us once our room was ready, probably around 2pm. We were ok with that since we wanted to go ahead and start exploring the city. Well, we returned to the hotel at 4pm, not having gotten any phone call about our room. It was still not ready then. They said that housekeeping had fallen behind. At this point we were very tired, having been up since 4am to catch a flight. They did end up finding us a room after more time standing around and waiting. Not exactly Westin type service. When we got to the room, the first thing I noticed is the state of the carpet. It was dirty and old and needed replacement. There were stains in several places. I was not even comfortable walking around in bare feet. The room needed some serious renovation, starting with the carpet. My wife noticed that there were several stains on the comforter as well. When she looked more closely, she was horrified when she saw there were tiny hairs on the sheet left from the previous guest. We both looked at it and agreed that the hairs were most likely from the pubic area. We were disgusted. We complained to housekeeping and the manager on duty. Even the housekeeper assigned to our floor admitted that she did not change the sheets or comforter between guests Ewwwww!!! We had them change out everything after that. When talking to the manager, he didn't seem all that compassionate (he even left in the middle of our conversation to take something to another guest). He did end up offering us breakfast for 2 nights. I would've preferred a percentage off the rate or SPG points. There was no excuse for that kind of housekeeping negligence at a hotel the caliber of a Westin. Days Inn, maybe. But not Westin. The AC in the room did not work well either. We had set it to the lowest setting (60F) and it was still hot at night. We had requested that maintenance look at it while we were gone during the day, but obviously it wasn't done or they didn't find anything wrong. Request to housekeeping for extra towels or shampoo took a long time, sometimes more than an hour. The concierge staff was literally useless. They were not very friendly and didn't really go out of their way to give good directions, or recommendations on what to see or where to dine. They gave very short and blunt answers. No warm fuzzies here. It was sad that the Enterprise car agent seated at the kiosk right next to the concierge desk, gave us much better information on the city and sites. It wasn't even her job. All in all, while I was happy with the hotel's location and easy access to things, I was disappointed with the overall stay. I've stayed at many Westins and this one was not up to par with most of them. My wife talked me out of staying at the Renaissance which cost about half of what the Westin was charging and probably would've been a much better experience. Even the brand new W in town had a cheaper rate than the Westin Copley. But we chose the Westin in the end because it was more kid friendly than the W We won't make the same mistake again..

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!”
Reviews.Author: mimikarat
Reviews.Content: We requested river view rooms to see the fireworks with our Grandchildren. My daughter had called three times to make sure this was what we are getting. When we arrived with our confirmation of our rooms, they said so sorry to bad we don't have the rooms you requested. They could not have cared less that we were unhappy. They took $30.00 off a night. That was so generous. When we got to our rooms I could not believe how filthy they were. The bathroom was dirty shower curtain was just plain nasty. They did not vacuum the entire time. We had to call everyday for replacement items. Our Grandson ran around for five minutes on the carpet and his feet were soot black. Just awful. So disappointed with this facility. I would never recommend this hotel or stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good customer service”
Reviews.Author: lillesand25
Reviews.Content: Check in was a breeze, but the bathroom was not cleaned-didn't realize until it was time to take a shower. Packed up again (which is always a pain) and was given a clean room in a jiffy. Good location and nice cocktail bar in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, perfect location, awesome service”
Reviews.Author: mbmomma
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in the perfect spot for a first time (or any time) trip to Boston. It's centerally located, right next to two T stations and connected to a mall with lots of food choices, stores and a market. We asked for a river view room to watch fireworks and they gave us a spectacular room with a perfect view - even had it prepared with our special request for no feather bedding. An indoor pool & nice fitness center rounded out each of our days and the kids were thrilled. There seemed to be lots of business people, families and even a wedding in the hotel - all happily co-mingling.

Reviews.Title: “Should've listened to the reviews that said it's subpar for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: ajkyc
Reviews.Content: As a longtime Westin devotee, I figured previous reviewers might just be being too harsh, and took a flyer on this one. I'd been there before socially but never stayed in one of the rooms. I regret it. Having stayed in probably a couple dozen different Westins, this is without question the worst experience I've had overall - as Westins go. Certainly did not live up to the name or the price. Wish I'd stayed at Nine Zero or the Mandarin instead. THE GOOD: - BED: - Typical truly Heavenly bed. Triple sheeting, top quality bedding, etc. - SERVICE: - valet, front desk and concierge, "Service Express", room requests (eg, housekeeping items) - is speedy and friendly, with one exception noted below. Was given an unrequested staggering view over the river - ETHICS: - $5 credit per night (usable at the hotel's food properties) for not requiring bed turnover. Nice to see a hotel put its money where its green mouth is - GYM: - large and well-equipped, with private TVs at the cardio equipment - PETS: - they allow dogs without charging a fee. Very civilized - DECOR: - lobby and hallways - are spotless and moderately upscale, if dated - LOCATION: - terrific, of course - attached to two good malls, and so close to Newbury and other Back Bay shopping/dining and the Common/Garden. I don't give this particular property a lot of credit, though, for the corporate office long aog having chosen a good existing property to take over. It's what you do with what you're given... THE DISAPPOINTING: - SERVICE: - My breakfast hangtag was placed on the door more than 5 hours before the cutoff time, but was never picked up. (To their credit, they did deliver the order 12 minutes after it was placed by phone.) Still, a business hotel can't make an amateur mistake like that - SERVICE: - The final bill was not delivered under-the-door the morning of checkout - CHECK-IN: - slow and understaffed (took almost 20 minutes to get to the desk, with only 3 people in front of me). It only got worse throughout my stay - VALET: - similarly, valet / dealing with the car was unusually ill-organized, hectic and understaffed - ROOM SIZE: - the smallest Westin room I recall ever staying in - BATHROOM: - very small, yes even for an urban hotel. 2 people could not be in there at the same time. Two showerheads though, a nice touch - AMENITIES: - Stingy - only shampoo, conditioner and lotion - though what was provided was high quality. We had to ask for robes and slippers, though again they were typical top quality - NO FREE WIFI: - it continues to amaze me that any hotel thinks it can get away without offering free wifi and not expect it to be remarked upon unfavorably. Consider this an unfavorable remark - ROOM SERVICE: - breakfast was serviceable - nothing special aside from the excessive quantity. Breathtakingly overpriced, even for a Westin, even for an urban setting. I've paid less for vastly superior breakfasts at, eg, various Four Seasons - POOL & POOL AREA: - ugly and dingy. Well, let's be honest - they're gross. Probably the most sub-Westin element I noticed THE BAD: - PARKING: - costs FORTY-FOUR DOLLARS A NIGHT. This isn't Tokyo. That's flat-out gouging of your guests who are paying *plenty* already - ONE RUDE STAFF MEMBER: - the only staff person we encountered who was anything less than delightful: a woman at the "service express" line (when you press zero) who was rude and a poor communicator. She did not listen to the questions I asked, answered questions I HADN'T asked, and ended her own sentences before they seemed complete, with sudden silence, in what felt like a bizarre, vaguely hostile way. She seemed harried and irritated, and was openly cross in her tone and speech, in each of the several conversations we had over the course of my stay. If anyone at the hotel cares, which seems unlikely, she would not provide her name but she had a Caribbean accent I could not place. - LEAK: - Some sort of leak in the sink/bathroom that kept the carpet outside the bathroom waterlogged throughout our stay. Clearly an ongoing but unfixed problem IN SUM: had this been a "lesser" chain than the Westin - or had it been half the price or less - I might have given it another star. As is, I think 3 is a bit generous.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay in a Perfect Location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: paris015
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley Place exceeded my expectations. I had stayed here once before about ten years earlier, and this time not only did they upgrade me to a suite, but the customer service was outstanding! The Heavenly beds were phenomenal, and the view out of my corner room was spectacular overlooking the Charles River and the MIT dome across the way. The location is superb with everything being walking distance - from the best shopping on Newbury to the Theatre district to the Copley T to take you to Faneuil Hall or the Waterfront if too tired to walk. A truly wonderful hotel! I will stay here every time I'm in Boston on business or for a romantic get-away!

Reviews.Title: “Rude to PriceLine Customer YET Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: FederalExpress
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley Place is a very lovely four star hotel. When in Boston, it's great being right in the middle of things. You can take the subway or walk anywhere from here. The beds were luxurious and the rooms were clean and modern. Boston hotels are expensive so we looked on PriceLine and won name your own price bid and ended up at the Westin. Our teenage daughter was traveling with us, so I called ahead to ask for double beds. The Reservationist replied, "Oh I am sorry, since you're a PriceLine customer; you get what is leftover". (Ouch!). On our final day, we phoned to inquire about a 1PM check-out (since our flight was at 8PM). She informed us, "We will charge you half the room rate, if you're any later than 1PM." She was discourteous and acted as if we were asking to stay for free, for the rest of the month. Perhaps the staff at the Westin needs a little review on customer service. Somehow, we still got a nice "leftover room" on a high floor with a beautiful view of the city, topping off our wonderful Boston vacation. The Westin staff should be hospitable even to low rent PriceLine customers like ourselves who paid a measly $200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location..clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: threedragons
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay. Great location and extremely clean rooms. Connected to a mall with a ton of shops and restaurants which was great so rainy days. Walking distance to Fenway. We were traveling with a group of about 400 people and the only complaint from myself (and others) was that the AC didn't seem to cool too well. No major issues so would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate, but better options”
Reviews.Author: ladyfitch
Reviews.Content: The Westin is fine, don't get me wrong. The rooms are spacious, there is a mini bar, lcd tv and great work desk. The bathrooms are modern enough and contain amenities and a bathtub. The lobby gorgeous, staff attentive enough. It's just bland. The furnishings in the rooms are not of the high quality that Westin ones usually are. The fixtures a little off. It looks like a hotel that has been renovated surely, but not by the Westin group (their 'feel' is very distinctive). I called once for towels and the request wasn't returned, otherwise the service was fine. Would I stay again? Yes, but money better spent elsewhere really.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: atlguy67
Reviews.Content: It's very clean, which is by far the most important thing to me, and it was quiet. Not as nice or as new as a W or Intercontinental, but still very nice. So on to the rest: - great location, hard to beat. Right by the Copley T station, but a quick tip: an entrance for the green line inbound on the west side of Dartmouth is closed, but there is an entrance thru some plywood box on the Boylston side of the public library. Not sure if the closed one is new or a renovation, and it may be obvious to people who live there, but my wife & I a couple of times went one stop outbound to switch over to inbound before we discovered it. - like every other high-end hotel, they're clinging to Internet charges. No idea what they are (hotel info said 'nominal,' probably $10-20), but no point. Yes, it's free in the lobby, but I haven't experienced connections that slow since I had a 2400 baud modem. But the Boston Public Library across the street has free wi-fi. - yes, they charge for parking. No idea how much since we didn't have a car, but I can't be alone in wanting to know this before I book hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly service, clean rooms, nice Back Bay location”
Reviews.Author: trianglefamily
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Westin and had a good overall experience. This hotel was conveniently located near restaurants, shopping, sightseeing trolleys, transit systems, Newbury Street, the Boston Library and Trinity Church. The service was prompt and friendly. We were able to check into our room immediately, even though we arrived before 10am. Our room was clean and the beds were comfortable. The concierge service was very helpful, although their opinion of "affordable" seems to differ from ours, when recommending restaurants. We enjoyed the pool and work out room as well. Unfortunately, there was a charge for computer access that was rather high, but otherwise, we were very happy with our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: boyblue4502
Reviews.Content: I just got back from my overnight stay and felt the need to write this recommendation on Westin's behalf in light of a ridiculous previous negative review. My wife and I live in NYC and at 1AM Saturday morning, she decided on a whim to take a road trip to Boston and spend the night. (We had never been to Boston.) We honestly picked this hotel because on Priceline, she bid on the price and got it for less than half of what the listed price was. When we got there, the hotel was immaculate and the room was nicely appointed and was big enough. The location could not be any more central in Boston. Their subway, the "T" was a block a way and the Boston public library was also a block away. Boylston Street is a block away and is lined with wonderful restaurants and cool stores. The hotel is located in the Prudential Center, which is essentially a huge high end mall. (Jimmy Choos, Pinks, Louis Vuitton, Tiffany's, stores like that) So if shopping is your thing, you can shop until your heart's content and just walk right back to the Hotel. I thought the staff was professional and polite as well and definitely were right on with their dinner recommendations. Two of the restaurants we went to based on their recommendations and are within walking distance were Skip Jacks and Atlantic Fish Company. Both served wonderful sea food and the prices were pretty much what I expected for being Boston and its location. Anyways, you can't go wrong with this hotel at all. Another huge plus was their bed. Probably one of the most comfortable beds I had ever slept in. (I like a firm bed and they tie Crowne Plaza for best beds in my opinion.) I found three negatives to this hotel in my opinion, which to me wasn't a big deal but I just want to be as informative as possible. The first is that you can hear through the walls. (I could hear people turn their water on, someone opening their drapes) Now I know it is beyond the hotel's staff control and it honestly didn't bother me. ( I could sleep through a nuclear war) But if you are a light sleeper, it might bother you. The second is the price to park at the hotel. It was $44 a night! We got around this though by googling garages around that particular hotel and we got a discounted spot in the prudential center for $25. We parked on the P1 level and the elevator took us right next to a California Pizza Kitchen. That was in front of an enclosed bridge that took us to the Westin. The third negative was the price for a breakfast. (In hotels like these, breakfast tend to be highway robbery) You can get around that by eating at Au Bon Pain, which is located directly next to the Westin. Boston is a wonderful city and we were lucky to find this hotel. Stay and you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: jamiegardner
Reviews.Content: First, I was sent to the waterfront Westin , then told that I was in the wrong place. When I asked for directions ,the man couldn`t` tell me , then left me standing there to go ask someone. When I finally arrived at the right Westin, the lady that checked us in , Marianna, was very nice and helpful but other than her , the stay was not great. Not to mention the outrageous prices for room and parking . I have stayed at other Westins and this one was small and cramped.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travis_anderson
Reviews.Content: Entering the hotel requires an escalator ride up from street level to the registration desk area, which has more the feel of a business plaza than a hotel lobby. I was traveling with my pre-teen son, who was very impressed with our room. Having traveled extensively, I was less impressed, but had no complaints. I thought our room was unremarkable for a hotel this pricey, and with two beds it was a bit cramped, but it was comfortable and clean, with great Back Bay views. The beds were very comfortable. The pool was small, and since the hotel was huge, it was generally too crowded with kids for any real adult exercise opportunities (like swimming laps). The exercise room was nice--but again, unsupervised kids goofing around on the equipment made serious exercise a bit challenging. My trip was part business, part pleasure, but my meetings were elsewhere, so I can say nothing about the on-site business facilities. The staff was very friendly and accommodating, however. We took the train from the airport, since there is a stop right outside the Boston Public Library (which is right next to the hotel and worth a visit just to see the interior architecture, if nothing else). It took us a little under an hour to ride into town by train and wheel our luggage the block and a half to the hotel--we travel light. The location is great for shopping (especially in inclement weather), as the hotel connects up with the Copley Place mall and Prudential Center. There's also a large food market close by, which is great for stocking up on water bottles, snacks for kids, deli sandwiches, Dunkin' Donuts, etc.. And the Duck boats line up just down the street from the hotel entrance. It is about six blocks to the public garden (with swan boats) and Boston Commons, and a few blocks further to the start of the Freedom Trail (which can be accessed much more quickly by hopping on the subway for two stops). All things considered, the Westin Copley Place is a good choice--especially for families.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, a few annoyances though....”
Reviews.Author: jlee2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Coply recently for the second time in the last several months for conferences. Overall, the hotel is very nice, in a great location, and service is very good. It is connected to a mall, which makes it convenient for shopping, and is also centrally located. The second time I was lucky and they put me in a suite, which was a pleasant surprise. Room was clean, spacious, modern. No complaints. Ate at two of the hotel restaurants (Huntington and Turner Fisheries) both great. There were a few annoyances though: 1. Every other day I would get a flashing "message" on my phone, which was simply an annoying advertisement to eat at one of the hotel restaurants. I get enough emails, messages, and texts a day that I don' t need phone "spam" in my hotel room. I'm already at the hotel, spending money, do they really need to advertise the restaurant too. Very annoying. This is not something I'd expect from a Westin hotel. 2. There were only two reachable outlets in the entire room (other than bathroom) and these were in the side of the desk. That's not enough for my phone, blackberry, iPod, etc. 3. The toilet seemed old, did not flush well, and the shower water pressure was low. The shower had a two-head shower, but only one really worked, and not well at that. 4. Loud. Since I was in a suite, it was separate from the rooms on each side by a door (on each side). I could hear the people on both sides of me. I don' t think this is true for the regular rooms (other than the ones next to the suites).

Reviews.Title: “Rescued from Another Night of Torture”
Reviews.Author: yastreb
Reviews.Content: Second time staying here and well worth it. Had to leave another place we were staying due to the noise, no A/C, and little sleep. After a night of torture the Westin was a nice respite. The Westin had - at the last minute - the rate we wanted and we checked in that night. Still a nice hotel and quiet, great rooms, beds, and good customer service. Nice pool and common areas. Rooms are starting to get a wee bit beat up but not too bad yet for all else you get; and the "business center" is pretty poorly run. For an inexpensive breakfast head to the mall next door that has a an Au Bon Pain with a big breakfast buffet. Also this hotel is close to the T and everything else. I'd stay here again next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel Great Location”
Reviews.Author: quirdavi
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel on a business trip to Boston. The hotel is in a great location close to all the major shops and walking distance to sites. Service was also excellent. One of the best sleeps I have had in a hotel for some time.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: travellingbug21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin using a vacation time share and was not disappointed. We were upgraded to a better room which overlooked the river, the living space in the room was huge as was the bathroom. The hotel is linked to a shopping mall via covered walk ways so being able to have a wonder around the shops is very easy. The covered walk ways also lead you to the Prudential Tower so in the winter months when temperatures are below freezing this is a fantastic bonus. The palm restaurant is overpriced and you wont get value for money. For 2 steaks we ended up paying over $100, this was not served with fries, salad or any sort of sides which was a little disappointing. The tour bus stops are close to the hotel and Boston Common is about 10-15 mins walk away from the hotel. The Westin was a fantastic hotel and when we next return to Boston we will make sure this is where we will stay everytime!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: divot316
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were celebrating our anniversary so I was looking for an upscale hotel in a great location. I have stayed at other Westin hotels while on business and was able to get the Westin Copley Place for $117.00 per night on Priceline. Checking in was a breeze and as usual, the Westin staff was exceptionally friendly and accommodating. In fact, when the desk agent learned of our anniversary, we were upgraded to a suite and provided a complimentary breakfast for one of the mornings. Our room was clean and comfortable. Westinâ€™s Heavenly Bed lived up to its name and we both slept well. The Heavenly Shower was no more than a second shower head with decent water pressure. The toiletries (soap, shampoo, conditioner and lotion) were also provided. If I had to point out anything negative it would be the cheap Hamilton Beach iron which only made it more difficult to press our cloths. The room also had a desk larger than most kitchen tables, internet access ($9.95 per day), in room safe, 42â€� LCD television with cable and HBO. If you are not used to staying in 4-star hotels you will soon learn the hotel restaurants cater to guests who prefer upscale dining. With the exception of the breakfast buffet in The Huntington ($24.00 per person) which was excellent, we did not use the hotel restaurants. There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance. Parking at the hotel is $42.00 per night plus tip for the valet. I found a great web site boston.bestparking.com. Here, you can enter the address in Boston where you are staying. The site will display a virtual map with parking garages in the area and their rates. You can print a â€œrate guaranteeâ€� and save. I self-parked at the Prudential Center. Their normal rate is $39.00 per day but with the printed voucher, the rate was reduced to $25.00 per day. It was a very short walk to the hotel. Overall, we were very satisfied with this hotel and would recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: CB48
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last year, and although we loved the location and found the front desk/concierge staff to be friendly and knowledgeable, we had issues with our room (don't worry - no bedbugs!). Having expressed those issues, we were invited back to try the hotel again. This trip was to celebrate a birthday, and we mentioned that when booking. Our room/suite this time was great - room 2512 - with panoramic views of the Charles, a VERY comfy king bed and a nice seating area. The room was very clean. We were able to check in upon arrival (noon ish) and came back from lunch to find a nice birthday balloon bouquet. Later that evening we were also surprised with a fruit/cheese plate. These gestures were very kind and show a commitment to making their guests feel welcome. As many other reviews have already pointed out - the location is good: access to the T, nearby restaurants and grocery stores, the Duck Tour and BosTix booth as well as indoor connections to the surrounding malls. Needless to say, the Westin Copley Place is back on our list of preferred hotels!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: sunnysideuppls
Reviews.Content: Have nothing bad to say about the Westin. This was our second stay at this hotel. The location is perfect, cannot be beat. The rooms are very large, the beds are amazing, the rooms have large windows for great views, the fitness center is excellent as well as the pool. The staff is great, helpful and pleasant and always willing to go above and beyond. When we checked in the gentleman asked us why we visiting and we told him it was our 5 year anniversary, so he upgraded us to a suite! That was a great surprise. We ate at Turner Fisheries one night (the restaurant in the hotel) and it was very good. We also had a drink at bar 10 that night (their trendy bar) and that was good as well. The hotel is connected to the Copley Mall and it is convenient to take a stroll through there. There is an Au Bon Pain in the mall and we got breakfast there each morning. Just a word of caution, the mini bar is very expensive but also on a sensor. If you pick up anything in the fridge and then put it back you will get charged. That happened to us on our first visit since we removed items to refrigerate some items we brought with us. When we checked out they removed the charges from the bill once I explained though. Also, we use a garage on St. James Ave to park and walk the 2 blocks to the hotel. It is half the cost of what you will pay using the valet at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay at the Westin Copley Place - Thanks Dedo!”
Reviews.Author: likethebest
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Westin Copley Place with my daughter over spring break. We needed a hotel with a good location as we would be looking at several colleges in the area. The Westin was perfect. The location is super convenient to everything in Boston. I called the Westin before our stay to find out about weather, buses, location etc....I talked to Dedo at the concierge desk. Dedo was just wonderful. He gave me all the information I needed and also offered to upgrade my room because of my starwood preferred guest status. We couldn't wait to meet Dedo upon our arrival.....which we did, the man never sleeps. He is ALWAYS there and is so helpful.....he truly deserves a raise!! Our room was just wonderful and the location just can't be beat....Take the Duck Tour and go to Little Italy for terrific Italian food and Pastrys from Mikes Pastry Shop.

Reviews.Title: “Another Fine Stay at the Westin, C.P.”
Reviews.Author: JLost
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this location and hotel at least five or six times before and still a great stay. The room was clean, pretty large, and well-located in Boston. For leisure trips to Boston, the hotel is attached to the Prudential Mall for shopping if the weather is bad and there are many T stops close by if the weather is good. The pool as well as fitness center (although there is no proper locker room) are nice and the staff was helpful. Bed was comfy too. I stayed on a Saturday night, asked for a late check-out and was granted a 2p.m. check-out. Basically, nothing but praise for this stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: susy2010
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, located in downtown at Boston. Just a little expensive, but a good service. They have many events, I went to the Biomedical Conferences 2010.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, some improvements”
Reviews.Author: AndrewW2
Reviews.Content: All in all, a very good hotel. It's what you'd expect for a large, chain hotel: large reception areas, large halls, tall building, missing a feeling of intimacy. But that's OK and what one should expect. The location is excellent and especially as it is connected to a shopping centre - great feature in the Winter. Reception staff were excellent and check-in and out were efficient, perfectly done, fast and courteous. The room was an excellent size and sufficient amenities on the SPG Preferred Floor. I had a room that overlooked the city on the 34th floor and it was very nice. Biggest complaint would be that I could hear every word from my neighbour in the neighbouring room. There is virtually no sound insulation for the doors that adjoin rooms. I'd imagine his work desk was right beside the set of (closed) doors and I could hear every word of his conference call - great for corporate espionage. My neighbour also woke up at 0455 on Wed as I could hear his alarm as well. He took a further call that lasted about 15 minutes and watched TV. You get the picture - avoid rooms with connecting doors. The rooms have beautiful flat screen TV's but you'll be disappointed there is no cable to actually enjoy anything good. Room was very clean. Westin beds are legendary. Internet is 19$ for two days. Not bad for costs nowadays but other hotels offer it for free. Gym is not bad with plenty of cardio machines but the weights area is crowded. Gym is a bit tired, pool was full of kids. Breakfast was a limited buffet - good quality, but the same every day. Serving staff was good and efficient however. An objection in principle would be the hotels' environmental approach to things. The hotel (Westin) waxes lyrical about "wellness" and tries to play on themes of being green, etc. There is an opt-out option for housekeeping which garners $5 per day in a gift card or 500 Starwood points. This is a nice option but let's get real - this is for labour savings, not because laundry is being spared. I took advantage of this programme and appreciated it but have no illusions it was for the environment. It's hypocritical of the hotel not to have a simple recycling programme for the bottles of water I consumed at the hotel; newspapers that I read or other rubbish. A master light switch would have also encouraged some real 'green' practices. Come on, who are you fooling? A good hotel and would stay here again. A

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Prof01
Reviews.Content: Registration process was flawless. Arrived at hotel before 9:30am. No problem. No waiting. Finished registering a minute w/o having to sign anything. Room was good - comfy bed, clean, all amenities. Bathroom light went out and hotel had someone fix it within 15 minutes of calling front desk. Only "complaint" was that the LG flat TV only had analog channels. If hotels upgrade to large flat TV screens, why in the world do they not provide HD reception? Internet access $10/day with a fast connection - wired or wireless in rooms, wireless throughout hotel. The hotel is connected to Copley Plaza shopping center and and Prudential Building with its shops and Sheraton Hotel, and across the street from the Fairmont Hotel and its Oak Room bar and restaurant. Guests have 24/7 access to a computer and printer in the lobby for printing airline boarding passes. We asked for and got a late check out (2pm). We'd definitely come back to the Westin Copley.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishGirl15
Reviews.Content: Great location in copley place. Attached to two shopping malls so you dont need to venture out into the cold. Couple of minutes walk to the T. Tour buses stop in copley place. Room was a great size, no noise from adjoining rooms. Very clean. Staff polite, check in/out painless. Breakfast slightly expensive at $24 for the buffet but the food was good and we had it three mornings in a row! Palm restaurant serves nice steaks, expect to pay around $45 for steak and sides extra. I would stay here again for the location and service received.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, rooms were ok.”
Reviews.Author: HHdreamin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for leisure on the weekend, then for business. If you are planning a stay in Back Bay, this is the perfect location. Particularly in the Boston winters, the hotel is connected to the Mall, and the convention center so you can maximize the indoors. All service aspects were top-notch, as I've seen with Westin's. The rooms were somewhat on the average side however. I would stay again for location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, conformable beds, decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mpeet001
Reviews.Content: Certainly not the greatest hotel i have been to but not bad at all. Very clean, excellent location for Boston, comfortable rooms. The restaurants in the hotel are overpriced and not good and i would avoid those. But the rooms themselves are an excellent value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lim5
Reviews.Content: Ideal hotel for a solo traveller. In a great location, close to shopping and sightseeing etc. I had nice room on 34th floor with great views of the city. Lots of good restaurants nearby or in the shopping malls. The only negative was that I found the bar a bit too dark for a female alone.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Vacationqueen84
Reviews.Content: We just stayed there this past weekend. It was my first stay at a Westin and I have to say I was disappointed. The room was nothing special, although it did have a great view over the Charles River. Bathroom was tiny and needed updating. The shower was plugged, the bathroom ceiling was in need of work and the room and bathroom just looked old and tired. Also, I called the hotel two weeks before our visit to speak with the Concierge to get a recommendation for a restaurant. She gave me a name, told me she'd book it and get back to me. She didn't ,so I booked it myself. Turned out that she had made the reservation, but didn't tell me, so we ended up with 2 reservations. I found out the day before our stay so had to take care of sorting this out. Other gripes, limited bathroom products, many basic channels on the TV were not working the first night, they forgot to leave us cups/glasses when they cleaned the room and we had to chase around to get some. Positives; the location, especially in the Winter can't be beat. Breakfasts, although expensive were good. The room was quiet. There are much better choices of hotel in Boston though, so I don't think we will be returning to the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great no nonsense hotel in a nice location”
Reviews.Author: JFulton
Reviews.Content: Did not read the reviews before I stayed there (the place was the closest to where I needed to be for work so we just booked it), but I was very surprised by the strong negatives. My room had nice furnishings, was spacious and very convenient. This is not the Ritz Carlton - its an upscale hotel that is geared more toward business travelers and tourists rather than those expecting a hotel resort escape. If you are looking for competent service, a clean well appointed room in a great location, you will not be disappointed by the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Awful”
Reviews.Author: Roe44
Reviews.Content: Wouldn't recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. Lobby dark and dingy. Hotel large and impersonal. Staff unhappy and not willing to help. As a solo female traveller, I caution you not to stay here. Hallways are long and empty. Not a feeling of safety at all. The surrounding area full of homeless, beggars and drug dealers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.. can do alot without walking outside”
Reviews.Author: u2greek
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Copley recently with my family before I attended a conference in another hotel. We are glad we selected this hotel because during the one night we stayed at the hotel, the weather was terrible, and did not desire to walk outside in the cold, wind and rain. The hotel is connected conveniently to Copley Place and the Prudential Center for shopping and dining. Hotel lobby is located on the second floor of the hotel, so was not easy to transport our bags up and down to our car. The lobby was a little too loud for our liking, particularly with the hotel bar right next to the elevators. The lobby was also not lit to create a nightlife ambience, but doesnt help when you are staying with your family. Of course, cost to park the car was astronomical ($42), and you do not have many other options other than to park in the Copley Place and drag your stuff with you. The hotel rooms were your usual Westin rooms, but a tad on the small side. Comfortable and clean though. Would recommend staying here if you want to be in the heart of Boston, and for could not complain about the price we paid for a Saturday night.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for more”
Reviews.Author: bigkatt68
Reviews.Content: Great location......Rooms were quiet.......Great staff........Great rooms with those heavenly beds. I've stayed in alot of hotels and this one ranks up there with the best!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaMe
Reviews.Content: The shower was plugged, and the room cleaning people forgot to put fresh paper cups in the room the last day we were there so we couldn't make coffee at 5:30am. Then we asked the check out people if we could get some coffee and none was made that early.... So no coffee on our way to the airport!! The bathroom was too small. The concierge service was wonderful, though. I just don't think the price was worth it. I've stayed at other Westins and they have all been excellent. I would look for another hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Heart of Copley Square”
Reviews.Author: kmc1021
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend in Boston and the Westin worked out great. The Hotel is very impressive and the connection to the Galery at Copley Square was great considering the wet weather all weekend. Lobby was very comfortable and the staff was very courteous. We arrived at 10:30 AM and one of our 2 rooms was ready, with an upgrade to riverview. Rooms were very well appointed and the beds were heavenly. Would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but average hotel”
Reviews.Author: njpmg
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night for business. The location can't be beat, and the sky walk access to the Prudential Center and the shopping mall is great (especially when it's cold outside). That said the hotel needs a little sprucing up. There were signs of wear and tear in my room. The bed was quite heavenly, but the shower was nothing special. The bathroom was small but functional. The room could have been cleaned better too -- I found random hairs in the very white tub and mildew on the shower curtain. The gym is adequate, and there is an indoor pool, which I didn't use. Overall, the Westin is okay, but certainly not outstanding. I would consider another hotel the next time I'm in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location---Exactly what you would expect from a Westin”
Reviews.Author: jayaveritt
Reviews.Content: Unbeatable location connected to two very upscale malls. Easy walking distance to the freedom trail and all of the sights Boston has to offer. Also very convenient to the T green line station. Hotel itself was exactly what you would expect from Westin. Good beds, decent common areas, courteous staff, all-in-all a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a few little things...”
Reviews.Author: meowgrrl33
Reviews.Content: Trying to find an affordable hotel in Boston can be quite a challenge. We took advantage of Starwood's second night 1/2 price promo at the Westin Copley Place. We arrived at 9:30 in the morning and were planning to have our bags stowed for the day. Happily, our room was ready and we were able to move from two queens to a king bed that wasn't available when I booked online. The room size is adequate and the bathroom is fine. The shower head is very 1980's as noted by a previous post. The tub was worn but the room was clean. The main issue is the soundproofing at this hotel. We could hear our neighbours sneezing and coughing and their cell phone conversations word for word. When they checked out early they forgot to reset their alarm clock, which we could hear through the wall for hours. The location of this hotel can't be beat. It's very central and a block from the nearest t-stop. It's extremely simple to get to the Westin from the airport using public transit. There are several decent restaurants if you can't make it out for dinner. The concierge service at the hotel is great. They could answer every question and gave great advice regarding local diners and restaurants. If the rooms had updated soundproofing, we would stay again. Otherwise, we'll stay in the same area at another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but really TIRED.”
Reviews.Author: DallasNitpicker
Reviews.Content: needs alot of updates, comon areas are beat up and dingy. Room was just OK, bed was great. Bathrooms are REALLY small and the heavenly shower consist of a 1980's shower with 2 heads. Parking is 42.00 per night...stayed in room 3609

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hershey220
Reviews.Content: It's a Westin, they're nice hotels, but kind of pricey too. The room was nice, the hotel seemed newly renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Spectacular View”
Reviews.Author: Shuuz
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night stay at the Westin Hotel on Copley Square. The location was excellent in a safe upscale neighborhood very close to many sights. We had a room on the 35th floor and the view of Boston was spectacular. The room was clean, spacious and comfortable and included a coffee maker, flat screen TV, mini bar, hair dryer, great feather pillows and a small sitting area. The water pressure was inadequate so the shower was less than satisfactory. Also the lighting in the bathroom was poor and the pillow top bed was too soft for our taste. The staff were helpful and it was nice having a bar, restaurant and shopping center in the hotel without going outdoors.We also enjoyed the gym, jacuzzi and swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good location; but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Ed0902
Reviews.Content: We had booked and pre-paid 5 nights; on arrival the booked room wasn't available; the booking in their system showed only 4 nights (we had used the Westin website to book and pay for the room); we got a bigger room the first night and then had to move the next day into a standard room. Because of this change, their system again charged us for the another 3 nights(?), it took over 24 hours to have them fix this issue and the problem was because we had change rooms!!!. The hotel is in good location, however its a churn and burn hotel and lacks soul. Not what we expected from the Westin chain.

Reviews.Title: “Met Westin expectations but bathroom was small and worn out”
Reviews.Author: traveling_esquire
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel Sept. 18-20 with our 4 year old son. We are SPG Gold members and were upgraded to a river view room on the SPG floor upon our arrival. The lobby and other public areas on the lower floors appear to be newer than the hallways leading to the rooms. The hallway on the SPG floor seemed worn and outdated. Flourescent lights, low ceiling, that kind of thing. Not as new or updated as the Westin Times Square, for example. We entered our room which was spacious and clean; definitely up to Westin's standards. Decor is standard Westin decor; neat and modern. Heavenly bed was on par with other Westins. However, the bathroom was quite small and looked worn. Tub tile surround looked worn as did the walls and bathroom door. Housekeeping was efficient and unintrusive. We ordered room service on several occasions. Each time our order was 100% correct and food was tasty and of the appropriate temperature. Room service also arrived within the time promised, which was never more than 30 minutes. A good job for a hotel that was booked with several weddings and a convention all at the same time. The location of this hotel is ideal for sightseeing and shopping on Newbury Street. It is linked by a skybridge to the Copley Square mall. You can continue through the mall to the Marriott where you can board the various trolley tours that operate in Boston. Also, the service at this hotel was excellent. All points of contact were friendly and efficient. This is why one of the reasons why we consistently choose Westin. I would definitely return to this hotel when visiting Boston in the future. Many thanks to the TA Boston forum folks for helping me choose this hotel. You were right!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, within walking distance of many attractions.”
Reviews.Author: luvtravelLuvtravel
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was great - within walking distance of the subway system. The hotel staff was courteous and upgraded us to a suite on the upper floors to celebrate our anniversary. Great views of all of Boston!

Reviews.Title: “amazing stay- Clean! in the heart of boston! great food! great bed!”
Reviews.Author: nickthe
Reviews.Content: amazing stay- Clean! in the heart of boston! great food! great bed! I liked the matress so much I purchased one for my house.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: okhelpme
Reviews.Content: great location, clean rooms . great food. easy access. location great

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Boston's Back Bay”
Reviews.Author: LMMWest
Reviews.Content: We'd lived in Boston's Back Bay until recently so when planning our visit we knew exactly the best location(s). This Westin is located in the upscale Copley Place with great indoor shopping, cafes and restaurants. It's connected to the Prudential Center, another fun indoor location for browsing the shops, a variety of eateries plus the elevator taking one up to the Top of the Hub dining area and sky walk. The Westin service is superb. We turned our rental car over to the hotel staff with no fuss or additional time or paperwork. The hotel is very clean and extremely well run. It's large but that does not diminish the personal service. Our room was on the 22nd floor and had a nice view of Boston's trendy South End and looking toward Logan airport. The room purchased thru Hotwire was large, very comfortable with sitting area, small refrig., in-room coffee maker, nice bathroom and the Westin's signature bedding which is extremely luxurious and comfy. This Westin location which is directly across from Boston's famous Trinity Church and Old South Church is easy walking to Beacon Hill's Charles Street, The Public Gardens and Boston Common. We caught the #39 bus, right across from the hotel, to the MFA (Museum of Fine Arts) a 10 minute ride along Huntington Ave. Boston is a divine walking city and the Westin couldn't be a better location....whether it's walking, or a short cab ride or easy convenient bus trip, this Westin is a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and close to many site seeing spots!”
Reviews.Author: chrissy7Delaware
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copely service was great. They were very helpful in many ways but mostly about getting around the city especially traveling with a 1 1/2 yr old! The room was nice and clean. We loved the location which was close to Newbury St and the Boston Commons. The hotel was also connected to a mall and had many restaurants in close proximity. The only thing I wasn't happy about was the crib. It was called the Westin Heavenly crib but there wasn't anything heavenly about it. My son did not like it at all. But all and all the pros out way the cons and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, could probably find better for the price”
Reviews.Author: KatieDavis
Reviews.Content: Enjoying Boston right now. Was an amazing city!! So much character, lots to do. Loving all the history!! When I return again, I will probably choose a different hotel. This place is just average and for the price, I think you can find a better gem. The location is great. It connects via a mall to the Marriott and the Prudential building. Very near Newbury street with lots of fun shopping. Central and a great location to start your Boston site seeing. For the hotel itself, I think it is a Westin that is going a little downhill. Lobby could use a remodel and the rooms seem old. Bathroom has chipped tile, a toilet you always have to flush twice, and they are pretty skimpy on the bathroom toiletries. No shower gel, face soap, cotton swabs, whatnot. They do have a pool and gym, both pretty clean but modest. I prefer a hotel where the price is what it is, and find it pretty annoying that you have to pay extra each day for internet in your room. Yes, this is frequently the case at many hotels, but I think it's tacky. Just add $9 per day to the price of the room and include it! Who doesn't travel with their computer these days? I like a hotel that pays attention to the details of just making their guest feel provided for, and this goes against this. Oh! and what I find the most annoying is these mini-bars where you're charged if you just touch something. Ever bring home left overs from an amazing dinner and just want a fridge to place it in for the night? I bought a bunch of Cannolies from Mike's Pastries (in the North End Italian Village - which is amazing!) and I needed to keep them chilled but could not in lame mini-bar. Annoying and wasteful. A hotel should pay attention to the simple details that make their customer's visit easy and hassle free. The Westin does not. Last, the walls are thin and early in the am, all the conference travelers are leaving their rooms about 7:15 am and IT IS LOUD. No sleeping in here! Wish I had earplugs. BUT, with that said, the Westin Heavenly beds are great! I love the white, feels very clean and the bed is so comfortable. Overall, it's not bad. Maybe I am just too critical because I have been lucky to stay at some other amazing places in the past.

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs at $289/night?!?”
Reviews.Author: MERLOC
Reviews.Content: It's almost 3 AM and I'm awake and feeling itchy...I think there are BED BUGS in my room! I didn't notice this earlier when I checked in, but the comforter has a few small brown-ish spots on it, and after I tore apart the bed, I found a few small brown spots/specs on the mattress. This is apparently a tell-tale sign of BED BUGS, based on my internet searching just now. I just want to sleep, but don't think that'll be happening here at the Westin Copley. How disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: atlhppwt
Reviews.Content: You won't find a better hotel location in Boston, with both the Copley Square (Green line) and Back Bay (Orange line) stations a block from the hotel, making it a cinch to get anywhere in the city. Check in was quick and easy and we stowed our luggage since we arrived early. A nice touch was receiving a phone call during our museum visit, letting us know our room was ready. Lots of oohs and aahs over the oh-so-comfortable heavenly beds. Skip the overpriced hotel breakfast and walk a few steps to the Au bon Pain in Copley Place for an amazing selection of baked goods, breakfast buffet, made to order breakfast sandwiches and other goodies. A good breakfast can be had for $5-6. I'd earned a free night through the Starwood Preferred Guest program and free means free. No taxes or hidden fees.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: lkuhn
Reviews.Content: nice area with HUGE mall great food!! relaxing yet fun

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Back Bay location”
Reviews.Author: SF94597
Reviews.Content: I travel to Boston frequently for business & this is a good hotel for my needs. Rooms are clean, include coffee maker with Starbucks coffee, robe, comfortable beds. Haven't had any problems with noise. Location at Copley Place is convenient for my business needs & close to restaurants & shops. My first choice in area is Back Bay Hotel (formerly known as Jurys) - however cost is sometimes outside company guidelines & this is a close second. Prefer this hotel over the Fairmont Copley Plaza or Taj - both of which I find old /worn & expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Vegas Style Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MalibuMike
Reviews.Content: As a tourist for the first time in Boston I stayed where I got the best deal on Hotwire and it was at The Westin in Copley Square. It's an okay location if you want to shop at the mega-mall the hotel is attached to but next time I would want to stay closer in to the central city. The Westin is a big (30 floors) modern hotel with standard amenities. Valet parking cost $42 a day but you can park yourself around the corner on Clarendon street for half the price. Room was comfortable and bedding good so really no complaints on that end.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: CTTRVL
Reviews.Content: The hotel can be described as your typical Westin, but some furnishings may need to be updated. Typical amenties include bathrobes, double head showers, white linens, flat screen tv, extra space, etc. The room itself was clean. Always, important to us for any of our stays. This hotel has valet parking only for those who like to self-park. Location is great! It's close to Public Gardens, Boston Commons, John Hancock Building, Prudential Building, Fenway Park, Newbury Street shopping, Quincy Market, etc. Having lived in Boston, this place is an awesome place for us when we visit. Everything is a short walk to us. If walking is not your thing, the "T" (mass transit) is easily accessible. We would recommend either the Westin or the Sheraton (several blocks away).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: want2seaitall
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for $132/night on Hotwire. So, for that price, I was very satisfied with my stay. If I had paid what the hotel's site was quoting, I'd have felt I got a bad deal. You can't beat this location. It was a 15 minute walk to Fenway...go Sox!!! It was a 20 minute walk to begin the Freedom Tour. Or, you can walk to the inbound T station just the other side of the library across the street to the Park stop and get off there. There is a Shaws within walking distance. The duck tours are just outside the entrance to the hotel in front of the Prudential Center. There are plenty of choices around for pubs/bars etc. The concierge was always extremely helpful with restaurant pics and pointing us in the right direction. They also helped my family by printing out our boarding passes for SW airlines. We wanted to get boarding group A, but would be out all day 24 hours prior to our boarding time. So, they did it for us, which was extremely helpful. Our room was on the 34th floor and overlooked the city...nice view. It was a large room with 2 queens, desk and seating area with table/1 chair. Only complaints: hot tub was not filled for our visit and we would have really liked to use it after our long days of walking the city. The restaurant and room services food prices are absolutely ridiculous...even considering Boston prices. We never used them as a result. And last, on our last night Monday...the cable went out throughout the entire hotel. It was probably no fault of the hotel and probably more to do with the cable company, but we almost missed our Pats big win!!! Thank goodness for the Marriott's hotel bar!!! I would not hesitate to book this hotel again at the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: HendersonJohn88
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business and it was all that i needed. Location was great to downtown and near great nightlife spots. Clean hotel with friendly staff. Miss Boston already!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Westin hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travel159549
Reviews.Content: Nothing special about this hotel, but it is roomy, clean, and centrally located (near Boston Common). Really nice bathroom, and nice TV. Comfortable bed. If the price is decent, this is a good place to stay in the Copley area (which is not in the primary downtown Boston area, but is next to Boston Common and a 15-20 minute walk to the "Freedom Trail" and other local attractions).

Reviews.Title: “What you would expect”
Reviews.Author: vacationhoundToronto
Reviews.Content: A large, conference hotel that sees many people come and go everyday. Location was perfect, right beside the Boston Public Library and across Copley Square from Trinity Church. Good shopping close by. Slightly disappointed with the room. Our shower curtain was missing many hooks, our bathtub had a chunk out of it. Overall it was adequate but not more than you would expect. Pool and hot tub were a little disappointing, cold and small. Turner Fisheries, the restaurant in the complex was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: davidtwang
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel. We had an issue (smoking) with our next door neighbor and front desk was very helpful with it. this hotel is close to the train station/subway and shopping! Not too thrilled with our $16 burger via room service!

Reviews.Title: “Central, clean Westin hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: craig-stevenson
Reviews.Content: Great location, clean and hospitable, and friendly staff. The usual 'Westin' experience, however be aware that unless you use the privacy card on your door, you are likely to experience a gentleman from housekeeping knocking on your door at 8:00am asking you when you are checking out! I am a 'Gold' member and entitled to a 4:00pm checkout so you would have thought he would know which guests were where and when they were checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donutsfamily
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location for sight seeing - close to the T and walking distance to the Boston Common and Newbury Street"

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: cpaneilRockaway_NJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Copley for 4 nights in August for a family trip. We booked a junior suite since we have an infant and an 8 year old. The room was nice and roomy although we were hoping for more separation so the infant could sleep in peace. This was not to be had, although I don't think you can find such a room in downtown Boston for a reasonable price. That is, without booking a presidential suite or something. The hotel was centrally located in the Back Bay area of Boston. Very close to the subway and Newberry St. and Fenway Park. The staff was very attentive and accommodating. The hotel is very luxurious and attached to Prudential Center, so it is very convenient to walk around and find stuff. The gym and indoor pool are perfect. Boston is a great city with lots to do and see, but its tough to navigate with a stroller as the subway is not stroller friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but service is poor”
Reviews.Author: csotwoVirginia
Reviews.Content: The Westin is in a very convenient location, very close to subway stop, within walking distance of many attractions. Our room was not ready upon arrival so it was agreed our bags would be stored in a secure location. When we arrived back at the hotel 4 hours later the bags were still sitting on the baggage cart outside by the front door. We also had trouble with valet parking. Our car was there waiting for us but no one seemed to know which fellow to go to get the key. We paid for internet connection which was extremely slow. The last straw was this week - when I received my American Express statement the amount was $42 more than my final bill stated. Upon calling the financial office at the hotel the gentleman very quickly found that I was charged for valet parking for the day we left. I can't help but wonder how often they get away with this...

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend”
Reviews.Author: BeenthereChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: Got a great rate by pre-paying for room. However, what I saved on the room was lost on over-priced food- $4 for a soft drink, $22 for breakfast. Didn't bring my computer, and had to pay $6 to use internet for 15 minutes, and this was only available when the shop was open. Restroom on lobby floor only accessible to guests with room key, very annoying to have to fumble for room key. How does that work for visitors at hotel events? Most restaurants in the area are too high price. Location too far from Boston Common, art museum, so $$ spent on cab rides. Mold in bathroom. Vomit in elevator, which I reported and was told they were aware of it. Why wasn't it cleaned up or the elevator taken out of service. Disgusting! One saving grace was on-site Starbucks.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: c3honey84
Reviews.Content: The Westin was in a good spot and was very clean and comfortable. The Duck Tour picks you up right down the street and the Prudential Center with all the shops and restaurants is around the corner. The few things that I was not happy with were the fact that wireless internet was $10 per day, and parking was $40 per day! It was valet only. The other option was parking in a public parking garage a few blocks away. The seafood restaurant in the hotel is not open on Sundays, which I found odd, and the Starbucks is not open very late. Keep in mind, it is a distance from both Fenway Park and the local colleges. And watch the cab drivers! We asked one to take us to Quincy Market, which took us 20 minutes to walk on a previous day. The cab driver took us out on the highway for some reason, and ended up taking just as long to bump up the fare!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: cilly28
Reviews.Content: Our 3 night stay at the Westin Copley Place in Boston was fantastic! We stayed on the 35th floor and was thoroughly impressed with the size of the room (for a city centre hotel), as well as the comfortable beds (we had two queen size beds). Travelling with a toddler, we required the use of their mini-bar fridge. We took all the items out and replaced it with things for our child (ie milk). Since it is sensor-monitored, we received a bill for $160 at the end of our stay. My husband just cleared it up with the staff downstairs and there were no problems. Though the size of the room was spacious, the washroom could have been a little bigger. Also, the ceiling paint/drywall of the shower was peeling and will soon be due for a repair. Since we have a young child who required his milk to be kept cold, we would have liked to have the use of a mini-fridge (other than the tiny mini-bar fridge). It also comes in handy when we have leftovers from dinner. Other than that, nothing really to complain about. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Low Expectations that were greatly exceeded”
Reviews.Author: Aurora100
Reviews.Content: Based on some of the reviews I read here and the comments of some of my co-workers who have stayed here, I had low expectations for this hotel. In reality, I was pleased with the hotel and would return. On the negative side, it is an older property with not a lot of flash. I travel with a lot of electronic gadgets and there a limited amount of outlets to recharge my devices. However, this is a minor criticism. The Westin has to have the best location in Boston in the heart of Back Bay. You are two blocks from Newberry Street shops and connected to a huge indoor shopping center with lots of shops, a good food court (I ate lunch at Pizzeria Regina every day) and plenty of good restaurants. The proximity to this shopping area is a huge bonus, particularly when the weather is bad. The hotel is also a short cab ride or a pleasant 25 minute walk from all the downtown attractions and financial district. Other things I liked about the hotel was an accommodating check-in staff (I came in on the red-eye and wanted to get in my room early), a decent gym and free Wi-Fi in their very nice lobby. The rooms were nice, if nothing memorable, and I was lucky enough to get a 31st floor room with a stunning view of Back Bay and the Charles River. The Westin Copely would be a top contender if I were to return to Boston as I enjoyed my stay there very much.

Reviews.Title: “Central location for business and pleasure”
Reviews.Author: BostonboyMiami
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Westin during a conference. The organizers arrange for us to stay at a different place, but i prefer the Westin for its location and convenience. The rooms are quite large by Boston standards, and the staff is unfailingly nice.
