Shopping and dining options are literally around every corner, or you can simply go across the footbridge to the Copley Place/Prudential for even more options. The service is efficient and helpful, but the hotel is getting a bit older now and it shows; the furniture is a bit chipped and the TV is large but old.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: CATrvl08
Reviews.Content: Check-in took about 10 minutes, but the upgrade to the river view room was fabulous. The views are great and this hotel is attached to the Prudential center and is in close proximity to shopping, restaurants, and tours, etc. Elevators didn't take a long time even though there are about 36 floors. I would definitely stay here again when I am in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Really Great Location”
Reviews.Author: lovemyboobug
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed here for one night before our flight. The interior of the building is very beautiful and our room was really nice. The bathroom was much bigger than other hotels I've stayed at, and everything was sparkling clean. The view wasn't much- looking out over the YWCA, a parking garage and the John Hancock Tower but you can't beat the location. We took the T from the airport to Government Center and walked to Shabu-Zen (YUM!) where we had reservations, then strolled back on to the hotel. Also, when I booked the hotel, their website says the check-in age is 21 (I was 20 at the time). When I came to check in, I had no problem, even though I "wasn't old enough". It was more expensive than places I usually stay, but for our one night in the city it was a nice splurge and saved us a lot of public transportation/car rental fees.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST GUEST SERVICE!”
Reviews.Author: ledox
Reviews.Content: the westin copley hotel deserve a 6 stars for their services! they treat theirs guests very well and professional! they make sure that everything is fine for you. the roomc is great but the bathroom is a little small but its ok. take the breakfast buffet at the hotel restaurant , Bar 10, is yummy!! the location is really goof next to the Prudential center! i recommend that hotel to anyone!!!! A++++

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Melwyjak
Reviews.Content: Four of us, 2 adults and 2 children, enjoyed our two nights in a junior suite. Check-in was fast and we were early. We got a great price on one of the discount travel siites but they treated us fine, put us on a high floor with a great view. We had two Heavenly Queen beds with crisp white bedding, flat-screen TV, one sitting chair w/ ottoman. It would have been nice to have a sofa but the room itself was large enough that we all had plenty of room to spread out. Itâ€™s a huge hotel, nothing fancy but still very nice. The bathroom was pretty small but thatâ€™s not one of my issues so it didnâ€™t bother me (two robes were also provided). No refrigerator in room, only a mini-bar but we knew this before arriving and didnâ€™t even touch it. There was an ice bucket in room and machine on our floor. Elevators were fast, no crowds or wait even though we were told the hotel was full. We pulled our rental car up and they had our luggage out in seconds and it was in our room in less than 15 minutes. We had an early flight and cabs were lined up at 6 am on a Sunday to take us to the airport. I lived in Boston for years and this location canâ€™t be beat. Over the past three years, we have stayed at Fanuel Hall and just outside the city and this was by far our favorite location. You can get anywhere you need to go â€“ subway is across the street, Charles River a few blocks walk, Public Garden and Common several blocks, etc. There is a huge Shaws market across the street (even sold wine) and of course, the Westin is attached to the Copley and Prudential Malls if youâ€™re a shopper. The Pru also has a food court and a Legal Seafoods that has a take-out order station if youâ€™re like us and want to eat in your room. Au Bon Pain is across the walkway to Copley for quick, inexpensive bagels and pastries for breakfast. I canâ€™t think of anything bad to say! We stayed at a supposed 4.5 star hotel in NYC for twice the cost before arriving and we all enjoyed this hotel better. We love Bostonâ€¦one thing we noted was how many more homeless Boston had versus NYC when it used to be the opposite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelingAddict
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was great; fast and smooth check-in (even got a great view of the Charles River) and a comfortable room. We called at night because the air conditioner wasn't working too well and someone was there within 20 minutes to fix it. Though I realized later that most of Boston didn't have their a/c too high. The room was a nice size and the bed was really comfortable. There's a CVS about 2-3 blocks away, the gardens and Boston Common are closeby and the walk to Long Wharf was about 30 minutes. The pool wasn't that big but people were nice and made room for each other.

Reviews.Title: “top hotel in central boston but at a price”
Reviews.Author: gordon-Ireland
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Westin Copley place on business for two nights on business. It really is a top class city center hotel in boston that is on copley square, linked to shopping malls, beside the metro, a short walk from newbury street, the charles river, boston common etc Reception is well staffed. Rooms are very nice - ask for one with a view of the charles river. Breakfast is tasty. Bar is plush and has a nice buzz. Food (I only had lunch) is also good. The catch ... well you pay for the service, location and the westin brand. So keep an eye out for offers.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: sunseekerMaine
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Copley for my daughters 16th birthday and it was perfect. The rooms were spacious and clean. We had a perfect view of the Charles River. The staff were friendly and accomadating. We were able to check in early, get two queen beds in each room and have a great view. The concierge got us into a restuarant that we were told by others would never have a large party on the night of a Red Sox game. The valet was helpful with directions and brought our car out in less than 5 minutes. It was just perfect. My only negatives would be that we were charged for items from the honor bar that we did not consume. After a call to the front desk, the charges were reversed.

Reviews.Title: “Well-located, SO-SO Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: kobekeith
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend last summer and forgot to post a review. Copley is a great area to stay in but I don't think that the Westin is worth the price that it charges. The Marriott would be better for sure as it is connected to the Prudential Center. With that said, this year, I stayed in the TAJ and that was above and beyond ANYTHING compared to the WESTIN Copley. The Westin must attract conventions so it has a zoo-like atmosphere in the lobby, in front of the elevators and on the elevators. It was always crowded and noisy. The rooms were average and the bathrooms were not as clean as I like to see. I usually like the Westin Hotels so this one was not up to par as far as I have seen in other parts of the world. It was not worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful rooms and view!”
Reviews.Author: leafsfans
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights of our honeymoon here, and right from the time we arrived, until we checked out, the service was wonderful! Our room was gorgeous and we had a great view. The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Newbury street for amazing shopping, restaurants, and people watching. We also were able to walk to Fenway Park (about 30 min) and the theatre district (about 20 min). The concierge will gladly highlight your way for you on one of their maps. One downfall is that you have to sit in the lobby for the free wireless internet, but I didnt mind too much, as there is a starbucks in the mall that is attached to the hotel (right near the lobby), so I just got a coffee, and sat in the comfortable couches for a bit each morning. The attached mall also had great shopping!! Beware that the parking is very expensive, but it is like that everywhere in the City. We definately reccommend staying at the Westin Copley Place for your stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great priceline deal but for a westin cleanliness was poor”
Reviews.Author: JPFA
Reviews.Content: Westin Copley, great location, beautiful views and the famous Westin beds. For that nothing to complain. Perfect two night stay. BUT why an overall average scor? Although with a great priceline bid price I can't complain but if I was paying rack rate it would be different. I was staying at the 32 floor (starwod prefered guest floor) and you would expect they offer the freguent guests the bes of the best. To be honest, the carpet in the room was not as clean as expected, stains etc made it a bit filfty. The bathroom was also outdated and really needs to be refurbished. Cleanliness was also down, you don't want to find a hair from the previous guest on the floor or in the tub... So, for the price I paid, more than a good deal but for people paying a few hundrerd bucks....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location to Watch July 4th Fireworks Celebration”
Reviews.Author: nola1961
Reviews.Content: Great location and a good value. On Copley Square with many restaurants with in easy walking distance. Not far from the Boston Common and the Freedom Trail. We stayed here because of the easy access to the Charles River where the fireworks celebration took place. Will come again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay over July 4th weekend.”
Reviews.Author: beachbuzzard
Reviews.Content: Great location for weekend trip to Boston. We had no problem with the room. Were there to sleep and shower mostly, but got a great deal on Hotwire. It was clean and the bed was comfy. My only beef was lack of vending machines; they expect you'll use the minibar at those insane prices. We weren't there that much anyway, I was just a little thirsty for a coke the last night... but I passed and drank a little water instead. To save a few $$, we parked our car at Woodland Station along the T (Green-D-Riverside line) and took into the city. T stop is right across the street. Parking for the weekend at Woodside was $13, compared to $42 a night at the hotel. The parking at Woodland is a garage in a great neighborhood (condos, country clubs, hospital all right there).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great views from the 33rd floor”
Reviews.Author: Angelinas74
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was nice - what you'd expect from a Westin - but the location is what I'd rave about most. It's so convenient to everything, and the hotel is even attached to a mall. Newbury Street is only a few blocks away, and if you're feeling feisty, you can walk most of the city from there. Free wi-fi in the lobby. Cant beat the Heavenly Bed. The bathroom was only meh. Also, if you're not registered as a Starwood Preferred guest, I'd advise signing up (it's free) and there's always a good chance you'll pick up a few perks (higher floors, better amenities, etc).

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: realinvestor101
Reviews.Content: Service level of the hotel is good. I had to be taken to emergency due to food poisoning during my stay. The staff there new how to handle the situation well. A++. When we arrived we noted there cleaning issues in the room, and the sink water tend to get clogged. It took the staff two days to fix it the clogs. Overall, the room were good with good view. As the title suggests the hotel is in a central location. There are a number of hotels around here as well. My understanding this is one of the newer hotels. Thing I liked the most is the location Least: A number of time the room bar got charged. Following our call the staff fixed it. However, it is quite annoying. Recommend future guests to review your bill thoroughly before paying.

Reviews.Title: “great views and location in heart of shopping area”
Reviews.Author: ncftrav
Reviews.Content: We were thrilled with the Westin. They gave us an upgrade to a river view even though we got the room through priceline. It was the 21st floor and we had a great view of the city and river. Everyone in hotel was extremely helpful when we asked for directions around town or to store our luggage the day of checkout. Elevators move super quick and there are a lot of them. Compared to the marriott downtown magnificent mile in middle of chicago, this hotel had a quieter, classier feel to it. It had the same great access to shopping as mag mile in chicago. We didn't have to go outside to access 2 malls (those in prudential center and those connected to the marriott copley place). Starbucks was at bottom of our hotel, duck tour across street, and the entrance to t can be seen from front of hotel. We walked a nice walk in rain to fenway park past a long stretch of gardens and beautiful town homes. There is a 5 story BU bookstore/barnes and nobles on that walk, pizzeria uno, and a cheap, delicious bagel store. Very disappointed with California Pizza, but that was truly the only low point of our trip (and it is not actually part of Westin, just in mall). The great thing about the Westin is that you can come back to your room at end of day tired, and just go out steps away to public library, the pru, and shopping. Saw a CVS within a block. Bathrooms in this Westin are a good size (better lay out than I have seen at other 4 stars so easy to move around). They leave nice smelling white tea shampoo and conditioner, and soap carved like a leaf. Starbucks coffee packets in room and they always left 2 caffeinated ones. This is a big deal. I can't stand getting only 1 measley cup of coffee to start day. The cups were to-go cups with lids (and large). TV was a flat-screen and beds were heavenly beds. Robes in room and no odd charges for refrig as I heard about (although we didn't even try to touch it). The lobby area has low lighting, candles, and tons of couches in different directions. It's on a second floor and just a great place for teens to sit while parents get directions. It rained our entire trip and staying here with view and malls made a huge difference for my teen. He had plenty to entertain him without going far. He gave rave reviews on the huge barnes and nobles in the mall and brookstone with its gadgets and foot massager at the end of the day. I don't know when he turned into a teen, but the museums held almost no interest for him and the malls a lot. He slept until 12 every day and housekeeping never once knocked on my door before then. Yet they always refreshed our entire room in afternoons. So again, hotel was a big plus. One change I may have made is to take a taxi to hotel from airport. Our luggage was rough to carry up and down stairs on t as you transfer trains. I'd only do this if I had a light bag for a 2 day trip.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Experience”
Reviews.Author: CMV1984
Reviews.Content: The hotel was lovely. Very clean and had many upscale shops/ restaurants. Location was ideal - across the street from the park, close to the T, and within walking distance to nearly all the different neighborhoods in Boston. Also of note - I mistakenly left a very expensive pair of earrings on the night stand, and the cleaning staff were VERY kind to look for them, call me when they were found, and mail them to me!! Really was an admirable thing to do.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: neslaw1
Reviews.Content: Just spent a great weekend in Boston. Stayed at the Westin Copley. Got a great price off of Hotwire. Everybody was very accomodating. Room was upgraded and stayed on the 33rd fl with a view to Fenway to the west and over the whole Newbury St, Comm Av ,Charles river and North to NH. Just wandered to find a place for dinner on Fri nite without a reservation with my Dad. We walked into the Atlantic Fish Co on Boylston and had a great dinner appetizer, bottle of wine and main course for $50 each and stayed for about 2 hours. At no time were we rushed. The room was booked but we got in as a reservation was a no show. Try the Cape Cod Bluefish. Appetizer was Ipswich belly clams which was very lightly breaded and tasty but not many for the money. But, this was dinner in Boston and if you really want belly clams you need to go to the Clam Shack on Wollaston Beach or some similar place. Breakfast on Saturday was at Joe's American on Newbury. Again, a little expensive but I must say my pancakes with a berry compote inside were some of the best ever. During the day Saturday, we took a ride to Nantasket. If you have never gone there, the views from Point Allerton are really spectacular as you look towards Boston light, the city skyline and watch the planes landing at logan. We also drove along Atlantic Av which is just south of Hull going towards Hingham which is like 17 mile drive in Carmel, Ca without the golf course-- just beautiful homes and mansions, great views of the ocean and numerous small islands and jettys. This is a great day trip less than an hour from the city instead of driving all the way to the Cape and fighting that traffic. While we had other engagements, the nightlife along Boylston was incredibly busy at every bar from Vox Populi to the Mandarin Oriental Hotel. Lots of people looking to see and be seen. Almost forgot, walked about a mile through the various Back Bay neighborhoods which was a great way to really see what living in Boston can be all about. Lots of restored brownstones, parks, and a feeling like you are in South Ken in London. Can't wait to get back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: NYCJami
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley is one of the two hotels I always try and stay at in Boston. The staff is always friendly and helpful and makes you feel welcome. The rooms are well appointed and have the Heavenly Beds which I love. And the location in Back Bay is very convenient to nearby shopping and restaurants as well as the South End neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend in Boston”
Reviews.Author: dgtray
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin June 4 â€“ 7. After arriving we considered riding the T to the hotel and waited a few minutes for the bus to take us to the blue line station. However, we decided to take a taxi which cost $26 before the tip vs. the T since we didnâ€™t want to have to carry our luggage up and down stairs. Check in was a breeze and we had a view of the Charles river on the 32nd floor. The room was nice with a flat screen TV, king size bed, couple of chairs and reasonably sized bathroom. The hotel is in a great location and you can use the walkways to travel several blocks without going outside. The orange and green T lines are located a block away from the hotel. We bought a weekly pass for $15, since the daily pass was $9 and used the T often to get around the city. The library is across the street and you can get 15 minutes of free internet time. If you want to pick up grocery items there is a Shaws Market across the street from the hotel and several CVS/Walgreen stores nearby. There are several restaurants located inside the mall areas and in the Back Bay. We ate twice at Legal Seafoods (the one closest to the Westin), Au Bon Pain for breakfast each morning and lunch when we arrived, Charleyâ€™s a couple of blocks away for dinner, lunch in the North End twice. Also, we went by Modern Pastry for tiramisu which was excellent. If you want to run or walk you take Dartmouth towards the river and will be able to take the foot bridge over the road and you are on the running/walking/biking trail around the river. The hotel can give you information on a 3 or 5 mile loop. The Boston side of the river has asphalt trails and a lot of shade, but the Cambridge side has concrete sidewalks with lots of places where you can trip on uneven surfaces. We didnâ€™t spend a lot of time around the hotel and tried to enjoy our time in Boston. We took the Duck Tour our first morning and it was very enjoyable. The pickup place is across the street from the hotel in front of Shaws. We reserved our seats ahead of time to get the first tour Thursday morning at 9:00. You get a good overview of the city and some nice stories about the points of interest. We spent time at Boston Common and the Botanical Gardens which are beautiful areas. We didnâ€™t walk the Freedom Trail from start to finish, but we spent some time checking out various sites along the way. We thought about going to a Red Sox game, but decided to take the tour instead. It was nice to be able to walk around the park and enjoy vantage points from several places in the stadium. By the way the green line of the T will get you a couple of blocks from Fenway. We went to the Prudential Tower to enjoy the view from the observation deck. Unfortunately half of the deck was blocked due to a special event so we couldnâ€™t view the entire city. This was my first trip to Boston where I could actually tour the city. We were very impressed with the beauty and cleanliness of the city, and there was a lot to do and see. The Westin is a great place to stay to enjoy Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Stay.”
Reviews.Author: axiques
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a weekend trip to Boston and stayed at the Westin Copley. The hotel is in the perfect location as far as we were concerned, everything was in walking distance and the best shops and restaruants were right outside the door. The hotel itself was very nice and well kept and the staff was extremely attentive and informative. We arrived early from teh airport and they accomodated us by having a room ready hours before check in which made our first day that much easier. Their concierge also gave us great information whenever we needed it. All around I can't think of any negatives for the hotel. We highly recommend going there to anyone looking for a great stay in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of Boston lies the perfect hotel.”
Reviews.Author: conradbaines
Reviews.Content: I stayed here from April 23-26, 2009 (like the perfect time to go) because it was hot out but not too hot like it is in July. I am a Starwood Perferred Guest so I got to stay on the thirty-fourth floor (or whatever 2 floors lower than the top is) and I had a really good view (but if I was on the other side of the hotel it would have been better.) It is connected to the Prudential Center!! You have to walk for a while but it is a great deal! It is right next to the Back Bay Amtrak Station which was very convenient. The pool wasnt great but doable. The only thing I didn't like about this hotel is that our ac broke in our room (when we were sightseeing thank god) but the staff fixed it right away and gave us free breakfast the next morning. Also, you have to pay 9 dollars or something like that every day for high speed internet. Besides that, it was great! I am going here every time I go to Boston!!!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LuckySouth
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early May, and the room was fine, standard, and comfortable. Nothing outstanding. I could smell some kind of carpet cleaner and I did not care for that. They do provide starbucks in the room and a daily paper which was nice. I also incurrred about 70 dollars in charges for the mini bar that I never touched. I called and the charges were removed, but I had to stand in line the next day to get a receipt for my own records. The Bar 10 serves overpriced food and drink. I had the lobster sliders which were really 3 tiny, tiny buns with lobster salad in them, Maybe three heaping teaspoons for 18.00. Drinks were pricy also. The price for breakfast was so outrageous to where it was laughable. The hotel is huge and inpersonal but has a nice reception area that leads one out to the conncected mall and the prudential center mall which can be quite handy. Starbucks is only steps away and there were many lovely stores. Of course the hotel is in a great location with Newbury street close by which one can walk to in the am for coffee and pastries or the evening for dinner. I do believe local calls were also very expensive; the bottled water in the room was 8 dollars. The fairmont is across the street and is a must see hotel, very lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Trushte
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful time in Boston and enjoyed staying at the hotel. It has good amenities and the staff were very helpful. It is in a great location and you are close to places to eat and to the T. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurants so can't comment. Breakfast seems to be expensive and most people seemed to eat it in 'Au Bon Point' which is a two minute walk away in the Mall. It is possible to book your room for half a day if you need it - which we did as we came back on a night flight and wanted the room to change in during the early evening after spending a day doing the Freedon Trail (in 24C). I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the erroneous minibar!!”
Reviews.Author: Chgo_Biz_Traveler
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty standard Westin, with nice, well-maintained rooms that are in good shape, some with amazing views. BUT -- they are very bad about posting erroneous minibar charges to your room!! I have stayed three times in the last month. Each time, even though never touched the bar (on the first stay I did not even know where it was), they have posted about $30 of erroneous charges to my room. Each time when I called to have the charges removed, the front desk argued with me and acted as if I were lying to them and trying to steal their food. I am starting to wonder whether it's worth the aggravation.

Reviews.Title: “great location for the Boston experience...”
Reviews.Author: jaafha
Reviews.Content: We rec'd a great deal on Priceline ($110) for a 1 night stay - on the busiest sports weekend in April. Location of the Westin is great - an easy jaunt to the T stop and a reasonable walk to places like Newberry St & Fenway Park. We chose to park our car at Alewife station & rode the T in to avoid the valet parking & hotel charge (check online for spots - the Prudential Center garage is there plus the Copley Place garage - you'd at least save the tip) Hotel staff courteous & room with king size bed extremely comfortable. In room coffee was Starbucks w/Coffee Mate liquid creamer (fellow coffee drinker get my drift here) which was a nice surprise. We didn't eat in the hotel restaurants so can't offer advice on that.

Reviews.Title: “Parking fees are outrageous!!!”
Reviews.Author: Waitrez30
Reviews.Content: This place charges $42.00 PER NIGHT to park your vehicle.There is NO MENTION of this charge when you book your stay.This amount may not be much to some people, but to my small family staying for 2 nights this is a hardship.Who has $84 DOLLARS to throw away on PARKING? Not me. Otherwise it is very clean.The beds and pillows are very comfortable.If you do stay here you must factor in the parking charge.

Reviews.Title: “3 star hotel in a 5 star location”
Reviews.Author: equinefarm
Reviews.Content: The only reason to stay at this hotel would be for its location in the Copley Square area. The hotel itself is average and the rooms and the hallways are in need of an upgrade. (Our room had a fairly large stain on the carpet). If you do stay here, try to get a room facing the Charles River. The hotel staff is polite, but rather indifferent.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms, a hitch here and there”
Reviews.Author: thelivingjuj
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley Place, attached to the Prudential Mall, is a very good hotel with the usual Westin amenities. We found the bathrooms a little cramped and had one glitch with getting a coffee bar re-stocked that was just comical - someone, please get them those neat Nextel two-way radios. On the whole it was convenient and up to snuff. BEWARE, however, the valet parking/luggage morass if it's at all busy - they had no idea how to handle it and didn't seem to care.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs something more”
Reviews.Author: Tasukete
Reviews.Content: We are from Boston so we know this hotel well. It's location is ideal, and if I was a tourist coming into the city I would hands down stay here just for the convenience. The fact that you have restaurant,s bars, and shopping all within a 10 min walk and all indoors is wonderful especially in the wintertime. The hotel is fine, nothing special though. A couple of scraped up walls, bathrooms that need an update, etc. The beds were really great though, didn't want to get out so A+ there. What really rubbed me the wrong way were two things. One was that our room wasn't cleaned. We were away for most of the day, came in at 2:30.. nothing. Stayed until 4 and left again. Came back at 6.. still nothing. At this point I called house keeping and they said we had a do not disturb sign up, which we did.. but for 1.5 hours. Where were they the rest of the time? I don't remember ever coming back to a room that late and not having it cleaned. The other issue was a bogus charge on our bill. "Honor Bar" for $26. Interesting because we had a Bar 10 charge on there from the night before and next to that is that mystery charge. I called down and apparently it was for the room bar, we didn't use it.. or even open it for that matter. Looks like they were trying to quietly slip in that charge next to another one, hoping that we wouldn't notice. But come on.. I liked the hotel in general and would stay again. Just have to keep an eye on things.

Reviews.Title: “Unequalled Service!~ by Longmeadow, Ma Resident”
Reviews.Author: Negrense
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights during the New Year's Eve and I'm pleasantly surprised of the excellent service~ from the concierge, to the frontdesk, & the doormen! Booked 2 rooms for my family, each room with 2 double beds and I was upgraded to 2 queen beds at no extra cost being a Preferred Guest! The Beds and linens are absolutely heavenly and the city view from the 28th floor was a sight to behold at night! But the most unforgettable thing we can't forget about our stay in Westin was the unparalleled honesty of the cleaning staff. While enjoying the sceneries of Boston amidst the cold weather after such bad new year storm, my wife suddenly remembered leaving her engagement and wedding ring by the TV panel in the hotel room. Driving back to the hotel while crossing our fingers, I called the hotel and learned that the rings were turned over by the housekeeping staff to their office ready for us to pick up after identifying them- that's 2 hours after checking out! Thank you Westin for such an incredible experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Dusty Room, Expected More”
Reviews.Author: travelingenmasse
Reviews.Content: Though we had spectular views of the Charles River, The Boston Public Library and easy access to everything the hotel was not what I expected. The room actually had dust on many surfaces! A thick layer of dust! When I informed the front desk they were appropriately sorry and promised to have it handled -- never did. It was nice to be able to stay inside on a cold and blustery day to reach the Mall, food courts, convention center and Prudential Center. The Westin is connected to all of the above via walkways. The restaurants, shops and all were very nice as well. Bar 10 does make lovely drinks and is worth sitting in for a spell. The hotel itself is nothing special and once again, location seems to trump expense. Because it was a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good experience”
Reviews.Author: Goldrusswoman
Reviews.Content: I live in a Boston suburb, but needed to be out of my house due to renovation. So my husband and I booked a room for a Friday night to do some holiday shopping. I booked the cheapest, Internet rate. When we arrived, the valet was in chaos. They had too many cars, not enough valets, and there were cars and people running everywhere. We left our car, a little nervous about how it might survive. Check in was quick and easy and I was thrilled that they had exactly the room I requested in terms of type. The room was clean and neat. Bed and shower were both "heavenly." The bathroom was clean but small, which I have found typical for a big city hotel. We checked out the gym. There were limited free weights and machines, but lots of cardio machines. The pool seemed small and at 7 PM was filled with kids. Although there were 8 elevators, the wait for one seemed excessive during our entire stay. The breakfast buffet was so-so. Next time I would go to Au Bon Pain or someplace in Copley Place (the mall connected to the hotel). Service was civil---not welcoming or friendly. They let us extend check out until 1 PM, and check out was easy. The valet was just as crazy at that time on Saturday---they just seem understaffed. Unfortunately there is no self park under the building---you would need to part at the garage at the Marriot across the street. The location of this hotel is fabulous for doing anything in downtown Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Rudeness to the Extreme”
Reviews.Author: asumom1998
Reviews.Content: Booked for 3 nights. Upon check-in asked to change to 2 nights. Was told that could not be done because of the fine print. Talked to Westin corporate and they said they would ask the hotel to refund one night, as a gesture of good customer service and that I would get an email response. I have not had a refund or a response. It has been one month.

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Rooms nice but traditional decor”
Reviews.Author: Suite2100
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the property twice for business now. Positives: -- Located right in heart of Back Bay and near to Newbury/Boylston St area (easy walk to dining and shopping) -- Attached to Copley mall which can be helpful for shoppers and in bad weather (you can walk to Prudential building inside) -- Views from the rooms I have had were great - looking out toward Charles river and Cambridge -- Easy cab ride from the airport (~15-20$) Drawbacks -- Do not look for funky/interesting in design and decor, room is standard 4 star and could be a decent Hilton or Sheraton etc. -- Staff, while nice seemed young/inexperienced -- Rates can get down right pricey at times for what they are offering and there are tons of acceptable alternatives so watch out If you are looking for/using Starwood points this hotel is a safe bet. I would recommend this hotel to others with the notes above in mind. Regards

Reviews.Title: “Comfy bed - great location!”
Reviews.Author: CherHaines
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were in Boston for a Bridge tournament and stayed at the Westin Copley Plaza. All-in-all, a good hotel in a great location. The Westin is located at Copley plaza and attached to one of the most amazing systems of indoor mall/walkways I've experienced. Check-in was prompt and professional and our room was on the 11th floor with a decent view of city lights. The best parts of the hotel were location (close to the "T", attached to the mall and other hotels) and the amazing comfy beds (Westin Heavenly(tm) beds). Room was spacious enough and equipped with safe, bathrobes, nice soaps/etc., and a one-cup coffee system. Maid service was efficient and coffee was supplied in quantity, which I appreciated. On the downside, I could have sworn the hotel advertised refrigerators in room, which I love to use for leftovers and breakfast. But instead it had one of those annoying mini-bars where if you touch anything they threaten to charge you. Also, food and bar were ridiculously expensive ($23 for 2 drinks at the bar). If you are, as we were, attending a convention or event at Copley, I recommend the Westin. But take advantage of food options at the mall (the Au Bon Pain "Choices" was great for breakfast), beware the mini-bar, and supply your own liquor (sneak it in, though, blue laws...:)).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: nyc_t08
Reviews.Content: This was a really nice hotel and the location was excellent. so much so that we have started staying in westin just for their great locations and clean and contemporary look

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room, great stay”
Reviews.Author: laangelsfan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Westin Copley Place for business back in July. My room was on a corner of the building on the 36th floor. For this reason, my room had a bit of an unusual design, but the view was spectacular. I had about a 260 degree view since being on the corner and could see from Logan Airport, well past MIT. The location of the hotel was perfect. A half block from the T, two blocks from Newbury St., close to the Hynes, and connected to the mall through a series of sky-bridges. With the mall being connected, there were so many restaurants to choose from only a short walk away and without having to step outside. For baseball fans, it was also a good but enjoyable walk to and from Fenway. I did it twice and took me about 20 minutes. Red Sox fans park further than the hotel in some cases and walk that distance. Pros: -Great view -Comfortable bed -Super location Cons: -Could clearly hear the people in the room sharing a connecting door -Windows a bit dirty -Internet was flaky and down a few hours one night (but I was comped a day- internet was not free at time of stay)

Reviews.Title: “Bulk standard US 4 star”
Reviews.Author: JCLON
Reviews.Content: Good confortable hotel downtown Boston. Rooms are spacious with the Heavenly Beds which always make a stay at the Westin worth your while. Had no problem with internet, room service was great - no glitch. Exactly what you expect from this kind of hotel. The breakfast buffet was nice but I have seen better in other hotels in downtown Boston. Do not look for anything funky here, it is just very functional and convenient. Direct access to the mall is a great plus as well.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel is next to a shopper's paradise”
Reviews.Author: 1californiagirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin on October 10th - 12th. Our Priceline rate was $170 per night. The hotel is fabulous - location, location, location. Restaurants/bar/shops/lobby are all nice. The hotel is adjacent to 2 shopping malls and your're within walking distance to a shopper's paradise. Every store imaginable is within walking distance to the hotel. Our room was located on the 19th floor and had a street view. The room was average. My only complaint would be the bathroom - it was small. The Concierge Service will help you with the tourist attractions. Parking in Boston is ridiculous. Parking at the hotel is $40.00 - and that's the going rate. Also, be forewarned of taxi cab drivers - they will take you on a scenic tour if you are not careful - to boost their fee. We talked to fellow travelers who experienced this as well. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Boston

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Service needs help”
Reviews.Author: drmtravl
Reviews.Content: I booked through Hotwire and was pleased when I found out that I would be staying at the Westin Copley Plaza. The location was great. Plenty of shopping and restaurants within walking distrance. Once I walked into to the hotel I was impressed. Very classic design and very clean. Although the property was beautiful I was disappointed with the service of the Front Desk staff. I did not feel welcomed. It was like I was just another number. So once I headed up to my room my trip started to turn around. The room was beautiful. There were many great features in the room. First off the bathroom amenities were top of the line. When I got out of the shower I loved that the mirror was not fogged up as usual. They must have a heater behind the mirror which was amazing. I have never seen this before, I wish I could have this at my house. So on to the next most important feature, the bed. Absolutely comfortable, the feather bed onto of the mattress made me feel like I was falling into a pile of clouds. I didn't want to get up the next morning. This hotel has a lot of potential. They just need to work on the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel? Yes. Heavenly? No.”
Reviews.Author: MR_PHL
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through a conference that I was attending in Boston. Rate was about $300/night. Location: Copley Square Downtown Boston. Pretty good location. Boylston street is not far away. Quincy Market is perhaps two miles away by cab. Fenway Park is two 'T' stations west. There is a shopping mall connected to the hotel and offers some places to get a quick bite. Check-in: A bit slow, but with all the conference attendees coming in, I guess its to be expected. However, I did go to the front desk at other times and found its to be slow as well. Room: First, the Heavenly Bed is not for everyone. I found it difficult to get comfortable. It could just be me. But I don't think it lives up to its billing. The bathroom was not in great shape. The shower head was coming loose from the wall and there was wallpaper peeling off the wall in the bathroom. A rehab is probably in order. Wireless internet in the rooms is good. Service: No complaints. Everyone was very pleasant and helpful. I didn't eat in the hotel restaurant (which I did hear was quite good) but the hotel provided food for the conference and everything was great. They serve Boddington's Ale in the hotel bar which is a plus too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property!”
Reviews.Author: lucksgirl
Reviews.Content: I found an excellent rate on hotels.com If I remember correctly, they only have valet parking which may be great for some, but I prefer coming and going as I please. But the car was always waiting for us by the time we got downstairs. Not to mention the valet charge$ and tip!!! The hotel is beautiful and very big. Very nice, as is to be expected from the Westin. Easy check-in. Our bags were brought up quickly. Very nice, clean room with a view. Pretty good room service dinner. <Side note: We took the dog with us only problem was there is no real place to walk the dog in the area around the hotel. We were picking up poop off the sidewalk! Just something to think about if you take your dog with you.> There is a Starbucks in the lobby which was great, very convenient. The hotel has a sushi restaurant which was excellent as well. The hotel bar was jumping every night we were there. The Westin is connected to the Prudential Center so you don't have to go outside to access the shops, restaurants, etc. That's a big plus in the winter time! Overall a great experience. I can't wait to return and recommend to anyone visiting Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Location,Heavenly Bed, Service WO W !!!”
Reviews.Author: basildogpuppy
Reviews.Content: Location, Heavenly Bed and service, Westin knows how to do it and has raised the bar. On a get a way weekend, one thing I look forward to is to going to bed...who can say that at a hotel !! ...Heavenly Bed that is ..hehehe.. that is why I can say that !!!Location was excellent, next to Lord and Taylor, Sax Fifth Avenue, and Nemon Marcus. All in an indoor skyway walk. Also Legal Seafood, which was AWESOME !! Cheesecake Factory and other resteraunts where in the same area. If this is to pricey a block away behind the beautiful and architecturally significant Trinity Church, across from the beautiful Boston Library is Filenes Basement and Marshall, all on the beautiful Newbury street, perhaps better then Chicago's Magnificent Mile ???!?!?!? A few blocks in the opposite direction is the always hip and cheaper H and M store. Westins excellent staff, service, and top notch workout facility made this hotel wonderful. A bar in the hotel, I believed called 10 was great and how convenient !!!! Even the valets went the extra mile for great service. Great weekend get away and great first time trip to Boston !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: JETGALNY
Reviews.Content: One word...FABULOUS! I stayed at Westin's Copley location in the heart of Boston's Copley Square after attending my sister's wedding in Boston. I stayed at the hotel with another bridal party member,we needed a much deserved debriefing and relaxation after the wedding. Plus our feet were hurting! It was nice to get away from family/friends for the night....lol. Our valet driver was a cute young fellow.Dedo assisted with check-in and was very,very helpful. Dedo offered help with any Boston info,but we were familiar with Boston. I actually worked in Copley Sq. while in college and had my senior prom next door at the Copley Marriott. Dedo was in good spirits after Jamaica's impressive showing at the Olympics. The room was gorgeous and we had a wonderful view of Copley Square. I grew up in Boston so it was nice to have a great view of Copley Square and The Boston Public Library. A word of caution....don't touch the mini bar. We did and were charged even though we didn't eat/drink anything....lol. I guess it had a sensor. The charge was deducted. I was tempted to buy the comfy robe. Breakfast was AWESOME....worth every penny!. Omlette bar, smoked salmon,cheeses,fruit,cereal,pastry...etc. Most of all I Ioved the fresh squeezed OJ....with tons of delicious pulp. I like it when I can chew my OJ! Tons of choices for meat eaters or vegetarians. Our server,Jules was great,he spoke 4 lauguages! The only thing I would change is the system they have when getting your cars from the valet at check-out. It was a bit congested.I didn't take any pictures of the room, but my bed was big and comfy. We took a walk down Newbury St. had a few drinks and I was asleep in about 10 seconds after hitting the sack. All in all,whenever I need to escape my family while in Boston, I will check into The Westin again!

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuff24
Reviews.Content: This is the second time in the past couple of months that my husband and I stayed at this hotel. The location can't be beat and the views from the upper floors are amazing. The rooms are clean, spacious and as always, the Heavenly Beds are extremely comfortable. The front desk agent (Kylie) that checked us in picked up on our conversation that it was my husband's 40th birthday, and sent a lovely card and drinks/snacks to our room. It was an extremely thoughtful gesture and truly made our stay even more special.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Poor swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: Boondoggler
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a very good hotel as you'd probably expect with this brand and price. We were able to upgrade to a junior suite for a small fee - well worth negotiating when you check in. Our room was extremely spacious with wonderful views over Boston. It has a good location close to many shops, bars and restaurants. It's about a 30 minute walk / 5 minute cab ride into downtown Boston - also about a 30 minute walk back from Fenway when we couldn't get a cab. The gym facilities were very good but the swimming pool was tiny. It doesn't take more than about 6 people before feeling full.

Reviews.Title: “Ready for a renovation!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: workinhard
Reviews.Content: For $400.00 a night, I was expecting a nice hotel. This was clearly my mistake. Wall vinyl pealing the bathroom, room service that was not polite, and elevators that made you feel like you were in a bad european movie. Staff was non caring at the front desk, and the hotel really did not make you feel welcome. The concierge were the only holding this place together. they were awesome. Overall, there are much better choices in Boston, I would defenitely skip this one.

Reviews.Title: “Business Traveler's Choice”
Reviews.Author: writingiseasy
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel b/c my company has a preferred relationship with Starwood, for which I am always grateful. This is a business traveler's dream hotel; the desks are huge in each room, it's super easy and fast to connect to the internet without much effort, the "Unwind" happy hour lets me do my work in the wi-fi enabled lobby while I sip a drink and I've never had to wait for a cab at this hotel b/c they line up outside in numbers. The best feature, however, especially for a woman traveling alone, is the fact that this hotel is linked by covered passageway all the way through the mall to the Prudential Building. Even in the middle of the winter, I can walk leisurely (without a coat) to dinner and shopping in my off hours. It's also a mere 2 blocks' walk to Newbury Street, the most stylish street in Bean Town.

Reviews.Title: “Preferred Hotel for Business or Pleasure in Boston”
Reviews.Author: FreqTravelerDC
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley is my preferred hotel in Boston. The rooms are relatively spacious, clean and modern with great views of the Boston Harbor or the Charles River. The staff, in general, is helpful and customer friendly. The workout facility has plenty of treadmills and elliptical machines for cardio, as well as free weights and other weight machines. It has a Starbucks immediately outside the entrance, as well as an Au Bon Pain within a short distance for light food. It is convenient to all of Copley, the Back Bay and South End.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MsMadison
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in this hotel so many times, and every instance is perfect. Great rooms, great location, great overall! This is our favorite hotel in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service and the worst Concierge”
Reviews.Author: notebookguru
Reviews.Content: What a terrible service our family experienced! I am a world traveler visited numerous kinds of international chain hotels. This time our family booked 7 nights at Westin Copley Place. From the day one till we leave, we have experienced nothing but unpleasnt service. Front desk folks were unhappy, no professional greeting nor smile on their face. Besides the very rough maid service was another nightmare expereince, one morning we were all in the room and the maid still walked in without even say "May I" attitude and left without cleaning the bathtub area. What in the world are they (all hotel staff) thinking working at the Hotel where the top notch service is required. I could go on and on complaining about this hotel. Do not expect the smile if you are going to stay at this place and do not expect nice greeting and a professional maid service. I rate this Hotel ONE STAR, again I say I am a very frequent traveler stayed numerous int'l chain hotels for last 15 years. It might be much better to stay in Marriot or other chain hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl64
Reviews.Content: We stayed here while looking at colleges in Boston over spring break. We booked online and got the internet rate which is cheap but you do have to pay in advance. For us this worked perfectly since we had appointments scheduled at the colleges anyway. The rooms were very comfortable and appeared to be recently renovated. The Heavenly bed was as soft and snuggly as they claim. I want one at home!! The bathroom was also nice and came with plenty of plush towels. I really enjoyed the complimentary Starbucks and coffee maker each morning, but there's also a Starbucks in the lobby if you like espresso drinks. Because this hotel has a walkway to the "mall" across the street, there's plenty of shopping and places to eat, although they are upscale, so plan on spending some money. We chose this hotel because it was centrally located for our college visits and convenient to the "T" (subway). We walked only a block to the green line of the T, which was great. We also found the T very easy to navigate and much cheaper than getting a cab. Not much to do at night, but that served us well. There is a nice bar in the hotel and a great Sushi place next to the Starbucks. There were also some cute gift shops in the lobby that had fun and unusual gifts. We didn't use the workout facility, but we did look in and it had plenty of machines, not just one or two. The pool was clean, but pretty small. More like a place to paddle around, not swim laps. We didn't have a car, so we didn't deal with valet service or the price of parking. You don't really need a car in this part of town since the T is so convenient. We did take a cab to the airport and we were pleased to find out what a quick ride it was. All in all, this was a great hotel and we really enjoyed our stay! I'd highly recommend it for business or sightseeing, although probably not a great place for young kids.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific! But park elsewhere and leave your swimsuit at home...”
Reviews.Author: urbantourist
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for three nights during the July 4th long weekend. Booked a few months in advance at $110/night. We were very pleased with the location of the hotel and satisfied with the quality of the room and service. Just two minor issues worth mentioning that may be helpful to others: First, parking is incredibly expensive. We chose to valet the car at $40/night as we arrived late and didn't want to bother with seeking alternatives, but next time we would look for a cheaper option. We didn't utilize the in/out priviliges since everything (Fenway, Newbury Street, Freedom Trail, Beacon Hill, Quincy Market, North End) was within walking distance. The only time we considered driving was for our outing to Harvard, but we were advised parking is expensive/difficult at Harvard so we opted to take the subway instead. Second, we were disappointed at the size and quality of the swimming pool. We had arrived at the Westin with every intention of enjoying the pool facilities, but decided in the end to skip the tiny, crowded pool and single-person changerooms. Enjoyed Starbucks and Au Bon Pain every morning of our trip as there were several close by. There's also a Shaw's Supermarket within walking distance. Didn't get to "unwind" in the lobby as we were always out at that time, but a great Westin perk for those who can participate.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location”
Reviews.Author: jmass
Reviews.Content: The Westin is a higher end hotel located right in Copley Square. The rooms and especially the beds are outstanding. We got a great rate through Hotwire and our main reason for going was the July 4th fireworks. Excellent location, within a couple of blocks. Eating and parking are both very expensive. Park outside the city and take the Tee in.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsMaytag
Reviews.Content: Booked through Hotwire for 3 nights at a low price of 119 a night for several rooms. Upgraded my room for $35 more a night at the hotel and had a 34th floor view of the magnificent Boston Fourth of July fireworks. Really can't describe how perfect a place the hotel is for this event. Pretty hotel that is kept pretty decent. It's located in the perfect spot and on a rainy weekend offers plenty to do with a great shopping mall connected to the hotel. Staff is cordial but valet parking is a rip-off at 40 per night. Getting around Boston is real easy and it's quite a good place to stay overall.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel--Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: kp2300
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin for four days to see the St. Louis Cardinals play the Redsoxs. Accomodations were very nice and everyone at the hotel was friendly and helpful. My only complaint was the tolietries. They were very stinky--medicinal in smell. I was hoping for better since we had traveled light to avoid checking bagage. Had to make a trip to the Walgreens close by. Our room was nice, and we were able to get the king bed we asked for. Hotel bar (Bar 10) has very good martinis to end the day with :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Bobothehobo
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for about a week on business. This is what you expect from a Westin hotel. Very nice rooms, beds, bathrooms, gym, and service. Shopping, restaurants, sites, bars, all in walking distance. Nice bar in the hotel, and you can stay indoors to walk to the shopping center with great restaurants if the weather is poor. Luckily, it was nice when I visited and we walked all over town. Only problem; a charge was made to my room from the bar downstairs which was not my charge; staff took care of it with a minor hassle, but it was taken care of. Could probalby use a better system to prevent that (ID, signature, something) Regardless, this was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “I loved the Westin Copley Place!”
Reviews.Author: U2SJ1
Reviews.Content: We really loved our stay at the Westin Copley Place in Boston. We also LOVED BOSTON! This hotel is in an amazing location. We took the Duck Tour, which was also something not to miss, and it is located right outside the hotel. It is attached to one of the most fabulous malls, with loads of shops and restaurants. Also attached to the Prudential Center, where you can go up to the 52nd floor and have a drink at the Top of the Hub Bar. Our room was clean, comfortable and had an amazing city view with the Charles River in the background from the 22nd floor. Cant wait to go back to the Westin in Boston!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: JLK2008
Reviews.Content: I really liked this hotel. It has a great central location (right off the Copley T) and was within walking distance to the mall as well as the shops on Newbury Street. The rooms are new and modern and very very clean, with the standard Westin Heavenly Bed--which was very comfortable as always.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms fine, but pool was slimy!”
Reviews.Author: 4kidsintow
Reviews.Content: We live outside of Boston, but I wanted to bring my 3 kids into town for an overnight during April break. Since I had a baby, I thought it would be great to be attached to the mall incase the weather wasn't cooperative. That-the location- was the best part. It was SO easy to be attached to the "Pru." Easy to grab meals, easy with the stroller...so what's the catch...the pool was dirty! I purposely booked a hotel with a pool for the kids and I was cringing as my kids got into swim. There was nasty foam on the top of the jacuzzi and the pool was murky. Besides the pool, we had a nice stay. Our room was a good size and well appointed. Basically, I would book here for convenience, not amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place!”
Reviews.Author: megsv98
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent suite on the corner of the building, which meant many many windows with insane views. The service was okay...we had to call the concierge several times for the same thing over and over. That was annoying. But overall beautiful room and it was very comfy.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Here !”
Reviews.Author: Rhine-and-Roses
Reviews.Content: What a great stay! Pleasant personnel who truly seem to want to make your stay comfortable. Smiles and help were the norm. The room was standard Westin- two beds, room to move around, clean as a whistle. We were given a room on the 13th floor, with a view of the Charles River. (Well, kind of a view, because the exterior of the windows were not as clean as the hotel!) The room had a desk and chair, along with a small easy chair and side table. The bathroom had Westin's regular toiletries, as well as a terry robe, but no slippers. Room service was fine- standard over priced, but fast and convenient. Housekeeping did a great job. We did not have the problems others mentioned with the elevators. The hotel was 100% booked, but we never waited more than a half minute. The concierge was helpful. Porters and doormen there when you needed them. Management must be good for a hotel this large to run this well, and still be helpful, friendly. Congratulations! I've stayed at a few Westins this year, and my experiences will have me looking to book them again. Location was excellent. I liked the Westin far better than the sister hotel (Sheraton) where we stayed our last night, due to the Westin being fully booked. Will stay here again in August and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - great for a break from business”
Reviews.Author: Beccy_surrey
Reviews.Content: Was in MA for business for two weeks (over from London) and had made same trip last year. On each occassion I got a city center hotel for the weekend. The Westin was an excellent place to stay. All the facilities you need, right next to the shopping mall, and with the dollar to Sterling at the moment I shopped a lot (Jimmy Choo, Mulberry, Gucci - the best European Fashions for half the price!!). Only downside of hotel was I found the bathrooms quite small and the baths were very uncomfortable for laying down in and realxing so ended up showering (not ideal if you just want to read a book and drink a glass of wine). Not sure how prices compare in the hotel as I was expensing my costs - did seem a bit more expensive than my hotel for the week but I guess thats the location. Also couldn't believe all the taxes that get added to the cost of the room - is just ridiculous! In the UK the price advertised is what you pay inclusive of VAT. Got a lot of room service as the first day was on my own until a collegue joined me. Food was lovely but not much choice on the room service menu. Second night myself and collegue ate at the fish restaurant downstairs and was quite nice (also had breakfast there). Last year we'd been to the Barking Crab and wish we had gone back as that had been cheaper, better atmosphere and great food. That aside the quality of the food can't be faulted at the hotel. Staff are very friendly and helpful....one thing that got me though was on the room service it automatically charged you a delivery fee and a tip which is fine, but when staff brought my meals I still got the impression I was supposed to tip further (which I didn't). Not sure if this was rude of me but I'd already paid a tip (according to the charge in my fee for the food) and wasn't going to tip again. Overall if I'm ever back in Boston I will stay here again and would deffinitly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin is Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: rosemarielynne
Reviews.Content: My children and I stayed at the Westin June 13th through the 16th. The Westin is conveniently located in downtown Boston so you can walk to the T-line. It is connected to a high-end mall so if it is raining so you can browse the shops. They also have quite a few very nice restaurants if you don't want to go far to eat. We went to the Quincy Market because they have so many different restaurants and is more affordable. The heavenly beds were just like they stated "Heavenly!" We all slept very well because the beds are so comfortable. The rooms are nice, spacious and clean and we had a great view of the Charles River. When we asked for extra towels and toiletries they brought them up to us within minutes. We also requested a mini-fridge and got one at no extra charge. Don't get anything from the mini-bar because that is way too expensive. They have a very nice workout area, lap pool and hot tub. Overall the Westin Copley is a very nice upscale hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: PThrowe
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of June. Westin does have some fabulous hotels, but I found this one to be pretty average. We had shipped a package to ourselves which the business center couldn't find, even though we had the tracking # that said it had been delivered. They did eventually find it. Also, shortly after we checked in I was standing looking out the window (nice view), my husband was lying on the bed, and a maid just came walking into the room - no knocking. She just stood there & stared at me and finally said, "So, how are you?" I told her I was fine and asked her what she needed, she responded muttering something about a computer, and then left - it was really weird. The bathroom didn't seem quite ready (the soapdish was in the sink) so maybe she hadn't finished cleaning the room??? The room itself was nice, but I've stayed in nicer Westins. The bed, as always, was comfy. We had to call to have the coffee station refreshed. Location is great for sightseeing - close to the T

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: dmg24
Reviews.Content: I got a fantastic deal for this hotel through Priceline. I arrived at the Westin after a thirteen hour journey, and could not have received a warmer welcome. The receptionist was very friendly, and kindly upgraded me to a junior suite. The room was perfect. A king bed, a separate seating area with the comfiest sofa (so comfy I fell to sleep!), and a desk so big that I could easily spread out my laptop and work plus all my guide books! The location of the Westin is ideal for Boston. On one day it would not stop raining, but that was not a problem due to the walkways through to the two shopping malls! Within the malls there were also plenty of places to eat and two Starbucks, so I was quite content! I also stayed at the Marriott on my visit to Boston, and whilst it was very nice, I don't think it compares to the high standards set at the Westin. I shall definitely be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: HappyBill
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Westin for an overnight in Boston. We booked that day on Hotwire for $196. The room was great. We had a King size bed on the 35th floor with a spectacular view of Boston. We drank in the bar which was lovely. We ate in the fish restaurant which was very nice. This was a very nice hotel in a perfect location with a great many services on the premises and attached to a luxury mall. I highly recommend this place for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tagretchen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin for one night in May 2008. The rooms were spacious and clean. The location was great, close to shoppings, restaurants and public transportation. Only a few blocks away from the beginning of the Freedom Trail. Would recommend the Westin

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: backtotheislands
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 night stay and can't imagine the poor reviews. We were upgraded at check in to a Jr. Suite on the 14th floor. We had a nice little sitting area, comfy heavenly bed, nice study area and comfortable bathroom. Our room was on the corner so we had great views in 2 directions. Our room was cleaned promptly each day and when we asked for a couple of things they were delivered promptly. We didn't eat at the hotel, but loved the location. All in all, we had a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “LOOOOVED THE WESTIN! Will definately be back!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGal45
Reviews.Content: I am reading some of these other reviews in amazement-I have troubled all over the country and seldom have I been as comfortable as I was at the Westin, I was there with my husband and teenage son-room was large by city standards-best bed I;ve ever slept on in a hotel-they honored my request for a high floor-we loved the view-the hotel has a pool which was a fun diversion and a decent exercise room-the hotel is elegant and modersn-it almost took my breath away! I loved my stay at the Westin-I also requested and received for no charge a mini personal refrigerator so we stowed some drinks in there-staff was accomodating, friendly-thumbs up Westin-And what a fantastic location-hard to beat-

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: McKRy
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a jr. suite. First room they gave my husband and I was not that nice, floors were stained and didn't 'feel' clean. My husband went down to the front desk and they were very nice about changing our room to accomodate us, and gave us a nice jr. suite on the 33rd floor overlooking the river. The hotel itself is very nice and clean. Great location! Close to Newbury St. and attached to lots of shopping at Copley place. Would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel for fun times”
Reviews.Author: mrsslovestotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Copley Place from April 17-19, 2008, and we had no problems. Check in was prompt and the staff was nice. The room was average size, deluxe king room, had Starbucks coffee, but we don't drink coffee, and the room was very clean. It is in a GREAT location for shopping, restaurants, and the subway. It is a $10.00 cab ride, one way, to Fenway Park or it is a 5 minute subway ride to the Park. Overall we had a nice stay. The only thing I can think that would be negative were the stains on the carpet outside of the elevators, but not that big of a deal. Would stay there again. There is a mall that is attached to this hotel just in case you need to go shopping for anything. Its is connected by a covered walkway. Fabulous idea!!! Happy Traveling! P.S. The only reason we went to Boson was to see Fenway Park and see the Red Sox play :)

Reviews.Title: “great location and beds”
Reviews.Author: larklaw
Reviews.Content: Business trip. Comfortable rooms-beds are great. Clean hotel-close to T and many restaurants and stores. Since not paying for this have no issues- Boston hotels are expensive all over. Nice that hotel is attached to mall. South end area close walk with lots of good restaurants. Newbury St shopping right around corner. Overall great location and comfortable rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Beds!”
Reviews.Author: Blackbears
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel while attending a business conference. Check in was very fast and efficient. I obtained the king room I requested and it was ready at 11:30am on Sunday morning, which I found to be outstanding! The common areas were pretty worn, especially the carpet. There were some weird smells in the hallways also, like old grease from restaurants. The room was a totally different story. It was very nice, smelled great, and the carpet was in good shape. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is in a great location for shopping, restaurants, and the Hynes Center.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location”
Reviews.Author: Berkshire1
Reviews.Content: Mass Pike is right around the block; Across the street from the T; Skywalk that leads to the shops / malls are nice if the elements outside are not. Great hotel if you on business time. I did not pay for this hotel and I am very glad. Its expensive.... a word of caution....dont touch the mini bar..... Use the vending machines. Park across the street and save 10 bucks. All in all.... nothing special but the beds are heaven, Easy check out, and call 10 min. ahead of time if you choose to use the valet parking.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay....”
Reviews.Author: Shelbs97
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this past winter for a company holiday party. We pulled in and the valet came to greet us. The valet guys were super nice. They were quick to take our car but didnâ€™t rush us at all while we were getting our things out of the car. Check in was good, they were friendly and honored our request for a king bed on a high floor. The room we had was very nice. The bed was very comfortable w/ nice linens. There were snacks and a minibar with a decent assortment of items at those crazy prices that all hotels charge. Instead of purchasing any, I went downstairs to a gift shop near the check in area and bought some snacks and some sodas for MUCH less money. There are a lot of stores on this level. The bathroom in our room needed updating and it was pretty small. Not what I expected. It was just a standard boring bathroom that youâ€™d find at your local Holiday Inn. Our party was held in a large ballroom. Everything was very nice, staff was great. Our only gripe was the food. It was awful. I canâ€™t comment on the restaurants in the hotel b/c we didnâ€™t eat at them, but the food for the party was so terrible, Iâ€™m glad we had purchased snacks at the gift shop! The next morning we woke up to a loud announcement coming from the loud speaker in our room that there was an emergency in the building and if we heard our floor called out we were to evacuate immediately. (There was a blizzard outsideâ€¦not sure where we would have been evacuated to.) Thankfully we didnâ€™t hear our floor. Finally, check out was a breeze, easy and quick. We went down to get our car from valet and it took forever to get the car back. I know they were busy, but they should have been prepared for the amount of people checking out and had more valetâ€™s on hand. In the freezing cold, with a blizzard (no joke) outside, it took about 25 minutes for them to get the car. NOT acceptable in my book. It was nice that there was a Starbucks inside the hotel and my boyfriend grabbed us coffeeâ€™s while we waited. Overall, I would stay here again, I would just make sure to call down to valet for my car before leaving the room if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: GlendaleCA
Reviews.Content: Staff below average in terms of customer service for a large hotel. Very stand-offish, don't like to assist. Feels like you are in a very upscale store where the sales associates act really snotty like they own the store. That is the attitude held by many staff at the Copley Westin. I got a Junior Suite. It felt like the average-sized city hotel. There was nothing exceptional about the room, except that the couch in the room was completely outdated and that the bathroom was small. Of course the bed is comfy, it is the Heavenly bed. The lobby is small, yet there is a nice area to sit and chat. The sushi place is very decent with the best staff members I came across while at the hotel. The fish restaurant has very little variety and I was not impressed at all. However the fish itself was well prepared. As a platinum starwood member who has stayed in numerous Westin's I did not find this to be either an exceptional or even average hotel. I enjoyed staying at the Sheraton a few blocks away much better. Maybe it is worth giving this property another chance, but I am not sure...Not sure if it is worth the price for what should be a much better facility.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! A mini bar charges sales tax and 15% service charge!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: love6kies
Reviews.Content: I was expected to have a vendor machine which supplies bottled water or soda that usually westin hotel chains offer, however, that was not the case on this hotel. I had no choice to have one of them from my hotel room mini bar, but it's very very expensive. oK I wanted to have a bottled of Perrier at $4 and the can of salted cashews for munches, but In theier menu said "ENJOY" and follows the fact that they charge automatically to the room account WITH a I15% service fee and 5% sales tax!!!! I had never seen any hotel charge those fee for that. I calicurated the total amount of those 2 item from the mini bar was $15.60. WARNING! People: bring your own drink, munches, or don't get thirsty or hungry in this hotel room in the midnight!! INSANE!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware the Electric Minibar!!!”
Reviews.Author: davidls45
Reviews.Content: Allright, it's a great hotel. We've stayed there many times before, but this time is different. When we got to our room, we opened the outer door to the minibar. We saw the ominous blue light on the door. We had run into this before in Dublin, and read the instructions (printed in diamond type and posted two inches above the floor). It confirmed that this was an automatic minibar, and we would be charged immediately for any items we removed. In other words, if you take out a container of nuts to see what they are, you are charged, even if you put the container right back. We avoided it like the plague. We got our printed bill and came home. No minibar charges. Two days later I was checking my credit card account online, and saw the Westin bill had been increased by over $60. I call the finance department. "Oh, that's for the minibar." "But I never used it." "So sorry, we'll remove the charge." Soooo....., if I hadn't bothered to look and didn't carefully check my credit card account when it came, the Westin would have just made $60 the easy way. I am very suspicious that they have some sort of ticker in their software that adds maybe 10% to your bill after you leave. If you notice it, they take it off. Otherwse, easy money. I wrote the Westin home people,, but of course got no response.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad...but I wasn't paying”
Reviews.Author: pipanale
Reviews.Content: I was at the Westin with a group from work. We were there for a training session. The room was nice enough, but the light-sensing mini bar/snack cart needs to go. One of my coworkers came into my room, rattled all the items around and then laughed as we watched the charges roll on to my account. I had to go downstairs to settle that up. I was also charged to park my car. Funny...seeing as my car was at the airport in Raleigh at the time. In fact, at least half of the group of 30+ people had to go to the desk to argue mystery charges on the bill. I hope it was funny software that just happened to hit us all at once and nothing else. The room had enough room for me, but needed some updating. I dropped something in the bathroom and got a good view of the 4 generations of wallpaper under the sink. The heavenly shower head scared me more than anything and was ugly looking. Plus, they charge for internet access. They have wired and wireless access, but you can only use one in a 24-hour period...or else they charge you twice. That chapped me a tad. It was conventiently located, but I'd never pay that much to go anywhere if it were my money.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed”
Reviews.Author: tripsing
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel via the Westin website for a lower rate. We wanted this hotel because of it's location, the walkways since the weather was forecasted to be very cold, and the Westin's reputation for excellent service. We were disappointed in the rooms to be quite small and bathrooms very small. The hotel in general needs updating. On our first morning there was an emergency evacuation announcement. When we dashed into the halls, the service folks were confused. They did not know where the stairway was. The instructions over the loudspeaker was to take the stairway. The custodian told us to take the elevators. ( We were on the 26th floor). There needs to be good communications during an emergency. In our hurry we left the do not disturb sign on, so upon returning there was no cleaning. Which was OK w/ us. However when we asked for turn-down service it never appeared ,nor did our request for clean towels. The room was stuffy and the air conditioning did not work. Luckily we had windows that opened which helped. The TV is grainy. They did sponsor tasty treats in the lobby which has a fireplace. There are nice aspects to this hotel. But Westin needs to pay more attention to some basics. I was never able to reach the front desk when we needed their help. ( put on hold and no one answered). There is a swimming pool and work out room. We stayed during the weekdays and the visited the pool and fitness room late at night . There were very few people there at that time. We had a nice time, but I was expecting more from this pricey hotel. Stayed in other Westin's which were updated and had reliable service. Took the advice of other reviews and parked in the lot across the street saving 10.00 per night.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT location!!!”
Reviews.Author: LI&NJHometowns
Reviews.Content: We were in Boston to visit colleges and absolutely loved this location! We were also very pleased with the comfort and attractiveness of the room and common areas.
