The hotel is across the street from the green "T" line which takes you to Boston College ( 30 + mins.) and BU (10 mins). We walked back from BU (apprx. 1 +mile) via Newbury St. which my teenage son loved the cool shops; Newbury Comics, Niketown, Johnny Cupcakes. I liked that the hotel is attached by a series of glass walkways to various upscale (& regular) shopping, restaurants, Marriot Convention Center. The activity around the hotel was jumping so you felt safe walking & window shopping in the mall areas. Nice selection of restaurants both chain (Starbucks,California Pizza & Legal Seafoods ) and non chain selection. Hotel parking was the only downside b/c of expense ($40) but apparently you could park at the mall for $30. I didn't bother to investigate.

Reviews.Title: “Another Stay, Another Satisfied Customer”
Reviews.Author: NorthEast33
Reviews.Content: 2nd Stay at this hotel and had another great experience. I received a great price again through priceline, $112. Quick check-in, staff was very friendly. My room wasn't ready, but they insisted that I wait for the exact room that was reserved for me because it had a great view of the Charles River. They were right. Even though I am a Priceline customer, they did not treat me any differently as you may hear from other hotels. Great Location. Nice Rooms, Small Bathroom. Directly next to two T stops and the train station Being a Sushi fanatic, I would NOT recommend OSushi (located in the hotel). Some of the fish was not fresh. But this does not change my opinion of the hotel. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: McLeanGuy
Reviews.Content: A nice Westin with a great location. The front desk took long, not sure if it was a language problem. The elevators took forever. The Palm Restaurant bar had great bartenders and was a good time. I think the bartender at Turner Fisheries quite because we sat there 10 mins and no bartender. The whole bar needed drinks and everyone looked disgusted. Bar 10 was fun but expesive. Being attached to Copley mall is nice. FYI the Sheraton looked nice and is also attached to the mall. The concierge got us reservation at Ruth Chris Steakhouse, we tried twice and were turned down.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in the middle of all the action in downtown Boston!”
Reviews.Author: lip89
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on New Years Eve 2004 with my wife and have to say it was a great stay! It is situated in the heart of downtown with a front door to all the hustle and bustle Boston has to offer in Back Bay. The lobby and check in process were superb and the staff was very nice treating me first class!! The restaurant in the hotel Bar 10 is a great place to grab a cocktail and a bite in a trendy typical Boston fashion with great decor and hip setting!! The rooms are very large and include a wet bar and additiona ammenities. This hotel has a lot to offer for the price and is as competitive as any you can find in the downtown area! I would highly recommend it, but be sure to bring your wallet, this as is any Westin is not cheap and especially for this location!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place But Bring Plenty of Dough”
Reviews.Author: doctorjay
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a one week conference and overall the place was pretty nice. The daily costs were: Room $200 plus taxes, Internet access $10, Breakfast Buffet $25 including tip. The location is in the better part of the city and the hotel is connected by walkways with several shopping areas, hotels and the convention center. This is important because you wouldn't want to have to walk in the sloppy streets after it snows. Food choices are fairly limited in the hotel but for coffee drinkers there is a Starbucks. All the food options are expensive so I would eat the expensive breakfast buffet and then seek out the Legal Seafoods, food court and Chili's in the Mall for dinner. Hotel staff are efficient but not especially friendly. The elevators can be painfully slow when many people pile in and the darn thing stops on every floor (36 floors I believe). I guess I don't mind paying more to get something special, but at this hotel I felt like I got the standard business hotel treatment for what may be a fair price.

Reviews.Title: “Another lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: lovlilynne
Reviews.Content: This was my 3rd stay at the Westin in 1 year. Last Thanksgiving weekend (2006), I brought my son and nephew for a 1 night overnight, and we had a great (although expensive) time. When it came time to book a hotel for the Boston Wine Expo, I had received an email from the Westin with a great rate that included breakfast. This time it was adults only, and again we had a very nice stay - although we didn't use many of the facilities. This last stay was on Thanksgiving weekend again, but this time I booked two nights and brought two nephews. The hotel was a lot more crowded than last year - even the malls seemed packed. When we arrived, there was no more valet parking, so we parked in the Copley Place lot. You know what? I'm doing that from now on. I really don't mind shlepping the bags a bit, I like knowing where my car is (and we don't take it anywhere anyway), and it was $10 a day cheaper. The boys were thrilled to get a room on the 20th floor - the view is great. The first morning, we had breakfast in the Hunnington, and I agree with one of the posters that this buffet is nothing special, but because of the prices of the a la carte items, the buffet is the most reasonable option. Once you add in coffee and juice to $15 eggs benedict, you are spending the buffet price or more. The kids got a discounted rate - and with 3 boys age 8-12, it was worth it (even though it cost more than our dinner at the Cheesecake factory the night before). They have redone the Hunnington since last year, and I can't see the improvement. It's more crowded, and difficult to get by tables, especially with the buffet. It really is a beautiful hotel, and I feel pampered when I go there. I will definitely go back - I hope another adult stay when maybe I can report on the spa treatments :-)

Reviews.Title: “Location is the key ingredient”
Reviews.Author: Proseco
Reviews.Content: The Westin did not disappoint in terms of location and concierge service. Two years ago, my daughter and I stayed at the Westin/Central Park NYC and the room was tiny and horribly pricey.. This was so much better w/breathtaking view. And, the holiday rate of $139.00 couldn't be beat. Two items I did have a problem with---one of our hand towels was threadbare in a spot and this is so unlike what you would expect at Westins. The other was with a check-in staff person. I had misplaced my room key and was behind a fellow hotel guest who must have been apart of the timeshare program. Well, the clerk gushed all over this man that it was embarrasing. He then treated me with disdain when I told him I needed another key. I realize I am only a starwood preferred customer, but still........The concierge (s) were extremely helpful. We found that Maryanna was so sweet in helping to arrange a special night for my daughter's 19th b'day at Lucca in the North End. She even asked about it the next day. This is what sets the Westin apart. We enjoyed eating at Stephanies on Newbury St. which is so close. One thing I wasn't pleased with was service at many of the Boston restaurants, except for Legal Seafood and Lucca. Got good deal on tickets for Blue Man Group at the kiosk in park across from the hotel. Trolley tour was great but I'd check the kiosk venue out for a cheaper rate. All in all, it was a memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Tries to be a 4-star hotel, acts like a 2 1/2 or 3-star”
Reviews.Author: p3mikey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel about once or twice a year over the past several years. The property has gone downhill each time I stay there and I actually checked out early on this last trip. Upon driving up, there were no parking valets, no bellmen, nada. I unloaded my own bags after waiting 5-10 minutes onto a cart and brought them up to the front desk with me. Finally, someone spotted me with a cart and offered some assistance. The hotel is comparable to the nearby Marriott, Hilton or Courtyard, but they are all cheaper. After several days of waiting for the car in the morning, or waiting for a parking attendant, I checked out a day early. Calling for luggage assistance, I waited 15 minutes, and again, no help. I carried my own bags downstairs and left. I am a Starwoods Gold Member and I'll never stay at this hotel again. Discussing the problem with the front desk staff, all I got was the shoulder shrug. Lots of other places to stay in the area, for less, with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review for a Saturday night stay”
Reviews.Author: MmePoppy
Reviews.Content: We got a good rate on the room, thanks to AAA, and were generally satisfied with its comfort and amenities. We were not fans of the extremely squishy bedding which they are so proud of, though. I'm sure many people like these layers of luxury and the pillow-top mattress, but we didn't care for it. The hotel pool is rather small, so those seeking a Sunday morning swim before breakfast quickly overwhelmed it. For such a large hotel, the pool is much too small. No one could swim laps at all. The exercise room was also very busy, with nearly every treadmill and elliptical in use. The breakfast buffet was served in the Turner Fish restaurant, due to renovations in the usual space. Again, due to all the families present on the weekend, it was a somewhat overwhelming scene of wiggly toddlers, sloshing orange juice, and crowding at the buffet. A chef was making custom omelettes, but otherwise the food was extremely ordinary and rather cold and congealing by 9:30 a.m. when we got there. The hash browns were more like cubed, steamed potatoes -- neither crispy nor savory. The oddly sweet sausages were tasty but cold, and the egg casserole had simply been sitting in its container for too long. The coffee and orange juice were excellent and our server refilled both attentively throughout the meal. Nice little muffins and pastries. Our arrival on Saturday was perfect, with both the valet parking and the early check-in to our room working perfectly. The valet service was smooth at check-out, too. We were pleased with the value for our discounted room, but a bit disappointed that the hotel couldn't provide a better breakfast setting for the many large family parties who were overwhelming their dining room and frankly making a bit of a mess. In its temporary quarters, everything felt crowded and cramped. Not the leisurely Sunday morning experience we had hoped for. And the food was just too ordinary for a hotel in this class -- they should spiff up their offerings a bit, and leave less food sitting there for lengthy periods. It was fun to be near Copley Square and Newbury Street, and the nearby shopping arcades provided places to stroll without having to experience the weather.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location”
Reviews.Author: elegantraveller
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this particular Westin previously so there were no surprises, thankfully. All our favourite features - those wonderfully comfortable beds and fresh linen, simple no-nonsense amenities and a coffee maker to hand for an early jet-lagged morning were there, together with a great view. The lobby of this particular hotel is always bustling and it could be irritating for some to find themselves in the middle of such a crowd at all times of the day or night. Such heavy footfall is the price to be paid for staying in a shopping mall, however and for us, the advantages far outweigh the drawbacks. We were there Thanksgiving weekend, so there were few conference guests - another potential minor irritation when staying downtown Boston, we've found. However, the Westin copes well with this level of activity, lifts are efficient and seldom involve anything more than a couple of minutes wait and once up on the residential floors, it's peaceful and relaxed. We've never eaten breakfast here, but nip downstairs and across the bridge to Au Bon Pain. Getting coffee to bring back is easy from the Starbucks across the lobby too. All in all, we find the Westin to be a great refuge from the hustle and bustle that brings us to Boston in the first place and we continue to be satisfied with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Not At All Worth Four Stars!”
Reviews.Author: BklynNYTraveller
Reviews.Content: The floor was dirty, the rooms were small, I had to remind housekeeping to replace my coffee and tea, and all the hallways felt dirty. On the upside, there are a lot of "relax and rewind" activities in the early afternoon, the gym was large, and the front desk staff were very accommodating. My toilet was not clean when I arrived. This place should be three stars at most. Wireless in the rooms wasn't free. That's silly. To get free wireless you have to hang out in the completely uncomfortable and dirty-looking lobby. The lobby isn't, like, filled with dirt smears, but everything looks stained and fake. I didn't want to touch anything. It felt like a slightly plush airport. I shouldn't have these experiences at a four-star. Four-star means luxury, not dirt and discomfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but wouldn't stay again...”
Reviews.Author: Traveler2585
Reviews.Content: We got a great last minute deal on our room from hotwire. We were only staying for one night but we may as well have just pulled an all-nighter and skipped paying for the room! Upon arrival we were quickly checked into a room on the 13th floor. The room seemed clean upon first inspection however I noticed that the bed had numerous hairs on the sheets leaving me to wonder whether or not the sheets were even changed. Also, the bathroom had a terribly chipped toilet and finger nail clippings on the floor. The view from the room was great. It was front facing the John Hancock building. That was about the only plus! The hotel was incredibly noisy and I'm not referring to the other guests! In fact, I never even heard anyone else talking in the hotel, the other guests were very quiet. However, the pipes in this place were ridiculous! They knocked all night and rattled everytime someone down the hall flushed the toilet or turned on the sink. In the morning, the housekeeper turned the vacuum on down the hall at about 7am and continued until about 11am going into various rooms. There was also an alarm going off in the hotel for a half an hour! I've never been in such a noisy hotel. Maybe I was just there on a really bad night but it really skewed my view of the Westin!

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: WYW
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights for a long weekend. Managed to book a cheap rate via priceline.com for 1st night as the rest of the stay was for business. Check in: Fine Room: Comfortable bed & bed linen. Bathroom: Small and compact, but not in a good way. Towels not that soft as you'd expect from a 4 star hotel. Also there were hairs in one of the towels! Not the best. Shower was nice & powerful. Check out: Express. Facilities: Pool is small and no real changing rooms - just a shower and restroom facility. Does have a large gym. Location: Excellent for shops and restaurants in the Back Bay area. Good transport in the area. Great base to explore other areas of Boston. Positive: Fantastic location Negative: Not too sure about cleanliness of the floor. No wow factor as it was a Westin Hotel

Reviews.Title: “think twice”
Reviews.Author: drfager
Reviews.Content: my wife and son were not allowed to check in upon arrival because the reservation was in my name even though my wife had the same credit card that the reservation was made with. i arrived 30 minutes later and we were allowed to check in. the junior suite was rather large with two queen beds but with a tiny closet and only 3 drawers. my wife quickly filled the 3 drawers and my son and i lived out of our suitcases for 5 days. parking was a stunning $40 per day plus tip to the valet for each time we used our car. service is valet only. if you absolutely do not need a car, do not bring one or rent one. we needed to get to maine and to the cape so we needed a car. there was one robe provided for 3 guests. the bathroom was very ordinary. there was no refrigerator provided nor was there a sink outside of the bathroom. the beds were very nice. there was only one tv with limited stations. there was only one box of tissues. one night when we returned to the hotel there was nobody at the street level to check our car. there was nobody at the front desk either and we had to go to the bar to find someone to check in our car. we printed out boarding passes on the day we left at the business center. the cost was $5 for 15 minutes plus $1.50 for each page printed. outrageous. . if you have a choice, choose somewhere else..

Reviews.Title: “Boston's Best ! The Westin Copley!”
Reviews.Author: callieq
Reviews.Content: A quick getaway to Boston from CT was needed, so I checked the prices to stay the weekend of 11/10 and sure enough the prices were through the roof... $350 + for anywhere. Have no fear priceline was near! www.priceline.com, went on, booked the Westin for $175.00 Whooo hooo! My weekend getaway was complete! We checked in early...about 10:30 a.m. Very easy check in. For people wanting to know about the area. You cannot go wrong booking this centrally located Boston hotel. It is in the middle of EVERYTHING, whether you want to shop, walk, eat, Duck tour it...etc. Our room was on the 30th floor! The views were to die for! The bed was all dressed in white linens and was the most comfy thing ever! After checking in we went for a bite to eat... we walked through the mall and went to the Pour House. (Boylston Street) We have been there before, so we knew it was good. We walked to Fenway because I had to get an Ellsbury T- shirt! GO SOX!!! We also shopped around a little on Newbury St here and there. At night we chose the Cactus Club, very good Mexican Restaurant for some drinks. We stopped by Lir a bar/restaurant. We also stopped by Whiskeys bar/restaurant for a quick bite and Solas an Irish Pub outside the Lenox Hotel. The BAR 10 inside the hotel was definitely hoppin', but we opted to go to bed when we got back. Wait... actually, we ran out to the 24 hr Shaws, which is right next door for some snacks and then to bed it was! The Westin is great! The employees are nice, the pool is small, but I would've jumped in! The workout area seems very legit as well. Nice equipment! You have tons of restaurants to choose from and the mall is under your feet! The next morning we took a walk to Gov't center- Quincy Market... about a 15 minute walk or so. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. And if the price seems to steep, try priceline. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “When is Boston-Stay at the Westin!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PaulTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for two nights in October of 2007 for parentâ€™s weekend at Northeastern University. Quite frankly a hotel cannot get any better then this. The facility is immaculate, the location is great, and the staff is wonderful. The entire first and second floors are comprised of high end shops, restaurants, and a bar. In the sitting area are comfy couches and a fireplace. There is a huge business center and conference rooms on I think the third floor and on the fifth floor is a tremendous work out facility along with an indoor pool and hot tub. The rooms are very well appointed and are large for a city hotel. The mattresses are the heavenly sleeper you hear so much about and they were great. Lots of attention to detail right from having lots and lots of electrical outlets to having a heated fog free mirror in the bath room. Windows covered two walls, and the views were spectacular. If possible try and get a room as high up as you can for the views. The Westin is across the street from the Pru Center and related shopping (including a grocery store). The area is totally safe, very active on the street at night, and very accessible to and from all parts of the City via mass transit. Cabs were very easy to get at the hotels entrance. We received a tremendous rate of $150 through Priceline for our stay at this facility. We had heard through the grapevine that Boston is a very Priceline friendly city, and we are very glad we tried that service. Hopefully we will get the Westin again some day!!!!!!!! I would not hesitate to recommend the Westin to even the most demanding guest. It is simply a wonderful place to stay in Boston. Enjoy!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Boston Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dash1_98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a Saturday night in May. Very nice room. Excellent bar. Excellent location. Metro station and histric sights right nearby. Parking pretty expensive (but that is true for all Boston hotels I think).

Reviews.Title: “Good accomodations - Outstanding Location”
Reviews.Author: SLYCAST
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights over the Labor Day weekend. The hotel was packed due to the holiday, the Boston College/Wake Forest game and also parents escorting their kids to area colleges. The front desk managed promptly and courteously. The rooms and decor are nothing special and the Lobby has a nice looking bar. However, we stopped in for a drink during the late afternoon and were ignored by the bartender (hate that) so we left and had a better experience at the Marriott across the street. We were able to get a decent rate, so we cannot complain too much. Overall, a good place to stay if you want to be within walking distance to great shopping areas, Duck tours, bars, restaurants, etc.

Reviews.Title: “10-7-07 Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: BNSZHill
Reviews.Content: Overall, I was pleased with my stay at the Westin. My wife and I have stayed at several hotels in Boston and have always liked the Weston. While its not the Boston Harbor Inn, it is very nice and priced reasonably given its location. Only complaint was that I had asked for an early check in and while not guaranteed, they have always accomidated me in the past. Normal check in was 3:00 pm and we arrived at 12:30. Because the Red Sox had played a playoff game the night before they were sold out and behind. They took my cell number and said they would call when it was ready (1 to 1 1/2 hours they told us). We came back a little before 3:00 and it still wasn't ready. Without even asking the desk clerk had the floor manager come out and found us another room that was on the 24th floor (we originally had one on the 32nd) and appoligized for the trouble.

Reviews.Title: “Great City, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: endOfPath
Reviews.Content: I was in Boston for a conference. It was my first time spending any real amount of time in a major city. I was very impressed with what I saw of Boston. I stayed at the Westin for 3 nights and I was very impressed with the hotel. It was incredibly clean and quite upscale. I was able to walk to the Hynes Convention Center without going outdoors by way of a walkway between hotels and buildings that even extends over streets. The room was decent -- not great but decent. The gym on the fifth floor was far above average for any other hotel that I've ever stayed at. They had many (8-12) treadmills, free weights, and numerous machines. One night I stopped at the concierge desk to ask about a good place to go for a run. They had laminated maps for 3 and file mile loops around the Charles River. I didn't really even expect to get a good answer much less a printed map.

Reviews.Title: “Great...when you're not paying!”
Reviews.Author: nike365247
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a 100 strong group of 'Achievers' from my company...all expenses paid! We had a UK based travel team looking after us so they took care of all arrangements and as a result I didn't have much need to call on Hotel's own staff. Great hotel with great highrise views. Those Westin beds are amazing, almost worth the $10,000 you can buy them for from the in-room catalogue (add a bottle of Westin fragrance and a Westin shower to complete the experience at home!!). The breakfasts should not be missed, especially the breakfast bagels.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: RLGL
Reviews.Content: Went to Boston for one night and needed a hotel room. Ran a search on Hotels.com and saw that the Westin was offering a $189/night rate. Other hotels in the area were $200-$450/night, so I decided to book a room at the Westin. I hear that the Westin normally goes for $250+/night. Before booking, I signed up for Starwood Preferred Guest Services. It was very easy - did it online. Booked room via Westin website. The Westin is in a very good location - attached to the Copley and Prudential Malls and within walking distance to Back Bay, Newbury Street, Boston Commons, etc. Lots of shops, restaurants and sights in the area. Check-in was a breeze. I was very happy that they allowed me to check-in 3 hours early. Asked if they had a high floor and they upgraded me to a room on the 35th floor. They were originally going to put me in a room in the 15th floor. Doesn't hurt to ask for these things! Didn't order room service, so can't comment on that. But, there are so many options of places to eat right outside the hotel lobby that there is no reason to get room service. Room was spacious and clean and the bed was super comfortable. The Westin boasts that they have a "heavenly" bed and they're right. Bathroom is a bit small, but very clean and had a fancy shower head. I highly recommend staying at the Westin Copley Place.

Reviews.Title: “A First Class Experience”
Reviews.Author: DCG
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at The Westin Copley Place during our visit to the USA to attend a family wedding. We had originally booked a room at The Four Seasons but had to change hotels at the last minute when they were unable to offer us an additional room when the size of our party changed from 2 to 4. We were initially disappointed as we are great admirers of Four Season. However, we were seriously impressed by every aspect of our stay at the Westin. Our children's deluxe room was upgraded to a corner Junior Suite adjoining ours on 31st floor with amazing panoramic views over the whole cityscape and the Charles River. The Westin 'Heavenly Bed' more than lived up to its name and the amenities in the room were excellent. The service we experienced during our stay was exemplary and of the highest order. The genuine warmth of every member of staff we encountered was reflected in the amazing friendliness and hospitality which we experienced from the citizens of Boston. The people of Scotland pride themselves on their reputation for being a hospitable nation but we found the people of Boston to be just as warm and welcoming and friendly. It would be wrong to single any member of staff out for praise but Dan? the concierge was as professional and impressive as any concierge we have ever come across and we have stayed in some of the best hotels in the world. The breakfast restaurant serves a lovely selection of fresh and delicious dishes. Room service - with the award winning Clam Chowder from Turners in house restaurant - was first class with a huge choice. We found the prices to be fantastic value - well we would do as the UK pound is so strong against the US dollar at present! The Westin is attached by a convenient walkaway to an amazing shopping mall with many major high end outlets such as Saks of Fifth Avenue, Louis Vuitton, Niemann Marcus etc. We have been home now for three days and I still need to use asbestos gloves to handle my Amex!!! :0) I can thoroughly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston for whatever reason. A great hotel in a great city with everything that any traveler could ever need for a comfortable and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.... but”
Reviews.Author: Early_50s_Traveler
Reviews.Content: If you're interested in staying at this hotel you understand this is not a discount hotel property. You might however think the Westin name and the corporate standards around that name will provide some guarantees of quality, service and fairness in pricing. You might not be impressed. For starters -- the hotel is well located, generally in good condition and the staff want to be helpful. But it does seem like the finance department is really the ones running the hotel and they have found virtually every little way they can to get more money out of your pocket and into theirs. Does anybody else remember a time when you booked a hotel room, you might pay a 50 or 100 per uplift/surcharge for using the phone, and the restaurants and gift shops were only nominally more expensive than the general area? What happened to those days? The significant other and I selected the Westin based on location and availability for a quick five and a half day (long) weekend around Labor Day 2007. We booked a "standard" room, and showed up late in the evening of our designated arrival. So far -- no problems. Being that it was late (approaching midnight), we decided to order a quick bite for dinner. We know that room service isn't cheap but being tired and hungry and unwilling to go forage for food in a new town at a late hour we ordered away - one steak quesadilla, one shrimp cocktail and two sodas. Now I wasn't expecting to get this at Taco Bell prices, but when I saw the room service ticket and they wanted me to pay $56.00 I was really unhappy. In all fairness the shrimp (4) were larger than my thumb and the meal was presented with a sprig of parsley. But 8 oz bottles of soda for $4.50 each, a mandatory gratuity, a delivery charge, a convention tax and another miscellaneous fee or two ran a ridiculous bill into the a whole new level. A trip to the front desk the next morning got an apology from the room service manager (who double checked that they hadn't made a billing error) for the above average prices. I repeated my displeasure and vowed to not use that service again during our stay. When we returned to the room that evening there was a hand written note, a tray of cheese wedges and some crackers and a bottle of "designer" water repeating the apology. I also found out at check out that valet parking was $40 per day - a detail that was posted on a single (small) sign in the drop area that was obscured by a bus or van when we pulled in late the first night. Can't say I remember ever paying more to park my rental car (which you generally don't need to get around downtown) than for the vehicle rental itself. But life is always full of firsts. I just wish they had topped off the gas on my rental SUV and washed and hand waxed it for those rates. Another pet peeve I have dealt with housekeeping. If you're not going to change the bedding and towels daily would you tell the customers how we can get you to do so when WE think they need changing? With no signs the hotel was "earth friendly" or a "green" hotel I expected the linens to be changed daily. By day three of the trip, I had to rip the sheets off the bed and leave them in a puddle in the bath to get them changed out. Day two when I simply piled a heap of sheets, blankets and pillows on the bed (complete with make-up stains and cracker crumbs) this was somehow interpreted as - please straighten up this mess. I guess being a seasoned traveler who has spent over a thousand nights in hotels I find these kinds of details unsettling of a property that bills itself as a luxury hotel. Seems management is running towards a bottom line and as long as the occupancy rate doesn't dip below some magic level -- they are successful. But what about how we as consumers feel after the experience of the property? I for one am unlikely to want to go back to this Westin just because I felt like I was a money tree being plucked in every way possible.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: ladybugx87
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Copley Place for 4 nights in September 2007. My parents joined me for 3 nights. This hotel is in a great location with many restaurants and shops nearby (Shaw's is right across the street for groceries, Newbury street has great shops). Check in was quite smooth. They were accomodating of my request for extra keys. My room was very nice. I had a view of the Charles River which was nice. The beds were as comfortable as all Westin beds and the bath was quite nice. Housekeeping did a great job keeping the room clean. The gym here is quite large and clean. I used it multiple times and it was always clean and something was open. I also took the recommended 5 mile running route from the hotel and it was beautiful. I ordered room service one day and it was quite prompt and good. The only issue was at check out. The valet charges were on my room bill even though my parents had paid them prior to leaving. It took about 10 minutes to get that resolved. i would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Copley Westin”
Reviews.Author: Raybird99
Reviews.Content: Booked through Priceline. Was hoping to get the Marriott, but was not disappointed. The location is great, on the corner of Copley square. Room was great, service was solid, and it'as a block away from the T stop. Also close to good restaurants, Fenway and the Boston Common. If you like seafood, the Atlantic Fish Company is fantastic and is only a 5 minute walk. Also got a room with by far the best view I've had through a priceline reservation. Overall, could not have asked for more.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay I've Ever Had!!!”
Reviews.Author: SJWoman
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at the Westin Copley Place after booking it with my points thru Starwood. When I asked if any rooms with 2 beds were available, I was upgraded instantly to a penthouse suite next door to the Presidential Suite!!! Although it still only had one bed, it had a chaise lounge that was big enough to sleep on. And the room was GI-MUNGOUS (to use my children's terms). The view was spectacular, and maid service very considerate. Hotel is also EXTREMELY conveniently located, being one of the anchor hotels for the Commonwealth Mall (I think that's what it's called) so the lobby of the hotel connects with the mall. It's also across the street from the Boston Public Library, and 2-3 blocks from all the shopping on Newbury St. It's also walking distance (5-10 min) from the public gardens. The pool, although small, is still quite swim-able, although one needs to share with the children who like to play there, too. The fitness room has plenty of equipment & had only one other occupant the couple of times I visited it. We had a WONDERFUL time, and would love to stay there again the next time we're in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Big, comfortable, clean, & central”
Reviews.Author: cooperpd
Reviews.Content: Just as my title states. Stayed here 17-23 Aug in room 2301. Big corner room overlooking the Charles River. Arrived via Logan. Easy shuttle/subway ride to Copley station. Exited the station and walked down 1 block (other side of the library) to the hotel. At check in, standard room was upgraded to junior suite. Front Desk staff were friendly and helpful. Asked for a second refridgerator and it arrived minutes after I got into the room. Junior suite is a standard room and a half. Entered suite into a small hall with closet. Closet had sufficient number of wood hangers, iron, board, and mini safe with key. Hall opened up into a large area with work desk. including lamp, phone, and internet connection. Wireless internet also available and free access with suite. Bathroom was small but nice. Granite counter top, soap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, body wash, hair dryer. Heavenly bath/double shower head had good pressure but I felt it too low for massage action. King pillowtop bed was supportive. Linens crisp, clean, good supportive pillows. Night stands with lamps on both sides. Pullout sofa bed, side chair, side tables, side chair with foot support, floor lamp, TV armoire, game control, remote, Sony clock radio, phone. Mini bar with key and basket of snacks. Looked well stocked BUT very over priced. $5 for king size candy, $7 for mini liquors. Housekeeping was terrific. Did an excellent job. Didn't use room service but from what I saw on the menu and on service carts in the hall, it looked good. I found the items overpriced. $18 for continental breakfast. Hotel is close to everything. Recommend getting the Transit Link Pass if you're in town for a week. $15 for 7 days. easy subway trains to everywhere you'd want to go in Boston/Cambridge.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: pinkpanther8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 weeks ago and again this week. Loved our junior corner suite with a view of the Charles River. Our service requests were met very quickly and our car was brought up from valet parking very soon after calling ($40/night). The room was clean and nicely furnished, but the bathroom was small. The water pressure in the shower is amazing. We really love the Westin beds which just about guarantee an excellent night sleep. We're considering buying the Heavenly Bed. The location is wonderful. There's a great restaurant 2 blocks away called Skipjack's Seafood Emporium which has great seafood and service. Be sure to eat in the North End for Italian food when in Boston. We used to stay at the Sheraton, but this is so much better. The Sheraton does have a much nicer pool. The Westin pool is small and doesn't look as nice as it does on their website.

Reviews.Title: “Very satisfied”
Reviews.Author: jmlls07
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is wonderful in appearance, in cleanliness and in decor. It is centrally located in Back Bay, connected to Copley Square mall, which is connected to the Prudential Center and is easily in walking distance to Downtown Crossing, Fenway, Fanueil Hall, Waterfront, South End, etc. The hotel lobby is very posh, and Bar 10 has the best martinis I have ever tasted, no matter how overpriced they are, they were worth it. The room itself was a good size, the bathrooms a little small, but still acceptable with granite countertops and typical Westin toiletries. The heavenly bed, mini bar, tv, etc was key and the view from the 29th floor was wonderful. Parking expensive $40/day, and doors to room shook a little bit when other doors down the hall would slam shut. The walls werent as thin as we were expecting, so it was all good. The staff was VERY accommodating, didnt seem to care we were Priceline customers. I would definitely book again. For sure.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: lovethebeach07
Reviews.Content: Me and my 3 friends just went up to Boston last weekend and stayed at the Westin- Copley Square. The hotel is in a great location, right by wonderful shopping on Newbury Street and by the T. It is also connected to a beautiful mall so that was convienent. They let us check in ealry (10am) since our flight got in early. The beds were the most comfortable ever and the view was beautiful. the only problem we had was that the air conditioner didn't work really well and it was 97 degrees on Saturday. They tried to fix it but had little luck. I called and complained today and they gave me 2 free nights for a future trip! So that made up for it!! I will go back again for sure. And we booked on priceline.com and got the rooms for $130 a night! What a steal for boston!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it..........”
Reviews.Author: Jancent
Reviews.Content: Myself and my hubby stayed here for our anniversary, we had an excellent corner suite will an amazing view. We are sent champagne and strawberrys to congratulate us on our anniversary. Everything about the hotel was great, except we thought the restaurant and food service could have been a bit better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Franchise35
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley is a great hotel right in the heart of Boston. The location is fabulous as it is walking distance to most of the major downtown landmarks such as Newberry St, Boston Common, Public Garden and Copley Square. There is plenty of shopping very close by (a few malls are actually attached to the hotel) and lots of good restaurants as well. The hotel itself was very good and the service was outstanding. The rooms were very spacious and clean and the few times I ordered room service the food arrived quickly and was still piping hot! I would highly recommend this hotel for business travelers to Boston as well as folks who want an ideal location to stay at that is within close proximity to all the key tourist sites in the city.

Reviews.Title: “No problems with the Weswtin Copley Place”
Reviews.Author: The_Toe
Reviews.Content: It is a fascinating experience to stay at a hotel after reading many reviews. I have found that the reviews are more often a reflection of the poster. Just click on that personâ€™s name and read their other reviews and I bet you would find similar complaints. We stayed five nights June 27-July 2. Never had any problems with the paper-thin walls complained about often on this thread. My wife and I brought our two children, ages 9 and 5, and they had a blast. We had two side trips, one to Salem and the other to Plymouth. The trip to Salem is easy. Take the T to the North End station; take the Amtrak train from the North end station and four or five stops later you are in Salem. With Plymouth you need to rent a car which we were able to do because of the Hertz desk in the lobby. You pick up and drop off curbside to the hotel. The hotel is also very close to Newberry Street. I would also recommend the Boston Pub Crawl Tour. Great stories about American history and beer. Beds and housekeeping were fine. All of you who are complaining have to remember this is Boston. These people will not be intimidated by an angry customer. If you are contemplating a stay in Boston, the Westin Copley Place is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS and close to Fenway”
Reviews.Author: AngelMel
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley Place is GORGEOUS. Service was impeccable, location extremely convenient. We stayed there primarily because we were going to the Red Sox game, and the hotel is a walkable distance to Fenway - especially if it is a nice evening. The bar in the hotel is very chic and classy and best of all, they serve Veuve Clicquot by the glass. The rooms were spacious and clean. We had a stunning view of the Charles River (see photo). My boyfriend called to see if he could have his shoes shined and ready the next day. 2 minutes later, someone was at our door to pick up the shoes, and 7 minutes after that, they were ready. Now that's service! The front desk, bartenders, room service, and housekeeping staff were all extremely friendly and gracious. Wireless internet is available, and they even lovely Westin post-it notes in the room. Nice touch. Of course I could go on and on about the Heavenly Bath products in the bathroom. I was hoping to purchase a gallon of the bath gel, but no such luck. If you have a chance - stay here - it's worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: azstephany
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time in Boston and a great part of that I credit to the Westin Copley Square. First of all, the location is near perfection. It is across the street from Trinity Church, Boston Public Library, a convenient T-stop, a huge grocery store, a mall with gobs of shopping and a food court, tons of chains and cafe restaurants. It's simply wonderful. The rooms were large and I noticed absolutely no problem with sound-proofing. A prank fire alarm did wake us up at 5:21 a.m. one morning (grrrr) but not the hotel's fault. The beds were great, everything was clean, the hotel is not ultra luxurious, but it is very nice. Some tips: There is a pen store off the lobby that will let you use the internet $5/15 min. You can charge it to the room and it's not a huge price to pay for peace of mind in clearing your e-mails. There is a great restaurant called Stephanie's Cafe on Newburry. Highly recommended! Ask for a fridge so you can go to Shaw's Grocery store and stock up on food. It definitely helps save money as the room service is pricey (as is the case in most hotels). Oh! The pool and work out room are fantastic too. The pool is salt water which was a nice treat.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from Westin”
Reviews.Author: 944s993
Reviews.Content: I was quite disappointed after my recent stay. Westin should have seriously considered how their buildings are constructed before the "renewed, refreshed and restored" campaign was launched. The walls were so thin I heard EVERYTHING my neighbors did, as well as converstions of people walking down the hallways, all night long. Maid service was laughable. My comforter was taken away after the first night and never made it back. A pitcher and glasses from room service ordered on Friday night were still in the room when I left on Sunday. Finally, the air conditioner in the room never worked right. Maintenance assured me that it was cooling, and being from Texas I assumed that maybe units up north were just not designed to cool the way ours do here. Imagine my surprise when I went to a friends room in another area hotel and realized that some air conditioners in Boston actually do cool. Maybe this is why my comforter disappeared-- maybe they thought I didn't need it... The concierge service was disappointing. Yes, my request was taken care of initially by Marcos. When we needed to make a change later on, however, the new concierge on duty seemed frazzled and clueless saying she didn't know anything about my original request. After being on hold for 10 minutes she finally decided to check the log book they keep--amazing, all the information was right there! There was also a young lady at the front desk who had no clue how to handle an incoming fax for a guest. After 20 minutes of waiting in the lobby for her to figure it out, another employee finally stepped in and let me know it was waiting in my room. Just not the 'polish' I've come to expect from Westin. Most of my group was at the nearby Sheraton, but I had chosen the Westin specifically because I felt sure the bed and pillows would be perfect, and I could actually rest. The only thing going for this room was the bed, and that alone was not worth the price. This hotel is far cry from what Westin usually provides.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best SPG property in Boston”
Reviews.Author: terravisum
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Westin Copley around 10PM to an empty lobby. The numerous lounge chairs in the lobby is a nice place to wait. The check-in procedure was smooth and friendly and I was in the elevator to my room within 5 minutes. The Westin Boston is well-known for its stinginess in upgrading SPG elite members so it is no surprise that I found my room to be no different than the one that I have booked. Although, I did have a nice river view but the downside is that my room was close to the ice dispenser. Given the room inadequate sound-proofing, it is not the best room to be in. The king bed however is the huge Californian style size-wise and can fit two adults with space to spare. The Heavenly Bed is of course wonderful as always. The room is nicely appointed but I preferred the room that I had over at the Boston Sheraton. I have always liked the Westin amenities and they are fully presented here. The bathroom however is quite small and definitively smaller than the other Westins that I have been in. The dual-head shower head gives good massage and the water pressure is decent. The location of the Westin is right in front of the Boston public library. The Copley T station is a block away and there are lots of restaurants around the area. An excellent location to be in. All in all, the Westin Copley is a decent above average Westin. However, the Sheraton a few blocks away is also a nice hotel that is equal to the Westin in most aspect. Pick the one that is more value to you, you can't loose with either one.

Reviews.Title: “Westin Was So So”
Reviews.Author: kjs2000
Reviews.Content: Hotel had a very central location. The staff was friendly, but the bathroom was subpar. It did not meet my definition of a "Heavenly Bath" as was advertised!! It was very small. There was mildew in the shower and the bathroom ceiling, most likely due to the fact that there was no fan in the bathroom. The hotel room was hot and sticky after my spouse and I each showered in the morning. The bed was comfy. Our stay included breakfast for two mornings. The food was satisfactory, but not great. The buffet included oatmeal, pastries, eggs benedict, fruit, sausage, and potatoes. Next time we are in Boston, we will likely try a different hotel. I think we will be able to get better quality for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location in Boston”
Reviews.Author: drjeff
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for an overnight conference. The rooms are beautiful and the service is very good. The hotel has an excellent location for touring Boston. The food in the hotel with the exception of hot chocoalte at t breakfast is very good. When I asked for hot chocolate I recieved a packet and hot water, surprising for a hotel of this quality. The pool is small but adequate. Overall a nce stay and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: tympan
Reviews.Content: I had a very good stay at the Westin for a conference over Memorial Day weekend. I got an excellent weekend rate, but still scored a huge corner room on the 20th floor with great views to the south and west. Westin's "heavenly" bed is indeed very comfortable, with excellent pillows. The double shower head is a nice touch and has ample water pressure. High-speed internet is available (via Ethernet connection) in-room for $10/day; wi-fi is available only in the lobby areas. There's a business center adjacent to the lobby where you can print and fax (for a hefty charge). Service in general was very responsive, as when I called after midnight to report that I'd forgotten to bring toothpaste and a toothbrush kit was delivered within minutes. Check-in was quick, express check-out was a no-brainer, and luggage service was easy. (Don't bring a car if you can help it: parking is $40/night and street parking is nearly impossible.) As others have reported, noise insulation from adjoining rooms is only so-so. I could at times hear TV and a child crying from the neighboring room and could also hear pipes running quite loudly from adjoining bathrooms. It wasn't terribly bothersome, though. The hotel's location is excellent, overlooking Copley Square and on the border of the Back Bay and South End. Turn north on Dartmouth Street and you're two blocks from upscale shops and restaurants on Newbury Street; a longer walk south takes you to trendy South End restaurants on Tremont Street. The hotel is attached directly to the Copley Place mall and the Prudential building, which means lots of shops and restaurants (including Legal Sea Foods, Turner Fisheries, a sushi place and several coffee shops--there's a Starbucks just off the lobby)--if the weather is bad you'll never have to go outside. Access to public transportation is great--you're a block away from the T (subway) stops at Copley (Green Line) and Back Bay (Orange Line). If you're a first-time Boston visitor I can see why you might want to stay closer to Beacon Hill or the North End, but the Public Gardens and Common are only about a 10-minute walk away, and if you're a more seasoned visitor this is probably a more fun place to be. Both the Back Bay and South End have beautiful late-19th-century architecture--well worth a stroll. One really unpleasant thing happened that's probably preventing me from giving the Westin a 5. When I arrived in my room it appeared that the bathroom had been cleaned, but when I lifted the toilet seat it was clear that the toilet had been, um, used and not flushed...I called housekeeping and then had to have a bit of a debate with the housekeepers who arrived, who insisted that they had just cleaned the bathroom and that maybe there was just soap in the bowl (believe me, that is NOT what soap looks like). I finally did get them to re-clean the toilet, but it definitely made me a little skeptical about how well they were cleaning. (My guess is that some member of the staff had used the toilet after it had been cleaned that day.) I'd say overall the cleanliness of the room was adequate, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Solid place to stay”
Reviews.Author: snyc9
Reviews.Content: After a night at the atrocious Bulfinch Hotel, I transfered to the Westin and was so glad I did. For $169 a night (the same price as the Bulfinch), the Westin is worlds away. Efficient, clean, professional, comfortable. From the 19th floor, the views were spectacular. The room was just flooded with light when I walked in. There is a small section of the window that opens -- something many hotels don't have, but a detail that's much appreciated for someone who enjoys fresh air in their room. The bed, as the name suggests, really was "heavenly." I slept so soundly and comfortably on it. I loved the location -- very central, near everything, including the subway, which was right outside of the hotel. Room service menu is really nice, there's a sushi restaurant, a seafood restaurant, a cool bar, a spa, a pool, starbucks coffee in your room (and a starbucks cafe downstairs too). For a huge hotel like this one, the service and attention to detail was really impressive. Apart from a missing bulb in one of the lamps and $9.99 internet access, I can't think of any flaws here. The bathroom was a little small for such a spacious room, but it didn't take away from the experience at all. Overall, I would recommend this hotel highly for those who seek consistency, an incredible bed, a central location and great amenities. This place will be my top choice in Boston from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Views!”
Reviews.Author: ElizBC
Reviews.Content: We just finished a stay at the Westin, from Monday, May 14 through Friday, May 18. My husband had a business trip so we didn't pay, but I noticed the price was $500. Not too sure if I would have paid that price myself even if I had the spare cash. The views from our room on the 33rd floor were gorgeous - we could see the whole back back and across the river into Cambridge. Besides that, I wouldn't pay that much money for this hotel. For a $500/night room, I feel I should be able to give five stars but I can't. The heavenly bed and bath were fantastic, but that's about all that separates this hotel from others. Even those have competition now, like the Hyatt beds. The staff was nice enough, but nothing extraordinary. We had two requests - a crib and room service, and both were completed timely and properly. This hotel has one of the best views in Boston, and it has a fantastic location. It's attached to the Copley Mall and the Prudential Building. It's also a block away from back bay shopping, dining and nightlife. It's a central location to other attractions, such as Fenway Park, Beacon Hill, Boston Common/Gardens, and the Financial District. I called down for parking rates one day for my sister who was coming in for the day. Parking was quoted at $41/day (valet only) or $35 for 8 hours. That was ridiculous, and there are several other cheaper garages around. For one, the Dartmouth Street garage (between Columbus and St. James/Huntington) is only $10 for nighttime parking after 5pm...not sure of its night rates...and it's super close! Also, the Radisson Hotel garage on Stuart Street (a few blocks away, drop your bags, then go to park and walk back) is only $18/day!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service, Convenient to the Convention Center”
Reviews.Author: Kris_K_D
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely stay at the Westin Copley Place during a recent business trip to Boston. This Westin had a friendly staff and excellent concierge that provided ample sightseeing information for my first trip to Boston. The LOCATION of the hotel is great if you're going to the convention center. If you never want to go outside, you could get to the convention center via two skybridges between the hotel and Copley Place Mall. It's still a bit of a brisk walk, weaving through strolling shoppers; allow 15-20 minutes. This is definitely a business hotel because, although Boston is the "walking city," I don't think this is the ideal location for sightseeing. After my trolley tour of Boston, I can see there are more colorful locations that might be a better base -- particularly Beacon Hill and the North End (Little Italy, especially). The Back Bay area had nice shopping and beautiful homes, though, so it was a nice walk to Fenway from The Westin. The Westin's location "attached" to the mall, means there are several decent DINING options besides what's offered at the hotel. I pretty much frequented Au Bon Pain twice daily, but there's also Chili's, The Cheesecake Factory, and a P.F. Chang's was coming soon. I was lucky to get a ROOM on a high floor with an excellent view of the Hancock Tower, Trinity Church, and a sweeping view of Boston and the Charles River. (I highly recommend a room on that side.) The room was spacious enough and was kept very clean. My only complaint was the size of the bathroom, which was a bit on the small side. From the toilet, a petite person like me could turn on the sink faucet and the tub faucet! Two people could not get ready in the morning in that small of a space. I would recommend The Westin Copley Place for a business traveler or for particular sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin for Boston Marathoners”
Reviews.Author: CBetty
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from Boston where he (not I) ran the Boston Marathon and we stayed at The Westin in downtown Boston. As this year the marathon was plagued with stormy weather (30-50 mph wind gusts), one of the best parts of the hotel was it's location and link to the Copley Place Mall. We were able to come to Boston on the train and get to our hotel without ever stepping outside, not to mention shop and eat in the restaurants housed conviently throughout the connected mall of buildings. For my running husband, it was close to catch the morning bus to the start line and then great for him to come back to the hotel so conveniently located near the finish line. The accomodations at the hotel were also very nice. We had a lovely corner suite with a great panoramic view. The beds were terrific and the staff was friendly. Everything was clean and our reservations in order! Couldn't ask for anything more!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice beds...”
Reviews.Author: nyg21xo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Copley Apr 13-14. The hotel itself is pretty stunning, its connected to a mall and the decor is dark and spacious when you enter the lobby (which is right across from a starbucks) Other than that, the room service is ridiculously expensive, they overcharged my card for certain thing (which they happily settled, no questions asked) although it was fun to have pizza and beer delivered to the room on one of those white linen tables...we felt like jet setters. We had to take a cab all the way down to Fenway to get to the good bars, but the beds in the room were amazing to come back to. All in all, I got a great deal on hotwire for this hotel but I don't think i'd pay rack rate for it.

Reviews.Title: “Noise & Dumb Staff”
Reviews.Author: Business_2_Globe
Reviews.Content: Noisy, noisy noisy. as a Platinum guest normally I get treated well, and a previous stay at the Copley had been very nice. The views are very nice. Having just been on the redeye they were nice enough to have a junior suite ready as I was staying for a week, and after breakfast I tried to get mid-morning nap. Couldn't because, housekeepers made a lot of noise. The room wasn't very clean also, and the air-con sounded like it was a ratttling tin-can. In the afternoon, I suggested to the 'manager' if he switched floors it would be nice - a 22 year-old who said, 'but sir, you have a nice room' and didn't want to deal with it. Later I would have ohter problems with internet & shower, confirming it was a bad room. It was hard to get to sleep that night as the connecting rooms are 'paper-thin', and my neighbours were showering. At 2am that night the air-con woke me up, and I couldn't sleep, so I worked. I tried to get some sleep again mid-morning. But the front-desk called me to tell me that I had D&D on the door, thus waking me up. Then, worse, another hotel employee brought something that was missing from the room, meaning that I slept about 15 minutes. By this stage I habdn't had more than 3 hours sleep a night for several days, having been flying. Finally I asked for the manager, who gave me the same room on a better floor. The housekeeping on this floor is definitely better. By the way I have noticed recently in many starwood properties that housekeeping have stopped putting feedback forms in the rooms, meaning you have to ask. as filling out these forms has with only one exception, rarely been useful, I thought to post here. Even being platinum, paying full price (ie not priceline, etc), staying for a week, this hotel had to be complained to, to do the right thing. And for my trouble, no 'comp' vouchers or even embarassment.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, but Noisy Rooms”
Reviews.Author: blossom1022
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during Easter weekend for a relaxing getaway trip. Location, location, location. This is the best asset of the Westin Copley Plaza. We took the Amtrak train to Boston and the Westin Copley was right across the street. No need to get a cab! The area has tons of restaurants, cafes, and boutique shops in walking distance and Copley Plaza is a mall filled with high-end shops. The Westin itself is your typical urban high-rise chain hotel. Check-in was efficient, the lobby and public areas were clean and very well kept. Our room with a king-sized bed was clean and the bed was "heavenly". I'm determined to buy the Heavenly Bed in the future! We ordered room service on our first morning there and it arrived as promised, within 30 minutes and it was still warm. However, there were two negatives features during our stay. 1) Housekeeping. On the second day of our stay we noticed that housekeeping didn't clean the coffee pot or replenish coffee/tea supplies. Since we were only staying for a short time this wasn't a big deal, but given that this is supposed to be 4-star hotel, I thought it was neglectful nonetheless. 2.)NOISE. I have to agree about the thin walls. My husband and I woke up earlier than we would've during our stay because we could hear other guests flushing toilets, showering, etc. Although I loved the location, I wouldn't return to the Westin because of the noise factor. I would probably consider the Marriott Copley, which is in the same complex, or other nearby hotels like the Fairmount across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great view, worth the price”
Reviews.Author: jarbitro
Reviews.Content: The extra cost for the "River View" room was worth it. From the room we could see the plaza, river, and Fenway Park. The breakfast was top notch, the staff was friendly, a late check-out was easy to get. You don't even have to go outside to get to shopping mall that spans several blocks. I had read complaints about the room noise, but our room was quiet. It was worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jramon
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights at the Westin Copley, we got a room with a nice view of the river. I would highly recommend this hotel. The location is great as well as the room, service and value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “Paper Thin Walls - Yes, It Is True”
Reviews.Author: johnivan521
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in March of 2007 on the 29th floor. I do agree with a previous reviewer that the walls are paper thin (I had a standard 2 queen bed guestroom). I am a sound sleeper and had my sleep interrupted by the guest next door taking a shower (yes, the noise was that loud). The sound of the pipes especially made the sound unpleasant. This hotel room was definitely dated but kept in decent condition and the housekeeping was good. I am not a fan of the Westin Heavenly Bed because it is too firm and the pillows are too thick for my taste. The customer service at the front desk ranged from excellent to poor. One more thing, I do not understand on the date of checkout why housekeeping comes to make up your room before you have checked out of the hotel. This seems counterintuitive to me since the hotel would need to refresh your room twice that day, so the room would be ready for the next guest. Anyway, my stay was just ok, and I am therefore not inclined to return to this hotel again being it was $259/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dan_S_NYC
Reviews.Content: A colleague and I were in Boston for 1 night on business, and we stayed at the Westin Copley Place. This was a very conveninently located and comfortable place to stay. The indoor mall allows access to shops and restaurants without having to go outside, which was ideal for winter temps. :) The room was pleasant, and the bed was especially comfortable. Definitely recommended and I will plan to stay here again the next time business takes me up to Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: sac_jhu
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Westin Copley Place was excellent. The price we paid was reasonable- my suggestion is to check out the hotel's website directly for last-minute specials. The hotel staff was friendly and helpful. We were given a large room on the 34th floor with a nearly panoramic view of Boston and Cambridge. The room itself was clean and comfortable. The only minor problem we encountered were the thin walls, which meant that we could hear the conversation in the next room. All in all, this was a great stay in one of the best hotels in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Paper Thin Walls”
Reviews.Author: OnthemoveCt
Reviews.Content: If you choose to stay at the Westin, be certain to ask for a room without a connecting door to another room. We did not make this request, and suffered through two nights of loud conversation coming from the room next door. We could hear and understand every word spoken through the door! Security did ask our neighbors to quiet down, which made them unhappy and even louder (of course!). In addition, I found hair in the bathtub and a dirty plastic fork on the floor upon arrival. Not what I would have expected from a Westin. On the plus side, great location and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “westin does well in boston”
Reviews.Author: carySc
Reviews.Content: Spectacular view from corner junior suite! Great location. Competent staff. Adjacent malls and restaurants. Not five star, but a happy choice. Not too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The Wonderful Westin”
Reviews.Author: BeantownBoiler
Reviews.Content: My finace (now husband) was traveling to Boston on business so I joined him on his trip. We now live in Boston, but at the time of our stay at the Westin, we were living in Tampa FL. The staff at the Westin are very helpful and professional. As Starwoods Preferred Guests we were upgraded to to a spacious junior suite with many windows and, as in all Westins, the Heavenly Bed. The location of the Copley Westin is perfect. The hotel is connected to the Copley Mall, an upscale mall with almost every high-end shop your heart could desire. It's just two blocks from Newbury street which is lined with many boutique shops and great dining. Boylston St also has many options for high end dining. There are two T (train) stops within two blocks of the hotel (Copley-Green Line and Back Bay-Orange Line). I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Boston. I've also heard great things about the new Westin on the waterfront, but I personally think the Copley location is accesible to more attactions.

Reviews.Title: “Just as a Westin should be”
Reviews.Author: mrsf888
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley is as a Westin should be. The room was clean and spacious, and the bed was as adverstised -- Heavenly. And although I didn't get a room with the view of the Charles River, the Boston night lights were so mesmerizing that I actually left the drapes open during my sleeps. The location of the hotel is fabulous as busy Boylston Street is literally a block away and trendy Newbury Street is not that much farther. And even though I was in Boston the week it faced its coldest tempreatures this winter, I still managed to walk from the hotel to "Cheers" on Beacon Street, which is on the outskirts of Beacon Hill. Boston looks like it has plenty of nice, upscale hotels throughout Copley Plaza and other downtown "districts" that might be worth a stay also. However, if I go back to Boston again, I'd stay at the Westin Copley again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: nic1047
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located in the heart of Back Bay, right on Copley square and within a minutes walk to the subway and dozens of restaurants. Stayed here by choice too many times so have got to know the place. Excellent views are to be had from the higher floors, with rooms **01 to **12 facing the river being the most spectacular with the corner room suites taking top spot. The hotel is at the end of the 1/2 mile long walkway connected malls so no need to venture outside when a Nor-Easter hits the city in the depth of winter. Decor varies between rooms, some having been recently redocorated, but from my observations the bathroom fittings were left unchanged so are getting a little faded. Room rates vary considerably due to the various conventions taking place. The Starwood guest complimentary daily Panna water ration can be very illusive. 6 days into this trip and I am still waiting and now gasping for my first bottle. Gym was renovated and extended a few years back and is now quite bright and roomy, although the pool is a little small, but you can take a 8 minute walk through the mall to the sheraton if you need a big pool. For joggers the Charles river is a 1/4 mile away where you can join the hoards of walkers, runners and cyclists, but to enjoy the best views of Boston cross over the river on Mass Ave and return over the Salt + Pepper pot bridge, which is best enjoyed at sun-set. (don't forget the camera). Starbucks just off the lobby helps get the day off to a fine start. Advisable not to send 'cold wash only' items in the laundry. If you get a good room at a reasonable rate this is a very nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: lsanche3
Reviews.Content: We booked The Westin Copley Place through the Starwood website; they had some great promotions - better rates than expedia, orbitz, etc. We lived in Boston for 5 years and went to visit friends. We booked the Westin at Copley because we knew it was located within walking distance to many of Boston's great restaurants and shops. Our room had a view of the Charle's River. The bed was VERY comfortable and the room was clean. We ate breakfast at the hotel one morning. It wasn't anything spectacular but it wasn't bad either. The staff was friendly and polite. We will probably stay here again when we visit Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: enr12
Reviews.Content: We had a very comfortable room overlooking the city, and the Charles River in the distance. The Hotel is connected by a covered walk way to a shopping mall so one does not need to go out of doors if it was raining or snowing, and you can cover several blocks of high end stores, from Saks to NM, and other very nice stores and the food court or the Cheese Cake Factory. It also connects to the Marriot where one can pick up the tour bus that goes around Boston, which leaves every 20 mins. The room was very comfortable, although the bath room was a little small, but it did have a shower and a tub. A very well located hotel in a very nice section of town, and within 8 min walk to a very interesting shopping street with unusually stores.

Reviews.Title: “Hot Tub Out of Service; Everything Else Great”
Reviews.Author: brokenankle
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here with my sister and her daughter the weekend after Thanksgiving. The calibre of the hotel's restaurants was outstanding. Our room was wonderful, the beds comfortable and the service exemplary. Had the hot tub been in service, it would have been a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dididb911
Reviews.Content: Our family spent one night in Boston to celebrate my husband's birthday and for the Rocketts Christmas show at the Wang. We have always been to loyal to Hilton but I came across a Winter special rate of $159 for a stay (two double bed) at the Westin so we booked it. Prior to our arrival I had faxed the hotel and asked for the possibilty of a room on a higher level overlooking the Charles River as it was my husbands birthday. We arrived at 11am on Friday during check out and were given the option by the valet jockey to park for around $20 across the street at the Claredon Garage. We dropped our luggage and opted to park in the garage. Upon checking in we were upgraded to a corner suite (Thanks Westin!) with one king bed. Requested a roll-away for one of the kids and off to the room we went. Our suite was a spectacular corner suites with two near walls of windows overlooking Boston and the Charles River. My seven year old son was in his glory as where the two windows met in the corner was a small circular interior rail that he would sit on and overlook all the bustling in Boston-a perfect "inside perch" with the best view in Boston! The room had a "heavenly" king size bed with pull-out couch and chairs along with a desk area. The following day we did have to agree that the bed is truly 'heavenly" with all the pillows and fluffy covers. The pool and fitness area is top notch. The gym is not a typical hotel gym but a full work out facility with flat screen TV 's at all units and Bon Appetite and Runners world magazines all lined up and ready for reading. The pool was good sized and the temperature was perfect. We were able to work out in the gym and overlook the kids in the pool from the glass window. Then when we returned to our room after dinner we found a chilled bottle of Moet Champagne and a tray of chocolate covered strawberries and confections along with birthday wishes for my husband. How very nice!! We only stayed one night but oh how one night changed us now to Westin people!!! Everyone we came into contact with was curtious and willing to assist us with anything and we had an exceptional stay.

Reviews.Title: “not good for the price”
Reviews.Author: HMS007
Reviews.Content: very good location... but hotel is grossly overpriced.... in my room, phone not working, the iron is broken and leaks colored fluid onto my business suite.. I am a regular business traveler and will NOT recommend this hotel for business use.

Reviews.Title: “Big and busy hotel in a prime Boston location”
Reviews.Author: el_midnite
Reviews.Content: This Westin is big and made for the business traveler. However, it still maintains a fine level of service and as a plus, has a great Back Bay location. I'd recommend it for any type of guest, business or leisure. There is easy access to public transportation and many fine restaurants and shops nearby. If you are so inclined, I even walked to Fenway Park from this hotel. My room was large, by typical modern hotel standards, and comfortably furnished. It wasn't overly posh, but still quite acceptable. You know, the usual: nice comfy bed, decent bathroom, the basics of modern conveniences. The lobby is upstairs from the ground floor, can be a bit confusing for the frst time visitor. The staff was cordial and seemingly professional enough for my tastes. I do recall the long waits for elevators, perhaps that has been remedied. All in all, it is a solid upscale, large, hotel. I have stayed at the Marriott nearby in Copley Center and would prefer the Westin over that property. I did not try any of the hotel's food, because in the same complex is Turner Fisheries, home to Boston's best chowder. Also, very close are at least two Legal Seafoods, a very fine choice for good...seafood. I would definitely stay at this Westin again. It's a good choice for business travelers, or anyone visiting Boston for that matter. It is expensive, perhaps a bit low on the value scale, but Boston is an exceedingly pricey city, especially hotel-wise. You do get what you pay for, considering it is Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Great night at the Westin Copley Place”
Reviews.Author: phl5110
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin this past weekend (Nov 4-5) while visiting Boston with my boyfriend. We got a winter sale rate of $199/night which is really cheap for the Westin, I believe the current going rate is about 450/night or so. I would not have stayed here if we didn't get that special rate, I refuse to pay over 400 for one night's hotel stay! We had a great time, it was a very nice hotel, room was pretty big and nicely kept, wonderful view of Boston from the 30th floor! We had a corner room. Our king bed was awesome - one of the most comfortable ever. I don't know why others commented on the Heavenly Beds being hard or uncomfortable, maybe some of them in other rooms were worn out? Not sure, b/c this bed gave me the best night's sleep ever! In fact, once we laid down after dinner, we were passed out before 10 pm thus ending any plans for nightlife - haha. Bathroom was quite small, but the double showerhead was a nice addition. No robes though, which was disappointing. As we only stayed for one night, we honestly didn't spend much time at all in the hotel - we didn't check in until after dinner and then checked out at 10:30 a.m. But the time we spent was quite enjoyable, and I'd come back again to the Westin Copley if I had a low rate again. I don't really think it's worth over 400/night though! If I was going to pay that much, I'd stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cracked Ceilings, Mildewy Showers, Concrete beds, and itchy linens.”
Reviews.Author: marcom1234
Reviews.Content: I am presently staying here on business with a conference. My ceiling has a massive crack going across it from end to end. The plaster is chipping too! My "Heavenly" bed is hard and firm. Not so heavenly compared to my nice pillowtopped mattress at home. The linens and pillows were worn and fraid. I expect this from motel 6, but not from a $495 a night hotel in Boston. I could be staying at the Ritz for this price! Prices are outrageous for minibar items. Internet is $10 a day. Shower head was mildewy. Minimal clothing storage space. 3 half drawers and a Small closet. Not for any more than 1 person. The towels and robes are hard and scratchy. Evidently the hotel does not believe in fabric softner. I am not impressed and will not be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Westin!”
Reviews.Author: BayAreaMover
Reviews.Content: We loved staying at the Westin and the location was perfect. All hotel staff was helfpul. Room was spacious and quiet with bathrobes and luxury bed! Only negative was some mold in bathroom shower. Also loved the lobby for relaxing and sipping drinks. Highly recommend and would stay there again when we are in Boston.

Reviews.Title: “Westin was awesome”
Reviews.Author: Andreabar
