Reviews.Content: Just returned from a three night stay at the Westin. Location is terrific. We had a great view of the Charles River from our room on the 22nd floor. The beds were so comfortable and there was little to no noise from other rooms or hallway. Would definitely stay at the Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “Want to Love it but....”
Reviews.Author: MichaelJA
Reviews.Content: I have always liked the Westin Copley for its location and excellent views. However, the hotel charges a lot for those two features, and while rooms have been upgraded, they could be better. The hotel needs to refresh carpets and furniture more often.The bathrooms are notoriously small â€” the door bumps up against the tub, leaving no room to manuever. The staff is mixed, some more than willing to go the distance and others quite rude. Housekeeping can be very slow and I've often come back to my room in the early afternoon to find the room is still not clean. Parking charges are outrageuous at $40 a day. The concierge desk staff needs more training. They seem short and hassled. I rented a car thru Hertz and found the old woman behind the desk to be one of the rudest people i've encountered in 20 years of travelling. Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location in City”
Reviews.Author: osutravel
Reviews.Content: This is the best location in Boston as it is 100 yards from the T stop and 2 blocks from Newbury street. Clean lobby with warm reception, great beds, small bathrooms...but is good for the value. I'd recommend the corner junior suites with a sweeping view of Boston. Make sure you get up to Harvard as its pretty to walk around. Lots of great bars by Fenway Park maybe a 15 minute walk away.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tekelberry
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. We stayed in a junior suite with a great view of Boston and the Charles River. One thing to note is that it appeared that the hotel was in the process of replacing the mattresses during our visit. Our room had new mattresses on the last night of our stay. They are definitely much more "heavenly" than the old ones they had. The only real issue I encoutered was slow - and I mean s-l-o-w - internet access during peak times Also, the location is wonderful. The hotel is directly connected to Copley Place, which is full of many high-end shops. There's a Starbucks on the Lobby level. Copley Place is connected to the Prudential Center, another mall. If you're looking for somewhere to eat, you can get to Legal Sea Foods (2 locations- 1 in Coply, 1 in Prudential), Chili's, Cheesecake Factory, Applebee's, Au Bon Pain, a food court, and the California Pizza Kitchen without walking outside. There are many more within walking distance. Furthermore, there's a Shaw's grocery store within about a block of the hotel. The Boston Duck Tours depart from right in front of Shaw's. The Copley T station is right across the street from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: raincheck10
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 stayed at this hotel for 4 days at the end of August and found it to be great. The positives 1)Great location at the heart of everything 2)Rooms were nice and view was stunning from the high floor we stayed on 3)Excellent dining choices, including the Palm Steakhouse. Also, for an inexpensive breakfast choice an Au Bon Pan is connected to the hotel. 4) Swiming pool and workout room were excellent 5) Staff was helpfull The Negative 1) Parking was $40/day at the hotel. We parked instead across the street at the 100 Claredon garage for $28 All in all a great city hotel where location, location, location is the most important thing. A few extras: Dining - Summer Shack for Seafood and the Palm for Steak Touring - Take the Fenway Park tour and walk Newbury Street Taxis - A taxi is sometimes about the same price as the subway for a short trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kabear
Reviews.Content: The pluses: excellent location. You can go from mall to mall with cross overs and never go outside. That comes in handy with rainy/bad weather. Shaws supermarket is practically across the street. The Prudential Center is a block away and good place to see the entire city from the 50th during the day or 52nd floor at night (we don't recommend the food unless you enjoy uncooked duck in your salad that the waiter doesn't tell you about. Just have drinks). Good neighborhood and seems very safe for walking around. There is a good breakfast place several blocks away, Thornton's Cafe, where you can get excellent eggs and omelettes. Avoid Au Bon Pain for any hot breakfast unless you enjoy cold hard waffles and ttheir food is expensive at $.49/oz. The restaurant in the hotel, 10 Huntington, is a bar and great place in the back for a Sunday brunch. They have great food. Be careful not to go into a food coma from eating too much. The concierge were very helpful and always available. There was never a wait to speak to one of the two on duty. The telephone staff is very helpful and friendly. We fabulous views day and night from the 22nd floor. Ask for a high up floor. The negatives: The rooms have the most uncomfortable chairs. We requested a different desk chair or even another of the same that might be stuffed better, but they could not give us anything but a plain old chair that was not comfortable either. The mattress was too hard and hurt our backs. The cleaning staff did not do a good job. Some days the bathroom was practically overlooked. The tub was not cleaned every day. They did not leave shower wash until the third day. They did not leave a shower cap until the fourth day. Overall, we liked the hotel and the convenience and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cactusaz88
Reviews.Content: Picked the Westin over Sheraton because it was supposed to be newer. However, our room was old and the bed certainly did not feel anything like the heavenily bed I've experienced at other Starwood properties. The guy at the check-in couldn't properly explain how our breakfast package worked so we never got to take advantage of our free breakfast. There was also a convention going on at the same time so the hotel was busy & uncomfortable. I had a package delivered to the hotel & they charged us a fee for it. They also charge for internet use. Don't think I'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Westin - great service, fabulous rooms, great location!”
Reviews.Author: couscous73
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband just returned from a 4 day amazing stay at the WestinCopley place! Being our fist trip to Boston and after reading all the reviews online, we decided to splurge and ended up getting 25% off our stay for staying 4 nights- it was so worth it! The hotel is sistuated on copley square, 2 blocks from Newbury- where there is amazing shopping, sidewalk cafes and access to the T. When we first checked in, they were super friendly. When I asked if we could have a nice view and a king bed, we found ourselves in a top floor corner room with amazing views of the Charles river and the city. The bathroom had dual shower heads and marble, there was a sofa and large screen tv and the bed was their famous Heavenly bed with plush sheets- we could barely wake up in the morning!We were in Boston with some family for a wedding and they promptly called us to say that their hotel , The Colonnade was awful and overrated-- more like a 2 star. I had almost booked the same one from a recommendation because of the rooftop pool--which is highly overrated and closes at 8! So The front desk accomodated them with a good deal and put them in an adjoining suite. The westin has a very hip bar with a mediterranean theme which is hopping in teh evenings--drinks are pricey so beware!Also direct access to the mall that seems to never end and a fantastic spa. I splurged on a facial and have to say it was pricey but the best I've had. I know I sound like a walking ad for this place, but seriously I wouldnt ever stay anywhere else in this city. If you have the cash and want to treat yourself, i really think this is your best bet! A fan from Neptune Beach, FL

Reviews.Title: “Omni is a winner!”
Reviews.Author: Take my word for it...
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Copley in early August. The hotel is a great location if you want to be near great shopping (e.g., Newbury Street, The Prudential Centre and the Copley Plaza). Attractions such as the Aquarium, Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market and the Children's Museum are a subway ride away and the subway is easily accessed from the Westin. We upgraded to a Junior Suite and had plenty of room for the three of us. The room had a great view of the city and river. Make sure to stay above the 10th floor. We stayed on the 20th and it was great. There's an indoor pool and fitness centre. Au Bon Pain, a restaurant, is located just inside the Copley Plaza which is accessed directly from the hotel. This is where to go for breakfast. You can also pick up lunch or a fruit cup or cookies for a snack. It's cheap and delicious and the coffee is good. Legal Seafoods is always a great choice for seafood (reasonably priced and very good). There are several locations in Boston and there's one in the Copley Plaza. The concierge recommended Lucca for italian food in the North End district. It was excellent. We had desserts at Mike's Pastry just down the street from Lucca. It's known for the cannolies and pastries. Lucca is a short walk from Faneuil Hall/Quincy Market. We traveled to Brookine, a suburb, for Chinese food. We ate the Golden Sham Temple. While the restaurant was very nice, the food wasn't great. If you're used to great Chinese food you'll be disappointed. The best shopping deals were found at Saks and on Newbury Street. Also, take a walk across the public garden and walk up Charles Street from Beacon Street. As you're walking through the garden you'll want to exit near the bronze ducks. Any local in the park can tell you where that is. Charles Street is very quaint. There are a few little boutiques that offer very upscale and interesting fashions. Boston is a great city and the Westin is well situated. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Get Your Hopes Up!”
Reviews.Author: SMG1111
Reviews.Content: I booked a stay at the Westin Copley Place for the 4th of July while I was staying there in February. My stay in Feb was great...but not so in July. I called from my hotel room to check on availability in July...I was told there were Riverview rooms available on July 4th at a rate of $289. I had a planned vacation in Cape Cod beginning on the 8th, so decided to go early and see the fireworks. I specifically stated at the time of reservations I wanted a Riverview room to see the fireworks--much like the room I was staying in then. I was not told there would be a problem. I rearranged my plane reservations to arrive on the 4th (instead of the 8th) in time for fireworks --and flew all day from California with my son. When I arrived, I was told that there were no more riverview rooms available! I was shocked. I am a long term SPG member and stay at Starwood properties several times a year. AFter much wrangling, I was told I could be put in a room on the 17th floor and I would be able to see the fireworks. I was not --they were blocked by the building in front of my room. I was told that my reservation "guaranteed me a room" not the type of room I'd reserved. I understand that the 4th is a very busy time in Boston, with a lot of demand for views of the River...but if there was a problem, they should have told me that no rooms with a view were available when I made the reservation....or I would have thought someone would have contacted me if there was a problem since I was an SPG member. I was very upset as was my son. I wrote a detailed letter to the CEO of the Starwood, as well as the General Manager of the Westin the next day....and have yet to receive a response from either (over a month later). Note: I was in the hotel for 3 more days after I left the complaint in the Managers Office. Unfortunately, I will not stay at this property again, and will not choose Starwood first anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Not like other Westin Hotels I've Stayed In”
Reviews.Author: cs35
Reviews.Content: I'm a Starwood Points member and this wasn't like other Westin Hotels. I stayed in February at the Westin in Florence and it was gorgeous. It seemed like there were more amenities when staying at a Westin. The Heavenly Bed wasn't that Heavenly at all. The duvet seemed a little dirty. The mattress was lower and a little too firm. There weren't as many toiletries in bathroom. The carpet in my room seemed a little dirty too. My Heavenly shower didn't work at first but after a call to the front desk it was fixed. The concierge was very rude. When I asked about the July 3rd performance of the Boston Pops at the Hatch the concierge pointed to a brochure which didn't tell me anything. I guess he really wasn't up on things. I read through the brochure and it didn't mention the concert, I was ready to leave Boston. He didn't even try to make a phone call. I was lucky to find someone at Quincy Market that knew about the concert. I thought the concierge at a hotel was supposed to be informed. Don't expect to find a knowing concierge at this hotel. Maybe they should be replaced by computers. If I could have went to a website I'm sure I would have found out everything. The concierge really had an attitude. I also asked about finding a nearby movie theater and another concierge did the same thing. It really put a damper on my view of the Westin Hotels. If you don't want to work with people get a different job. The bell hop seemed none existent. I got out of my car and popped open the truck. I thought someone would have came to get my suitcases by that time but I ended hauling them up myself. The location is excellent for Newbury Street and the nearby malls.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-par Service; Sub-par Hotel”
Reviews.Author: qaz123
Reviews.Content: This hotel could do A LOT of things better. We encountered many problems over the course of our stay: 1) The shower did not drain properly, even after an engineer "fixed the problem." The drain simply could not handle the flow from the second shower head. So much for a heavenly shower. 2) The sound-proofing on the plumbing was abysmal. We could hear ALL the bathroom activities of the occupants above our room, which commenced very early in the morning. So much for a heavenly rest in their heavenly beds. 3) Service at one of the hotel restaurants, Bar 10, was terrible. No one even attempted to seat us and there were food remnants on the seats in the booths and all over the table. Moreover, the furniture looked worn. We ended up leaving, so we can't report on the food. 4) Our room was not made up until 330pm on Saturday. After a full morning and early afternoon sightseeing, we came back to a still dirty room with no clean towels. This is unacceptable. The pool area is quite small, with very limited seating. The gym, however, is spacious and well-equipped. The rooms are relatively large, though plainly outfitted, with no real sense of style and the bathroom was quite small, given the size of the room. All of this would be semi-acceptable at Holiday Inn prices, but this hotel charges a lot of money for their rooms. I got a special rate of $240 a night--the website and other sources had been quoting $329 per night. At those prices, you could stay at the Four Seasons (Weekend Rates), or many of the other hotels in the Back Bay, which I would highly recommend. This a convention hotel, through and through, not a luxury weekend hotel. The only saving grace of this hotel, if there is one, is its location. The hotel is located close to Newbury Street, Back Bay Station, the Public Garden, and so on. That said, there are many other hotels in the Back Bay, and many that are basically in the same location as the Westin. I would recommend searching around and avoiding this hotel, unless you can get a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: PAQ
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum Starwood member, I used 10,000 points to stay one night at this hotel. My first time at this hotel, although I and my wife are originally from Boston. Very good experience overall. Be advised, using valet to park car (no other option) is $40 per night. Be advised there is no Club Level room or free breakfast for Platinum members at this hotel. I was upgraded to a junior suite on the 20th floor with a beautiful view of the Charles River, downtown Boston, and the Boston Harbor. The pool with jacuzzi was adequate and the fitness center was very good. Typical Westin touches - bed, shower, etc. Very quite room. Elevators were excellent. Plenty of restaurants and shopping just outside hotel. It is even attached to an indoor mall. Service at hotel was efficient and friendly. There is a convenient Hertz Rental Car desk at the hotel, so next year we will return our rental car at the hotel, avoid the $40 overnight fee, and just take a taxi t the airport. We plan to stay at this hotel again at the same time next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Westin”
Reviews.Author: masstraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin for 1 night free using our Starwood Points. Had a lovely room on the 34th floor-a little high, but what a view. The bed is just that, heavenly! Shower is excellent, bathrobes and big closet. Service was great, very friendly. Very rainy day, but we made the best of it. had an unbelieveble lunch at Atlantic Fish Co., Michelle (a man) was our bartender and made the lunch wonderful. Abe and Louie's for dinner was very good, too. Pricey and a little noisy and crowded, but filet was to die for. Had drinks at Fairmont Copley-ornate hotel, but just gorgeous. Walked Newbury St and did a little shopping. The Westin was a great location and we would definitely stay again, they also have a great , fun bar.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hip hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Anonymous1000
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Copley Place on Copley Square in Boston over the Memorial Day weekend and loved every minute of our stay. The hotel staff was friendly, helpful and well-informed. The second floor lobby of the hotel was warm, inviting and yet very hip and contemporary. Loved the fireplace and sitting area. Outstanding shops and window shopping opportunities. The enclosed breezeway over the street that connects to the enormous Prudential indoor shopping mall was terrific, too. Brunch at the Turner Fisheries restaurant was wonderful (went there based on the recommendation of the hotel concierge).

Reviews.Title: “Another Chain Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lexma90
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here when my spouse was at a meeting in Boston; it was one of the convention hotels. Upon checkin, we were first given a room that had recently had the carpet cleaned (carpet still wet; furniture on bed). We called immediately, and they moved us (after a 15-min. wait) to another room; somewhat annoying, but not a problem. More annoying was the fact that the person who checked us in told my spouse that we could not cancel our last night's stay (last of 4 nights) - that the policy was that we had to cancel any night's stay 24 hours prior to our initial arrival (FYI, separate item, room price quoted as $256). That may be the policy, and we messed up. He did upgrade us to a riverview room to compensate for our not being able to check out a day early (spouse booked too many days by mistake). Then I called the Westin Reservations number from our hotel room, and made the same request to cancel - the woman on the phone said that yes, we could cancel that last night, which she did, and I had her email the confirmation to my blackberry. She also mentioned our room price was $297, and we had 4 adults; I said no, 2 adults, 2 kids, and we thought the price was $256; she fixed all that as well. The next morning, I checked at the front desk to make sure everything had been fixed. That woman still had us for a 4-night stay, but cancelled that last night with no comment; she had us down as 2 adults, 2 kids, at $236. So in the end, we got a cheaper rate than originally, for a better room, and the number of nights we had planned. And we may have misunderstood the Westin's cancellation policy, and only got what we wanted by getting around the system. But it was still a bureaucratic hassle. I'm not a chain hotel sort of person in general (prefer small family-run hotels), but do stay at chains occasionally. I only recently have heard about Westin's heavenly beds; I didn't notice that they were any different; but maybe that's because the bed was similar to mine at home. The room was decent-sized, and I didn't notice that it was larger than other hotel rooms, though it may have been. There was a coffee maker in our room, which I liked. The lobby area was quite small, and I was surprised there was no breakfast restaurant in the hotel (though we don't generally eat at them anyway). I didn't notice the Starbucks until the last morning. On the plus side, the staff (except for the guy the first day) was pleasant and helpful, and the little runner's maps were great! The location is very good, close to everything in the Back Bay, to the Charles River (for running), and to the T, which we used a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect... and I'm a hotel snob”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm a hotel snob. I like nice modern hotels with all the amenities - and the Westin exceeded my expectations! Our room had an incredible view of the Charles River. The staff was great - check in was quick and easy. They brought a refrigerator for our room so we wouldn't have to empty the mini bar to keep our snacks cold. The bathroom was small but very nice. The location of the hotel is perfect if you're sightseeing. Downtown and the waterfront areas have a lot of construction. Copley Plaza is centralized, upscale, clean and between 2 subway lines. The hotel is attached to the Copley Plaza Mall which has a great breakfast place called Au Bon Pain if you like bagels and bread items. We would walk over each morning and get breakfast to bring back to the room (they have seating too but we liked eating at our window since the view was so good). There's a Starbucks in the lobby as well. The Turner Fisheries restaurant is pricey but good. Overall it was great and I admit - when it comes to hotels I am hard to please!

Reviews.Title: “Typical business class hotel”
Reviews.Author: AdvisorKing
Reviews.Content: I qualified for the Boston Marathon and visited Boston from the Friday before the race (held on Monday) and stayed four nights, leaving Wednesday. The only way to book a hotel during marathon week is through a Boston travel agency that acts as the single booking agent for all major hotels in Boston during the period. I traveled with my family of four, including two children. Our criteria for selecting a hotel were price, proximity to the finish line (easy walking distance for children), and a swimming pool. We selected the Westin Copley, which is within a block of the finish line. The quoted rate was $269 per night, although taxes raised that amount to just over $300. That was about twice what we would normally spend just about anywhere we normally travel on vacation. But we accepted that, during Marathon week, there were few alternatives. The hotel was typical of larger downtown hotels that cater to business clientele, but the staff were friendly and courteous to my whole family. The room was large, with more than enough room for a bed, a pullout couch, a coffee table and an extremely large desk. We had no complaints. We were on the 30th floor and had a very nice view. The swimming pool was smaller than I would have expected, but my children were happy with it. The hotel is conveniently located a block from the â€œTâ€� (subway) station. Although the subway system is old, it was convenient and easy to use. We never felt unsafe, even with smaller children. The hotel is connected by walkway to a series of office towers and shopping malls, although we didnâ€™t figure that out until the last night we were there. I would stay at the Westin Copley again, although I would easily try somewhere else if the price was better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Hotel, and Ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Fool for the Beach
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference 3rd time in 3 years. The hotel is very expensive, but worth it. You are in a very good spot in Boston. You can walk to everything, and take the subway as well. The hotel really nickle and dimes you. Paking was $39 per night, and you have no choice. Bottle of water in the room was $4.95. At these prices, and for the level of hotel, Westin should not be charging $9.95 per/day for internet service. This has become an unfair way to charge guests, when most other places provide access free as a service. As a Gold SPG Member, I am always upgraded here to the Top Floors, where the SPG Rooms are. I was on 33rd floor, and had a fantastic room with a view of the river. The room service was very good, and the eateries in the hotel were all excellent. Turner's Seafood, and The Palm were all great. I will definitly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Could be nice, but it's not great.”
Reviews.Author: DJ
Reviews.Content: Seriously, Boston is a tough city in which to find a reasonably priced, nice hotel. The Westin is only the epitome of this problem. I made a last minute switch from the Hilton to the Westin since I thought I would get an upgrade with my SPG membership. Alas, a $50 higher rate bought me nothing more than an average room, no upgrade, and wallpaper that must date back 15 years or more. The room had a strange temp control and was either hot or cold. The bed could have been a "sweet sleeper", but it seemed like a garden-variety bed. The pool was small and the internet... Well, let's say 45 minutes of clicking here and there and calling the service desk (twice) got me nowhere, so I gave up to tackle it after some meetings. Same problem until the service desk put me through to IT who had to have me reset several settings on my computer. This has never happened at any of the othe Starwood hotels where I've stayed. BUT! Complaining about it got me 5000 points, so chalk 1 up to the SPG program. Compared to othe Westins where I've stayed, see San Diego or DC, this rates more in line with a Sheraton or Marriott. For the prices they charge, you should get complimentary coffe, a foot massage, happy hour drink or three, and free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the points”
Reviews.Author: Afua
Reviews.Content: We had a bit of difficulty actually finding the hotel, as we had not printed a map beforehand. If you haven't driven in Boston, would highly recommend you print off exact directions. We checked into the hotel at around 9 p.m. and had two very attentive front desk clerks at our service. We used points to pay for the room, and got a room on the 35th SPG floor overlooking Back Bay. The view was AMAZING. The room itself was very nice; two heavenly beds, flatscreen TV, small sitting area etc. The room felt spacious compared to other big city hotels (London, Toronto etc.) that I've stayed in. This could have been because we were on an SPG floor. The hotel was very convenient to the subway (archaic green line or orange line). It was also attached to Copley Place and the Prudential Center by interior walkway. You could walk to the subway without going outside, which would be nice on an inclement day. Another perk to Westin (which we did not take advantage of) is the running program they offer. You can sign up to be part of a group and at a specified time, someone from the hotel will lead the group on a run around the hotel area. This is nice if you don't know the area, but prefer running outside. I have also stayed at the Sheraton (located close by) and much prefer the Westin. It is much quieter (the Sheraton lobby can be a zoo), but still very convenient. I don't know if it was worth the $479 advertised rate, but it was definitely worth redeeming my SPG points for -- especially for one night.

Reviews.Title: “great room; lousy reservation staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have stayed there many times, convenient location and face it, I love the bed. However, my reservations have been messed up more often than not. The most recent example was this week when I had reservations for three nights only to be informed when I got there that it was for two nights. After speaking with the manager I was told that there was room available for the third night, for an additional $150. My company won't pick up the tab for a scam job. I was forced to haul my luggage to another hotel in the middle of my business trip. No fun and quite aggravating and irritating.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel Choice”
Reviews.Author: VacationPlanner
Reviews.Content: We initially had a reservation at a hotel in the Financial District but were able to secure a good last minute rate at the Westin. We are so lucky to have done that. The hotel room was spacious, very clean and well appointed, with two comfortable queen beds. Our room was located on the Starwood Preferred Guest floor with a great city view. The room was extremely quiet and relaxing. We found the front desk staff, concierge and housekeeping personnel to be very friendly and helpful. Probably the best thing we noted was the hotels location, just off Copley Plaza and connected via covered walkways to the Convention Center. You could walk several blocks without going out into the cold. The Copley and Back Bay T stops were also just a short walk away for access to the city sights. We all thought this was one of the best hotels on our trip and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “overpriced and overrrated”
Reviews.Author: mountdurand
Reviews.Content: The hotel was huge and rather impersonal in the high price range, heavenly bed was not heavenly just ordinary, heavenly shower just a shower with two heads and a bit grubby looking,in a poky bathroom, water in room was priced $5 a bottle coffee in room price $2 forget the minibar just too dear, internet access $15 a day. Given the room price it would have been lovely to have had free coffee and water!!at least. Room service price for yogurt and tea was $20!!! Many of the other hotels were less expensive and provided the niceties free of charge. I didnt feel special at the Westin and was irritated by the focus on grabbing dollars for no service,I woud not reccommend or stay there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Ho-Hum Westin”
Reviews.Author: Citymominthesuburbs
Reviews.Content: Yawwwnnnnnn...........clean, friendly staff, nice location otherwise completely forgetable (except for the $94.00 charge for two cokes from the mini bar). Rooms perfectly bland, bathrooms perfectly small, all this for $400 a night. Westin "Heavenly Shower" didn't work. Would return only for the very convenient locale (next to Boston Back Bay Amtrak station).

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We picked the Westin because of the ad for large rooms. The room was no larger than an ordinary Holiday Inn or Hampton Inn room. The decor was nothing special and the room was hot, even though it was cold outside. We kept our window open the whole time and tried to turn off the heat, but it was still hot. There was nothing special about the heavenly beds either, in fact the pillows were lumpy. Everything was over priced. $5.00 for a bottle of water, and a glass of the house wine was $12.50. The ad said robes in the room, but we didn't have any. We had friends who stayed at the Marriott and it was cheaper and much, much nicer. I would not stay at the Westin or any Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “Westin is top notch”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Top notch from the time we pulled up to the time we left. The place is awesome through and through. Two things though......1) they will hit you with 40 bucks for the valet. You really have no other choice and don't want to deal with finding a spot. 2) They charged me for the mini bar. I questioned it at checkout and the guy just took it off. Very politely and never asked a question. Probably standard procedure. Who knows. Place is great.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the Most Part”
Reviews.Author: MAGalinNC
Reviews.Content: The Westin was fine for the most part. The only problem we had was that you cannot control the temperature in the room, we had a similar problem with the Westin in Philadelphia. The room was clean, the location is good and they have a great bar.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted, again, with the Westin at Copley Place”
Reviews.Author: laprof
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend at the Westin while visiting with friends. We arrived about 2 hours before the stated check-in time, but were allowed to have our room early. A nice, large, clean room with typical amenities - safe, mini-bar, iron/board, good tv, nice toiletries - and a wonderful, helpful staff. Perfect location for dining and shopping options. Have stayed there before, will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ok overall but flimsy doors!”
Reviews.Author: lrnyn
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in a junior suite room for 2 nights. The front desk person said I'd been "upgraded" based on my gold SWP to a junior suite. Too bad that it was already the room type that I had reserved...some upgrade!! Room was spacious but "heavenly" bathroom was the same size as the closet. Hardly any room to move. Worst thing about the stay was the flimsy pine doors. You could hear every other door being opened and closed throughout the long halls. This was particularly annoying during evening turndown services when you could hear a loud bang every two minutes. You can even hear the phone ring (loudly) from the room next door and the draft under the door is also pretty impressive (no A/C needed). Location is great, connected to two nice malls with plenty of shops and withing 2 blocks of Newbury St. Service was average. The bar was very nice. Didn't have time to check out the fitness facility. Overall a nice conference type hotel. Could definitely use a renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Solid Choice”
Reviews.Author: lalagirl22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Copely Place for two nights of a business trip. The hotel is a solid choice, centrally located, food is good, and there are shops conveniently located off the lobby. The staff was great as well. I will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “nice but pricey for what you get”
Reviews.Author: riley3!
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located with a great staff. The rooms are nicely decorated with great views. I thought it was a little pricey for what you get. Our queen room with nothing special was $300.00 a night. However, within walking distance to all Boston attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Find a better hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: thedew
Reviews.Content: I live in the Boston area and stayed at the Westin for a quick last-minute getaway. We paid $479 for a "Riverview Deluxe" room and I'm so sorry we did. The room was incredibly ordinary. Although the view across rooftops to the Charles was nice, it wasn't worth the money. The shower was good, but the tub didn't drain. The climate control didn't work properly (we were hot) and the bathroom was small -- needing renovation and new grout. The beds were very comfy. The location is excellent -- attached to the shopping centers. The oddly-shaped and dark lobby was always crowded with convention-goers and business people. Overall, this is a business hotel and wildly overpriced. You'd do much better across the street at the Copley Plaza, where for a little less money you get much more style and grandeur. Or, for the same price, choose the Ritz Carlton or Four Seasons, a few blocks away, but much nicer and on the park. My favorite hotel rooms in Boston are the harbor view rooms at the Boston Harbor Hotel (at Rowes Wharf). Those rooms are plush, gorgeous, updated and have amazing views. The hotel is much friendlier and service-oriented. It's just a short walk from there to Quincy Market, Copley or downtown. I would not stay at the Westin again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of this conference style hotel”
Reviews.Content: This hotel caters largely to conference guests and makes no attempt to serve loyal Starwood Gold or Platinuum Members. It took over 45 minutes to check-in, reservation was incorrect, room changes had to occur during our 4 night stay due to overbooking, very little follow-through with guest requests and previous reservations. The room meets your traditional Westin Heavenly Bed standard however the climate control was not working very well....it was either too hot or too cold in the room. The hotel is connected to a very nice shopping complex with amazing stores; in terms of location a definite plus. The staff in general were very nice and kind however the restaurant staf at Hunnington's for breakfast were not very quick with service nor reseptive to our needs. For the cost that you would pay for a room here, it would not cost you much more to stay at the Four Seasons or the Ritz Carlton where you are guarenteed to get the best of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel... Bathroom needs refurbishment... Too pricey”
Reviews.Author: Tiquinho
Reviews.Content: The Westin Copley Place is a good 4*. Good points: - Very well situated, in the heart of Boston - Nice building - Nice & big standard room - TOP NOTCH & FRIENDLY SERVICE, especially at the front desk & the concierge Bad points: - Bathrooms badly need a total refurbishment, and they're very small too - Fitness center is very small, the "swimming-pool" is ridiculously small (it looks more like a jacuzzi than a swimming pool) - Prices are definitely too high, because you pay a 5* rate, but this hotel is a 4*

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: NevadaViper
Reviews.Content: Nice clean rooms and bathrooms. Ample staff. Great views from the uppermost floors. Convenent location. Across the street from the starting point for Ducktours. The latter is a must! Stay away from Turners the in-house seafood restaurant. Service was very slow and spotty. Food was terrible. Manager recognized this and did not charge us for meal. The Palm restaurant is not up to usual Palm standards.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Boston!”
Reviews.Author: nicla
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend in Boston (our first time there) & were very pleased with our choice of The Westin Copley Place Hotel. The room was clean, quiet & the Heavenly Bed and Heavenly Shower will most likely make us repeat Westin guests! We were able to take the 'T' (public transportation/train) from the airport, so we didn't need to set foot in a cab during our entire trip. Take the free shuttle from the airport terminal to the 'T.' All you need is $1.25 per person- take the Blue Line to the Government Center where you can transfer (for free) to the Green Line & get off at the Copley stop, then walk 2 short blocks to the Westin. Checking in & out was easy and the staff was very courteous. The hotel connects to the Prudential Center/mall, so we chose Au Bon Pain for our breakfasts (a decent deal compared to the room service prices). Within walking distance of the hotel is the upscale shopping and dining on Newberry Street and the Boston Public Garden (swan boats).

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday trip!”
Reviews.Author: fitzhoyt
Reviews.Content: I and another niece took my niece to Boston for her 40th birthday. We stayed at the Westin and had a great time. They first upgraded our room to 2 queen beds due to my niece's birthday and the best of all was the concierge named Austin. They were all great but Austin was the best. We had a great dinner at the Palm Steakhouse and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The whole trip was wonderful and one of the concierge who got us tickets for a "Duck Tour" even though they were sold out really helped to make our trip complete because my two nieces had never been to Boston and this is a great way to see the city. Thanks to everyone there.

Reviews.Title: “Austin from Boston!”
Reviews.Author: sharper865
Reviews.Content: Simply Fabulous! I just returned from a 4-night stay at this Westin hotel. We were in town to celebrate my 40th birthday. Austin-the concierge got wind of it being my birthday and took the greatest care of us. First our room was upgraded to a better view, then we came home one night to find chocolate covered strawberries & champagne in our room complements of Austin. Every concierge we came in contact with went the extra mile to make our stay comfortable & enjoyable. One of the main sites we wanted to experience was the famous duck tours which by the way was just steps from our front door. The day we went the line was a mile long to buy tickets & we were told the next day was sold out & that we probably wouldn't get tickets. We went back to the hotel, spoke with the conierge on duty & within minutes we had duck tour tickets in hand. I left very impressed with Westin Hotels & will DEFINITELY look them up in every city I travel to. Thank you Austin from Boston & Westin Hotels for making my birthday so memorable!

Reviews.Title: “O.K., But Not Great.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a weekend at the Westin Copley Place. I was not especially impressed. The room had a great city view, but otherwise could have been a room in any average hotel. The thing that bothered me the most was that the tile around the tub was very moldy and disgusting. It needed to be regrouted. The dresser drawer space was not adequate for 4 of us. The bedding looked a bit shabby as well. On the positive side, the location was terrific and the price was right. I would not stay there again. I expected more from a Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Not Heavenly.”
Reviews.Author: Shopbarefootbooks
Reviews.Content: We had a few problems with this hotel...The biggest issue in my mind was that the Westin Copley Place did not have the Westin's signature Heavenly Bed! As regular Westin customers, we were highly disappointed. It wasn't uncomfortable, but a far cry from the plush bed and linens that we are accustomed to. The Bed is why we pay a little extra to stay at The Westin in the first place. Secondly, we had some service problems. We arrived at 3:30pm after a long day of travel, hoping to nap the baby (9 mos) for at least an hour before heading out to a scheduled event at 6pm. At the check in desk, I emphasized that we needed a crib in the room ASAP; in fact, I mentioned it 3 times. In spite of a couple additional phone calls, the crib never came. I made one final call as we left and it was finally there upon our return to the room at 8pm. They make a big deal out of having the "Heavenly Crib" and they gave our kids nice "Westin Kids' Club" ball caps, yet they failed to truely recognize the most important needs of their smallest guests when it mattered the most. Finally, the battery on our door lock was dead, so the keys kept failing. After several frustrating trips down to the front desk to gain reentry into our room, they finally sent someone up to check the lock... I don't know... it didn't occur to me at the time that that would be the problem, but now it seems so obvious. And don't they have hundreds of these locks? Shouldn't that have been their first (or at least second) troubleshooting action? Otherwise, the room was nice and our stay reasonably comfortable. The bathroom had a granite counter but ordinary tile shower. The workout room was fine, but pool too small for anything useful (my 4 yr old son found it boring and I couldn't swim laps). The location is great: all the shops and restaurants you need in the ajoining malls, Shaw's grocery, two minute walk to the famous Boston Duck Tours, T stations very close. No need for a car. We had a Jr. Suite for $249 - a huge room, although the space was not devided. We requested an upper floor and got a gorgeous harbor view. On the 3rd of July, we could see about a dozen fireworks displays (of surrounding communities) from our window (didn't stay the nt of the 4th). As bad as I make the stay out to be, it was a reasonable value (room size, location). I can overlook the crib and key problems because "stuff happens" and employees are human, but the non-Heavenly Bed really bugged me. Being Starwood Prefered Members, I guess we would consider staying here again, but wouldn't be thrilled to. I might try for a more interesting botique hotel since this wasn't such a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Beds”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We paid $399 for two queen beds for a three night holiday week-end stay and found the week-end to be pleasant. The beds were comfortable, the shower hot and steamy. The rooms were clean - -I am very persnikity about that. Never heard noise from other guests. The work-out facility was superior, though the pool was small. Concierge could have been more helpful. He recommended walking to town and did not give us any advice about the T or about the trolley tours that depart from the nearby Marriott. Walking wasn't very practical for the distances we needed to cover with a 4 year old. The hotel connects with indoor concourses with an indoor shopping plaza and the Marriott and many restuarants. We found Au Bon Pain convenient for breakfasts and enjoyed Legal Seafoods and Cheesecake Factory for dinners. All three are less than 10 minutes from the Westin. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Copley is a Keeper”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Westen Copley Place. We had a fantastic stay. We booked a room with two double beds. We arrived late and the rooms with double beds were not available. They upgraded us to a Jr. Suite with a king size bed and a pull out sofa. The room was very spacious and nicely decorated with modern decor. We had 2 full walls of windows that gave us a gorgeous view of the Boston Harbor. The Westin connects to the Prudential Center and Boston Back Bay Train/Subway Station through walkways and a beautiful mall. Having the Backbay T station within a 4 minute walk is a real money saver (only took 3 cabs during our visit). The T system is easy to understand and is only $1.25 per ride. We did not eat at the hotel but the restaurants and lounge areas were always hopping. The hotel also offers Hertz Rental car service. We arrived back at our hotel after the Hertz closed and had to pay for over night parking, but we knew this because we did our homework before we came to Boston. The Westin Copley is a keeper.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, but had a few blips”
Reviews.Author: BigDTraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for 4 nights, and was very pleased by the size, layout, and especially the view of the room. It was extremely convenient to everything - walked indoors to the conference in the Marriott next door, easy walk to Newbury for shopping and eating, and right next to the T. My only concerns: the blow-dryer did not work - which was fine since I brought my own; the plugs in the desk did not work - I didn't have my laptop so I charged my phone next to the bed; and the shower didn't drain well. Since I was so busy, I didn't call immediately on these small inconveniences, but when I finally did contact the concierge, they were extremely apologetic and fixed the issues that day. Just FYI - even though the Westin is close to the airport, with all the fees and tolls, the cab fare was $37, however going to the airport from the Westin was only $19.

Reviews.Title: “Welcomed stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: corguz14
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Boston June 11 early at around noon and expected the hotel to not have our room ready. We were in Boston for a very large convention and the hotel was sold out. Honestly I would have thought the hotel was 50% full. It never seemed crowded and was pleasantly quiet for a downtown hotel. Anyways check in at the hotel three hours early and surprised to find our room was ready. Gave the lady a flash of my Starwood Preferred Card and was quickly upgraded to the SPG floor (33rd) and upgraded to a river view room....what a deal. Paid 249 for the room but the room i was upgraded to went for 419 on the website. Staff multi-lingual (good) and not overly friendly (bad). Room was very nice. Amazing view and the best beds you will find in a hotel chain. The rooms have a nice size flat screen television and contemporary furniture including three chairs and a desk. My only complaint is the bathroom is very small and cramped. Shower is nice as well as the marble counter tops, but the bathroom had a holiday inn feel while the room had a ritz carlton feel. Bathrooms need a bit of an upgrade. Carpet, paint, and walls were all in good shape. High Speed internet is not included (10.45 a day), and the valet parking is absolutely ridiculous. Do not rent a car unless you have to. The public transportation in Boston is the nation's best. Also the location of the Westin is soo convenient to everything. Walking is definitely in the picture to shops. Cabs and Subway feel safe and are very cheap. Restaurants at the hotel were very good (Turner Fisheries and Legal Seafoods in mall). The bar was the happening place for guests and was a fun place to relax. Overall the hotel was a nice experience and I will definitely stay there for any Boston experience.

Reviews.Title: “Too Short a Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night at the Westin in late May and wished I'd stayed longer. Although others have complained about the check in procedure and the room condition, I found the Westin to be superb from start to finish. The front desk was efficient and quick, the room was huge and well-appointed, the fitness area was well equipped and it had a pool too. Also, room service was timely and the food was excellent. Finally, at every stage of a very short stay, the staff was helpful and charming. I can't wait to go back and stay longer!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Greatest Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: chriswin
Reviews.Content: When I entered the lobby I thought I was in for a great experience. Not so. The clerk at the front desk rushed me through my check in - when I went back later to ask some questions I was again rushed. My package included breakfast for two - I asked the clerk if since I was just one person could I have room service breakfast instead - she said no and suggested I bring a friend (I'm on vacation in a City where I don't know anyone, but I guess I could have grabbed someone off the street!) I also didn't have a robe in my room - the clerk said not every room has robes, although the hotel's web site doesn't indicate that. They did finally send me a robe but they seemed bothered by my request. One of the shower heads did not work at first - they did finally fix it. The food for the breakfast buffet was boring. The one plus for me was the martinis in the hotel bar - try the cucumber one! Not a 4-star experience for me and I would not likely stay there again unless I got an exceptional deal.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel for a short stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Westin Copley Place Hotel in February 2005. I was given a very big room with nice furniture and oversized TV screen. The hotel is conveniently connected to the very big shopping center and (nice when it is snowing outside). The hotel is not at the city center but the underground station is just around the corner and you can reach the hart of the city in a few minutes. However, there were several downsides: (1) the hotel bathrooms could use some renovation, (2) the carpets in the halls are realy old and a bit dirty which is unusual because the rooms are OK, (3) the hotel doesn't have a restaurant. Therefore, do not order breakfast as room service (too expensive), go to Au Boin Pain which is about 1 min. waking in the shooping center and have your breakfast there. One unusual thing was that the hotel did not have an adapter (I am from Europe) so I had to go all the way to the town and buy one in order to be able to use my mobile phone- I do think that any Westin in the world should have an adapter. The best part of this hotel is the staff- polite and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Property, Inconsistent Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Westin Copley more than 100 nights over the past two years, and it is one of my favorite hotels in the Northeast. The rooms are all spacious, comfortably furnished, and clean. The service can be inconsistent, especially with regards to special requests, but most of the employees are nice and courteous and try to help whenever possible.

Reviews.Title: “A Fabulous Escape!!!”
Reviews.Author: Longmeadow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I managed to get away last weekend (without the little ones!) and completely enjoyed the Westin Copley. Despite the rain, there was lots to do. The gym is really something to write home about - huge for a hotel gym and filled with the latest equipment - inspiring us to work out twice! The pool and hot tub were wonderful as well. The room was nicely decorated and clean. The service was efficient and friendly. We enjoyed a light dinner and wine at Bar 10 but wished I got a chance to sample their Mochatini (it looked like a dessert in and of itself.) Agree with a previous review to take in breakfast at Au Bon Pain choices (in the adjacent, attached building) which had and excellent buffet. The hotel's location is a shoppers paradise with every high end shop just steps across the indoor bridge and Filenes Basement and Marshalls a short walk away. We are looking forward to our next escape to the Westin!
